2017-07-01.abstract: Scott Pruitt told coal industry executives that he would conduct a “red team-blue team” research exercise on climate change.
2017-07-01.snippet: Scott Pruitt told coal industry executives that he would conduct a “red team-blue team” research exercise on climate change.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, plans to convene a team of researchers to test the scientific premise of human-caused climate change, he told coal industry executives on Thursday.
2017-07-01.headline_main: E.P.A. to Give Dissenters a Voice on Climate, No Matter the Consensus

2017-07-01.abstract: Like baseball itself, the Society for American Baseball Research is having trouble gaining a foothold with the 18-to-30 crowd.
2017-07-01.snippet: Like baseball itself, the Society for American Baseball Research is having trouble gaining a foothold with the 18-to-30 crowd.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t quite 8 a.m., but a group of official scorers, baseball analysts and fans were settled into a small meeting room on Thursday at the Grand Hyatt in Manhattan to debate the real reason the Boston Red Sox blew Game 6 of the 1986 World Series to the Mets.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Baseball’s Analytics Society Sees a Problem: Avg. Age, Members

2017-07-01.abstract: My dad was a proud World War II Marine. I followed his footsteps in Vietnam.
2017-07-01.snippet: My dad was a proud World War II Marine. I followed his footsteps in Vietnam.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: My father enlisted in the Marine Corps as soon as he graduated from Harvard in 1942, a few months after Pearl Harbor. He led a platoon in the first assault wave on the South Pacific island of Bougainville in 1943.
2017-07-01.headline_main: My Father’s War, and Mine

2017-07-01.abstract: A commission, searching for proof of fraud, requested personal data on 200 million voters. “Go jump in the Gulf of Mexico,” one state official responded.
2017-07-01.snippet: A commission, searching for proof of fraud, requested personal data on 200 million voters. “Go jump in the Gulf of Mexico,” one state official responded.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: A White House commission’s sweeping request for the personal and public data of the nation’s 200 million voters set off an avalanche of opposition by state leaders in both parties on Friday, as officials from California to Mississippi called the move an overreach and more than 20 states declared they would not comply.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Asked for Voters’ Data, States Give Trump Panel a Bipartisan ‘No’

2017-07-01.abstract: Drawing a parallel between a Yankees outfielder and Moonlight Graham, who provided an inspiration for the novel on which the movie “Field of Dreams” was based.
2017-07-01.snippet: Drawing a parallel between a Yankees outfielder and Moonlight Graham, who provided an inspiration for the novel on which the movie “Field of Dreams” was based.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Baseball lore is rife with bizarre coincidences. But the juxtaposition 112 years apart between the Yankees’ rookie outfielder Dustin Fowler and Archibald Wright Graham, better known as Moonlight Graham, is as astounding as it is unfortunate.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Dustin Fowler’s Injury Evokes Another Brief Call-Up, 112 Years Later

2017-07-01.abstract: There are many insights to be drawn from the latest media maelstrom involving President Trump, including that a presidency born of television still lives there.
2017-07-01.snippet: There are many insights to be drawn from the latest media maelstrom involving President Trump, including that a presidency born of television still lives there.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: There are a lot of insights to be drawn from the latest media maelstrom involving President Trump: about his sensitivity to criticism, his impulsivity, the way he talks about women and the ease with which he can still hurl the basest of insults.
2017-07-01.headline_main: ‘Morning Joe’ Row Is Fresh Sign of TV’s Iron Grip on Trump

2017-07-01.abstract: After intense pressure by members of Congress and retired diplomats, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson reversed his decision to delay hiring fellowship recipients.
2017-07-01.snippet: After intense pressure by members of Congress and retired diplomats, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson reversed his decision to delay hiring fellowship recipients.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The State Department is now quietly allowing dozens of young women and minority students to become full-fledged diplomats after threatening to rescind job offers that most of the students were given two years ago upon winning prestigious scholarships.

2017-07-01.abstract: The president pressed South Korea on trade and made moves that angered China, posing a test of whether he can keep campaign promises while also cooperating on security.
2017-07-01.snippet: The president pressed South Korea on trade and made moves that angered China, posing a test of whether he can keep campaign promises while also cooperating on security.

Mueller III, the special counsel overseeing the investigation into Russia’s meddling in the 2016 presidential election.

2017-07-01.abstract: I’m grateful that a catcall hasn’t led to violence like it has for so many other trans women of color.

2017-07-01.abstract: After Dustin Fowler’s season-ending knee injury and 12 losses in the past 16 games, the Yankees now have a three-game road series against powerful Houston.

2017-07-01.abstract: The charges against him followed years of criticism that he had overlooked — or covered up — the widespread abuse of children by clergymen in Australia.

2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY — When more than a dozen sexual abuse victims from Cardinal George Pell’s hometown in Australia, Ballarat, flew to Rome to meet with him last year, they carried crushing stories of pain caused by local priests, and varied demands for Vatican action.
2017-07-01.headline_main: How Cardinal Pell Rose to Power, Trailed by a Cloud of Scandal

2017-07-01.abstract: When politicians see a big structure, they can’t seem to resist naming it for one of their own. Up next: the Mario Cuomo Bridge.

2017-07-01.abstract: The immediate care given to many of those wounded at the Bronx hospital shooting could be the most critical factor in whether they survive.
2017-07-01.snippet: The immediate care given to many of those wounded at the Bronx hospital shooting could be the most critical factor in whether they survive.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: As fire alarms blared and smoke billowed from the 16th floor of Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center where a gunman had set himself ablaze after shooting seven people on Friday, hospital workers rushed the injured to the emergency room and got to work.
2017-07-01.headline_main: As a Doctor Tried to Take Lives, Others Rushed to Save Them

2017-07-01.abstract: Bryan was originally known for making homemade trick-shot videos with his brother. But after a blistering 16-month run, he won the RBC Heritage in April.
2017-07-01.snippet: Bryan was originally known for making homemade trick-shot videos with his brother. But after a blistering 16-month run, he won the RBC Heritage in April.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: CROMWELL, Conn. — In the moment that Wesley Bryan realized his lead was insurmountable and he would become the first South Carolina native to win the RBC Heritage, he was seated in the CBS broadcast booth. Sitting with Jim Nantz and Nick Faldo in April, Bryan delivered the type of soul-bearing interview rarely seen, recounting his emotions as he stood on the 17th tee and realized he had the lead.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Wesley Bryan’s Greatest Trick Shot Was Rapid Rise to PGA Win

2017-07-01.abstract: Airlines are rushing to work with airports to comply with Department of Homeland Security directives on screening passengers on flights to the U.S.
2017-07-01.snippet: Airlines are rushing to work with airports to comply with Department of Homeland Security directives on screening passengers on flights to the U.S.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: New directives from the Department of Homeland Security require airlines that fly to the United States to step up screening of passengers for trace amounts of explosives and, in some cases, impose more stringent security checks.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Airlines Face New Security Rules in Summer Scramble

2017-07-01.abstract: A doctor opened fire on his former colleagues at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center, killing one person and injuring six others before committing suicide.

2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: A doctor armed with a rifle rampaged through Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center on Friday afternoon, killing another doctor and wounding six other people, five of them seriously. The gunman then set himself on fire and shot himself in the head.

2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: It costs as little as $10 and as much as $10,169 to get the same blood test in California. A lower-back M.R.I. priced at $199 at one Florida clinic goes for $6,221 in San Francisco. A shoulder X-ray can run anywhere between $21 and more than $700 across the United States.

Swimming was about to end and there did not seem to be much Elizabeth Beisel could do about it as she switched from the breaststroke to the freestyle in the women’s 400-meter individual medley final at the national championships.

The fractions they won’t be able to multiply. The state capitals they won’t be able to identify. “Learning loss” is the name for it.

2017-07-01.snippet: The extra time allotted by Defense Secretary Jim Mattis will allow military leaders to assess the impact of adding the recruits, a Pentagon spokeswoman said.

2017-07-01.abstract: Amid mounting injuries and losses, the Yankees displayed a potent offense. Brett Gardner hit a grand slam, and seven starters recorded at least one hit.
2017-07-01.snippet: Amid mounting injuries and losses, the Yankees displayed a potent offense. Brett Gardner hit a grand slam, and seven starters recorded at least one hit.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — One swing of the bat did not wipe away all the frustration of the last few weeks for the Yankees — the raft of injuries, the mounting losses — but watching Brett Gardner crossing home plate on Friday suggested otherwise.

2017-07-01.abstract: Celebrating the country's 150th birthday? Here are five stories to get you thinking about taking a trip there.
2017-07-01.snippet: Celebrating the country's 150th birthday? Here are five stories to get you thinking about taking a trip there.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: We chose the country of Canada as the top place to go this year, partly inspired by international interest in a country that seems devoid of wrenching rifts and partly because of the yearlong celebrations that have been cooked up for the sesquicentennial. Because it’s such a vast country, we decided to run a few additional pieces to invite readers to explore America’s northern neighbor. Here are five stories meant to inspire journeys to Canada.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Traveling Canada

2017-07-01.abstract: Jeff Nichols’s account of a landmark civil rights case, starring an Oscar-nominated Ruth Negga, comes to HBO. And Peter Capaldi ends his run as the Time Lord.

2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: “Loving,” about a landmark civil rights case involving interracial marriage and starring an Oscar-nominated Ruth Negga, comes to HBO. And Peter Capaldi ends his run as Doctor Who — at least until Christmas.
2017-07-01.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘Loving’ and ‘Doctor Who’

2017-07-01.abstract: The Chinese president warned against challenging Beijing’s rule, a jarring contrast with protests later in the day.
2017-07-01.snippet: The Chinese president warned against challenging Beijing’s rule, a jarring contrast with protests later in the day.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — President Xi Jinping of China delivered a tough speech Saturday at the end of a three-day visit to the semiautonomous Chinese city of Hong Kong, warning against politicizing disputes or challenging the authority of the central government. But he didn’t stick around for the reaction, as thousands of people took to the streets in an annual protest calling for greater democracy.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Xi Delivers Tough Speech on Hong Kong, as Protests Mark Handover Anniversary

2017-07-01.abstract: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers debate a hot dog taste test, President Trump’s tweets and the 20th anniversary of Harry Potter.
2017-07-01.snippet: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers debate a hot dog taste test, President Trump’s tweets and the 20th anniversary of Harry Potter.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.
2017-07-01.headline_main: ‘That First Crisp Bite Can Make or Break the Hot Dog Experience’

2017-07-01.abstract: Bouton, who exposed baseball shenanigans in “Ball Four,” has a malady linked to dementia; five years ago, a stroke essentially wiped out his language skills.
2017-07-01.snippet: Bouton, who exposed baseball shenanigans in “Ball Four,” has a malady linked to dementia; five years ago, a stroke essentially wiped out his language skills.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass. — The old knuckleballer grips his favorite pitch with three fingernails. Most pitchers use two, but for him that makes the pitch wobbly, impossible to control. Jim Bouton, 78, uses his ring finger, too. This is the grip he showed Johnny Carson four decades ago on the set of “The Tonight Show,” and the grip he displayed for a recent visitor in his backyard, high up in the Berkshires.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Jim Bouton, Author and Former Pitcher, Struggles With Brain Disease

2017-07-01.abstract: Once courted, then spurned, the smaller rival sought revenge for years. Now Europe’s regulators give it reason to cheer.
2017-07-01.snippet: Once courted, then spurned, the smaller rival sought revenge for years. Now Europe’s regulators give it reason to cheer.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Jeremy Stoppelman, chief executive of Yelp, the local search and reviewing site, would like this article to be focused on his company’s growth, or on how its reviews help independent businesses, or on pretty much anything besides what it is about: how Yelp became Google’s most tenacious pest.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Inside Yelp’s Six-Year Grudge Against Google

2017-07-01.abstract: Kate and Laura Mulleavy, the sisters behind the offbeat Americans fashion brand, talk Paris, industry pressure and strawberry ice cream.
2017-07-01.snippet: Kate and Laura Mulleavy, the sisters behind the offbeat Americans fashion brand, talk Paris, industry pressure and strawberry ice cream.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Last week, just days before their Paris debut on Sunday and moments after the end of a wild thunderstorm, the American designers Kate and Laura Mulleavy stood together in a dilapidated hospital courtyard on the Left Bank. Droplets of water sparkled on rusted pipes and flaking windowsills. The sky was gray, and overgrown grass pathways and thorny pink rosebushes smelled damp from the deluge of rain. The forecast in the days ahead? More of the same.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Rodarte’s Founders on Being the Newest Americans in Paris

2017-07-01.abstract: Eva, an egg-shape vibrator for couples, taps into a pro-feminist market.
2017-07-01.snippet: Eva, an egg-shape vibrator for couples, taps into a pro-feminist market.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: As a product designer, Janet Lieberman often finds flaws in everyday tech devices. This was particularly true when it came to vibrators, which she would spend hours shopping for on Amazon.
2017-07-01.headline_main: A Wearable Vibrator for Couples

2017-07-01.abstract: “Vegas is one of those places that is always changing and always staying the same,” said the photographer Ryan Shorosky, who has been documenting its people for several years.
2017-07-01.snippet: “Vegas is one of those places that is always changing and always staying the same,” said the photographer Ryan Shorosky, who has been documenting its people for several years.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: When Ryan Shorosky graduated from the School of Visual Arts in New York in 2014, he decided to drive an 18-wheeler around the country for a year, photographing truck drivers along the way.  That was when he first went to Las Vegas.  He returned there once a month over the course of that year.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Classic Americana in Las Vegas

2017-07-01.abstract: He grew up watching Michael Jackson videos in Athens, Tex. Now J. Quinton Johnson is rapping in Broadway’s hottest production, asked to audition before he’d seen it.
2017-07-01.snippet: He grew up watching Michael Jackson videos in Athens, Tex. Now J. Quinton Johnson is rapping in Broadway’s hottest production, asked to audition before he’d seen it.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: At the Richard Rodgers Theater on a rainy and humid Saturday in June, J. Quinton Johnson, 22, crossed from stage left to right, lugging the heavy overcoat worn by the character he plays in the first act of “Hamilton,” a tailor named Hercules Mulligan who spies on the British for the benefit of the revolution.
2017-07-01.headline_main: How a ‘Hamilton’ Super Fan Got Cast in the Broadway Show

2017-07-01.abstract: The stores love her. Many critics don’t. But Maria Grazia Chiuri, the first woman to lead Christian Dior, isn’t worried.
2017-07-01.snippet: The stores love her. Many critics don’t. But Maria Grazia Chiuri, the first woman to lead Christian Dior, isn’t worried.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Maria Grazia Chiuri, the first woman to lead Christian Dior, has been in her new position for less than a year. Her appointment to Dior, in July 2016, was greeted with fanfare, both for her celebrated tenure at Valentino, and for the overdue gratification of having a woman leading one of the world’s most storied fashion labels.

2017-07-01.abstract: Francis declined to renew Cardinal Gerhard Ludwig Müller’s mandate to lead the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith.
2017-07-01.snippet: Francis declined to renew Cardinal Gerhard Ludwig Müller’s mandate to lead the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: ROME — Pope Francis earlier this year ordered Cardinal Gerhard Ludwig Müller, the top doctrinal watchdog in the Roman Catholic Church, to fire three priests from the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith, which is the keeper of the church’s orthodoxy and presides over investigations into sexual abuse.

2017-07-01.abstract: Two Times reporters discuss the Jay-Z album debut on Tidal, and the bad behavior that runs rampant in the venture capital industry.
2017-07-01.snippet: Two Times reporters discuss the Jay-Z album debut on Tidal, and the bad behavior that runs rampant in the venture capital industry.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Farhad is off this week, so Kevin Roose, a Times business columnist, filled in.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Mike’s and Kevin’s Week in Tech: Streaming Music and Harassment in Venture Capital

2017-07-01.abstract: The Trump administration blames China for the decline of aluminum production in the U.S. But where has it really gone?
2017-07-01.snippet: The Trump administration blames China for the decline of aluminum production in the U.S. But where has it really gone?
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: REYDARFJORDUR, Iceland — Where did the United States’ aluminum smelters go?
2017-07-01.headline_main: American Companies Still Make Aluminum. In Iceland.

2017-07-01.abstract: The civilians were killed during an Indian counterinsurgency operation that also killed two militants, the police said.
2017-07-01.snippet: The civilians were killed during an Indian counterinsurgency operation that also killed two militants, the police said.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: DIALGAM, Kashmir — Security forces in the Indian-controlled portion of Kashmir killed two militants on Saturday, including a top commander, in a gun battle that also left two civilians dead.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Clashes in Kashmir Leave 2 Civilians and 2 Militants Dead, Police Say

2017-07-01.abstract: If an apartment has more shares than another similar one — making its maintenance payment higher — is it possible to adjust the allocation of shares?
2017-07-01.snippet: If an apartment has more shares than another similar one — making its maintenance payment higher — is it possible to adjust the allocation of shares?
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Q. In 1981, my mother bought an apartment in a Manhattan co-op. After her death, I discovered that the maintenance was high for a one-bedroom apartment and my real estate agent agreed. Upon further investigation, I learned that an apartment on the same floor and of the same size had a maintenance that was $798 less per month than my mother’s apartment. It appears that at the time the building went co-op in the 1970s, the allocation of shares given to her apartment was not correct. What is my recourse?
2017-07-01.headline_main: How a Co-op Divvies Up Its Shares

2017-07-01.abstract: She was the one with all the bridal items in her apartment, but he was in more of a hurry to get married.
2017-07-01.snippet: She was the one with all the bridal items in her apartment, but he was in more of a hurry to get married.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Brittany Haas and Benjamin Stephen Finkle are to be married July 2 at the Inn at Erlowest in Lake George, N.Y. Cantor Shira Ginsburg is to officiate.
2017-07-01.headline_main: She Already Had a Bridal Veil, but Was in No Rush to Wed

2017-07-01.abstract: The couple met in grade school and became a couple in the eighth grade.
2017-07-01.snippet: The couple met in grade school and became a couple in the eighth grade.

2017-07-01.abstract: The couple met in law school in California, then again six years later on the East Coast when Mr. Barge was on his second stint in law school.
2017-07-01.snippet: The couple met in law school in California, then again six years later on the East Coast when Mr. Barge was on his second stint in law school.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Matthew Donald Barge and Thomas Preston Bottomy were married June 26 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member of the New York City Clerk’s office, officiated. On July 6, the couple will exchange vows and rings at a ceremony in Pont de Molins, Spain, that will be led by Andreas Sotiropoulos, a friend of the couple.
2017-07-01.headline_main: A Law School Dropout Drops Back In

2017-07-01.abstract: The producer No I.D. discusses his work shaping the rapper’s entire new album.
2017-07-01.snippet: The producer No I.D. discusses his work shaping the rapper’s entire new album.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Jay-Z knew it was time to reveal another side of himself. He just needed a palette.
2017-07-01.headline_main: The Man Behind the Music for Jay-Z’s Intimate ‘4:44’

2017-07-01.abstract: Benjamin Netanyahu has said that the Western Wall should be a “source of unity.” So why am I arrested for praying there?
2017-07-01.snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu has said that the Western Wall should be a “source of unity.” So why am I arrested for praying there?
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — In 2012 I was arrested for the first time. I was 54 years old — a mother, an executive and a leader of my community. My crime? Praying while wearing a tallit, a Jewish prayer shawl, at the Western Wall. My father, an immigrant to Israel of German descent, never got a parking ticket. He would have rolled in his grave if he knew his daughter was being cuffed and fingerprinted by the Israeli police.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Jewish Women vs. the Jewish State

2017-07-01.abstract: Suzanne Hodgkinson, whose husband opened fire at a baseball practice, joins others who face a wrenching challenge after a relative commits a mass shooting: mourning someone reviled by many.
2017-07-01.snippet: Suzanne Hodgkinson, whose husband opened fire at a baseball practice, joins others who face a wrenching challenge after a relative commits a mass shooting: mourning someone reviled by many.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: BELLEVILLE, Ill. — He flung dishes at his wife, roared at the television, erupted during an outing at a local brewery. Suzanne Hodgkinson became so concerned with her husband’s growing anger that she wrote to his doctor asking for help.
2017-07-01.headline_main: ‘I Want This to Get Over’: After Congressional Shooting, Complex Grief for a Gunman’s Widow

2017-07-01.abstract: Kvitova, coming off a victory last Sunday, is a 5-1 favorite to win a third singles crown even as she is still recovering from a knife attack.
2017-07-01.snippet: Kvitova, coming off a victory last Sunday, is a 5-1 favorite to win a third singles crown even as she is still recovering from a knife attack.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: LONDON — After just two tournaments back on tour after a knife attack that damaged her primary playing hand, Petra Kvitova has completed an improbable transition from sentimental favorite to oddsmakers’ choice.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Petra Kvitova Keeps Her Wimbledon Expectations Low. Oddsmakers Disagree.

2017-07-01.abstract: Players representing the United States in the match with Ghana and in this summer’s Concacaf Gold Cup know a good showing could increase their chances of being on the World Cup roster.
2017-07-01.snippet: Players representing the United States in the match with Ghana and in this summer’s Concacaf Gold Cup know a good showing could increase their chances of being on the World Cup roster.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: EAST HARTFORD, Conn. — More than a month ago, U.S. Soccer quietly confirmed its hotel and training base for next summer’s World Cup in Russia. The federation has also sent officials to investigate bus companies, travel routes and restaurants, and a separate group scouted possible day trips for friends and family who will follow the team to Russia.
2017-07-01.headline_main: United States Beats Ghana in a Friendly, as World Cup Auditions Begin

2017-07-01.abstract: President Trump started a holiday weekend with another denunciation of the news media, first in morning tweets, followed by a speech at a veterans celebration.
2017-07-01.snippet: President Trump started a holiday weekend with another denunciation of the news media, first in morning tweets, followed by a speech at a veterans celebration.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump used the first part of his holiday weekend getaway to issue more denunciations of the news media, using a celebration of American veterans and freedom at an evening rally to thunder that he would not allow the “fake” media to stop his agenda.
2017-07-01.headline_main: ‘I’m President and They’re Not’: Trump Attacks Media at Faith Rally

2017-07-01.abstract: Undocumented immigrants suspected of paying to bring their children to the country now face arrest, a tactic to discourage smuggling that also separates families.
2017-07-01.snippet: Undocumented immigrants suspected of paying to bring their children to the country now face arrest, a tactic to discourage smuggling that also separates families.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration has begun a new tactic to crack down on illegal immigration, this time arresting undocumented parents suspected of having paid to have their children ushered into the country by smugglers.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Trump Administration Targets Parents in New Immigration Crackdown

2017-07-01.abstract: Mohamed Fahmy, who was working for the Qatari-owned Al Jazeera when the Egyptian authorities jailed him in 2013, has become a pawn in an intra-gulf rivalry.
2017-07-01.snippet: Mohamed Fahmy, who was working for the Qatari-owned Al Jazeera when the Egyptian authorities jailed him in 2013, has become a pawn in an intra-gulf rivalry.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The journalist Mohamed Fahmy had been working in Cairo for Al Jazeera when the Egyptian authorities threw him in prison for more than a year, accusing him of stirring up unrest as an agent of the channel’s owner, the Qatari government.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Journalist Joins His Jailer’s Side in a Bizarre Persian Gulf Feud

2017-07-01.abstract: In a rapidly aging Japan, crematories cannot keep up with demand, so businesses are combining hospitality for families and temporary storage for bodies.
2017-07-01.snippet: In a rapidly aging Japan, crematories cannot keep up with demand, so businesses are combining hospitality for families and temporary storage for bodies.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: OSAKA, Japan — The minimalist rooms at the Hotel Relation here in Japan’s third-largest city are furnished with plain twin beds. Flat-screen televisions adorn the walls. Plastic-wrapped cups and toothbrushes are provided in the bathrooms. And just across the hall are the rooms where the corpses rest.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Crematory Is Booked? Japan Offers Corpse Hotels

2017-07-01.abstract: The four men and one woman, who indicated that they wanted to defect when their boat was stopped by the South Korean Coast Guard, are being interviewed.
2017-07-01.snippet: The four men and one woman, who indicated that they wanted to defect when their boat was stopped by the South Korean Coast Guard, are being interviewed.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Five North Koreans crossed into South Korean waters in a boat on Saturday, sailing across a heavily guarded maritime border between the two nations in what appeared to be an attempt to flee the North, South Korean Coast Guard officials said.
2017-07-01.headline_main: 5 North Koreans Found in South’s Waters Appear to Be Defectors

2017-07-01.abstract: Will Shortz has us coming and going.
2017-07-01.snippet: Will Shortz has us coming and going.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — It’s hard for me to choose a favorite among the Variety puzzles that run in The New York Times. Our beloved acrostics rank highly with me, as do the cryptic crosswords. I love the Marching Bands. But if I had to pick one for elegance, ultimate solvability and fun, it would have to be the Spiral.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Variety: Spiral

2017-07-01.abstract: Inspired by a citizen complaint, a district mayor says a Czech law requires the entombing of remains — even if plasticized for traveling shows.
2017-07-01.snippet: Inspired by a citizen complaint, a district mayor says a Czech law requires the entombing of remains — even if plasticized for traveling shows.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — The mayor of one hilly district of Prague, just across the Vltava River from the fairy-tale towers of Old Town, has some bodies he wants to bury, between 50 and 100 of them. He’s not sure exactly how many. Some are just parts.
2017-07-01.headline_main: A Prague Leader Tries to Bury a Bodies Exhibition, Once and for All

2017-07-01.abstract: The man took the animal after he was told he could not adopt a dog because he had two unneutered “guard dogs” at home, shelter officials said.
2017-07-01.snippet: The man took the animal after he was told he could not adopt a dog because he had two unneutered “guard dogs” at home, shelter officials said.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Sunny is a young gray rabbit with floppy ears. She lived at New York City’s flagship animal shelter in East Harlem. On June 14, the police say, somebody stole her.
2017-07-01.headline_main: $1,000 Reward Is Offered for Return of Rabbit Taken From Shelter

2017-07-01.abstract: With an eye on the postseason, the National League-leading Dodgers are limiting their starters and spreading the relief work around.
2017-07-01.snippet: With an eye on the postseason, the National League-leading Dodgers are limiting their starters and spreading the relief work around.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Dodgers set a record for relief appearances last season. It seemed to be a result of a barrage of injuries that claimed even the game’s best pitcher, Clayton Kershaw, for much of the summer. Mostly, though, it was by design. The Dodgers want it this way, and the results are convincing.
2017-07-01.headline_main: A Dodgers Pitcher Goes Six Innings. Great Job. Next.

2017-07-01.abstract: The extent of injuries suffered in a shooting at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center became clear on Saturday as doctors scrambled to save the lives of their colleagues.
2017-07-01.snippet: The extent of injuries suffered in a shooting at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center became clear on Saturday as doctors scrambled to save the lives of their colleagues.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Dr. Tracy Sin-Yee Tam was making her rounds at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center on Friday morning when she walked into a 16th-floor examination room to ask after an older patient.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Doctors Work Furiously in Bid to Save Victims of Hospital Rampage

2017-07-01.abstract: Mohammed, a civil engineer from Mosul, was accepted for resettlement to the United States. Then the Supreme Court reinstated President Trump’s freeze on refugee resettlement.
2017-07-01.snippet: Mohammed, a civil engineer from Mosul, was accepted for resettlement to the United States. Then the Supreme Court reinstated President Trump’s freeze on refugee resettlement.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — For Mohammed, an Iraqi civil engineer, the cruelest experience of his life was not when his father tortured him for being gay.
2017-07-01.headline_main: For Abused, Gay Iraqi in Turkey, U.S. Refugee Freeze Is Cruelest Hit

2017-07-01.abstract: At a time when few Chinese investors want to take a risk on Russia, a new casino in a forest, 4,000 miles east of Moscow, beckons deep-pocketed Asians.
2017-07-01.snippet: At a time when few Chinese investors want to take a risk on Russia, a new casino in a forest, 4,000 miles east of Moscow, beckons deep-pocketed Asians.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: ARTEM, Russia — On Russia’s eastern rim, where endemic corruption and bureaucratic sloth conspire to hold back the economic dynamism enriching the rest of Asia, a shimmering palace rises from a dark forest in an improbable effort to tap into the wealth of nearby China, Japan and South Korea.
2017-07-01.headline_main: In Russia’s Far East, a Fledgling Las Vegas for Asia’s Gamblers

2017-07-01.abstract: It’s politics as unusual on stages across the city in July.
2017-07-01.snippet: It’s politics as unusual on stages across the city in July.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Has everything become political? Certainly the world of New York theater is doubling down this summer on its commitment to reflection and resistance. Classic tragedies and comedies, new plays and even a tuneful musical revival seem custom designed for this hot — and possibly overheating — season.
2017-07-01.headline_main: 5 Must-See Shows if You’re in New York This Month

2017-07-01.abstract: Pro-democracy and pro-Beijing demonstrations took place in Hong Kong amid a visit by President Xi Jinping of China. Saturday was the 20th anniversary of the handover of Hong Kong from Britain to China.

2017-07-01.headline_main: Pro-China and Pro-Democracy Rallies on a Hong Kong Anniversary

2017-07-01.abstract: The world is inspiring. We’re beating disease, poverty and illiteracy.
2017-07-01.snippet: The world is inspiring. We’re beating disease, poverty and illiteracy.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: GANTA, Liberia — Cheer up: Despite the gloom, the world truly is becoming a better place. Indeed, 2017 is likely to be the best year in the history of humanity.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Good News, Despite What You’ve Heard

2017-07-01.abstract: Donald Trump brings Grand Guignol to the Potomac.
2017-07-01.snippet: Donald Trump brings Grand Guignol to the Potomac.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — So, with this latest toad jumping from our president’s mouth, is Donald Trump acting like a sexist pig or simply a pig?
2017-07-01.headline_main: Cruella de Trump

2017-07-01.abstract: How Republicans can retreat to modesty on health care reform.
2017-07-01.snippet: How Republicans can retreat to modesty on health care reform.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: SEVEN years ago the Democratic Party found itself at a crossroads. Its sweeping health care bill was increasingly unpopular — the subject of angry town hall protests, the cause of a shocking special-election defeat in Massachusetts. Some people in the Obama White House, notably Rahm Emanuel, wanted to scale the bill back, to drop the idea of reinventing the individual insurance market and simply expand Medicaid.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Going Small on Health Care

2017-07-01.abstract: After a couple months of Justice Neil Gorsuch, it’s clear Mitch McConnell’s theft of a Supreme Court seat is paying off in spades.
2017-07-01.snippet: After a couple months of Justice Neil Gorsuch, it’s clear Mitch McConnell’s theft of a Supreme Court seat is paying off in spades.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, has had a rough couple of weeks. Yet, however many setbacks he might suffer over health care reform or other parts of the Republican agenda, he knows he has already won the biggest fight of all: the theft of a Supreme Court seat from President Obama, the installation of Justice Neil Gorsuch and the preservation of the court’s conservative majority for years to come.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Justice Gorsuch Delivers

2017-07-01.abstract: What’s next? Will conductors line us up behind the cabooses and have us push our trains?
2017-07-01.snippet: What’s next? Will conductors line us up behind the cabooses and have us push our trains?
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Hieronymus Bosch painted a torture chamber where mutant beasts snacked on human flesh. Dante conjured fire, ice and a devil with three faces. If either man lived in New York City today, he’d know better. Hell is the subway at rush hour.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Where Commute Is a Four-Letter Word

2017-07-01.abstract: Criticism is not censorship no matter how insistent Twitter’s free speech brigade might be.
2017-07-01.snippet: Criticism is not censorship no matter how insistent Twitter’s free speech brigade might be.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The first thousand times I was accused of being a politically correct, anti-free-speech censor, it seemed silly. The charge was always in response to some relatively innocuous bit of cultural criticism — like, say, that racism is bad and artists should try not to make racist art if they don’t want to be called racists. Or that if comedians want to joke about rape, they should write their jokes very carefully because rape is very horrible. I saw it happen to other women, too, women who had asked for better representation in media, or had even gone and said the words “video games.”
2017-07-01.headline_main: Save Free Speech From Trolls

2017-07-01.abstract: Tabqa was liberated from ISIS in May, but it still has no basic services and many rotting corpses. The U.S. is sending aid, but it’s not in the business of rebuilding.
2017-07-01.snippet: Tabqa was liberated from ISIS in May, but it still has no basic services and many rotting corpses. The U.S. is sending aid, but it’s not in the business of rebuilding.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: TABQA, Syria — The young man unburdened himself about the dark years of living under the Islamic State as a crowd of curious onlookers gathered in front of a weathered storefront in the town marketplace.
2017-07-01.headline_main: In a Desperate Syrian City, a Test of Trump’s Policies

2017-07-01.abstract: Let’s reclaim public, integrated swimming as an American summertime ritual.
2017-07-01.snippet: Let’s reclaim public, integrated swimming as an American summertime ritual.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: When I was a child in Springfield, Mass., I lived about a six-minute walk from a beautiful, well-maintained, outdoor public swimming pool just inside the eastern entrance to Forest Park, one of the largest urban parks in the country. To get to the pool, I had only to walk through my friend Adam’s backyard, cross Trafton Road, pass through the park’s gate, head toward the hockey rink and listen for the sound of happy children splashing in cold, blue, chlorine-y water.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Why Can’t We All Just Go to the Pool?

2017-07-01.abstract: The team has done little to sign free agents so far and is still in need of a starting point guard. But doing little is better than doing something stupid.
2017-07-01.snippet: The team has done little to sign free agents so far and is still in need of a starting point guard. But doing little is better than doing something stupid.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — Amid the frenzy of the first few hours of N.B.A. free agency on Saturday morning, the Knicks were essentially spectators.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Silent So Far in Free Agency, Knicks Try to Move On After Phil Jackson

2017-07-01.abstract: At least 25 people suffered gunshot wounds, but no fatalities were reported. The police said this appeared to be the result of a dispute, not an act of terrorism.
2017-07-01.snippet: At least 25 people suffered gunshot wounds, but no fatalities were reported. The police said this appeared to be the result of a dispute, not an act of terrorism.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Dozens of people were wounded by gunfire at a nightclub early Saturday morning in downtown Little Rock, Ark., in what appeared to be the result of a dispute, according to police reports.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Dozens Are Injured in Shooting at a Nightclub in Little Rock

2017-07-01.abstract: In their messy way, New York State’s lawmakers crammed everything under the sun into a special legislative session.
2017-07-01.snippet: In their messy way, New York State’s lawmakers crammed everything under the sun into a special legislative session.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The Chicago newspaper columnist Mike Royko suggested many years ago that his hometown change its motto, “Urbs in Horto,” Latin for “City in a Garden.” Far more appropriate for a city historically steeped in corruption, he said, would be “Ubi est Mea?” Where’s mine?
2017-07-01.headline_main: The Good, the Bad and the Big Ugly in Albany

2017-07-01.abstract: A government shutdown over the state’s budget has shuttered more than 50 state parks, historic sites and recreational areas. At least nine other states are also at impasses.
2017-07-01.snippet: A government shutdown over the state’s budget has shuttered more than 50 state parks, historic sites and recreational areas. At least nine other states are also at impasses.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: ISLAND BEACH STATE PARK, N.J. — This spot is usually a choke point for shore traffic, not a U-turn. Yet roughly every 10 minutes on Saturday morning, a new vehicle approached the entrance to the beach here — some packed with beach chairs, beach balls, fishing rods and anticipation — only to be met by two police cars and a barricade.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Going to a New Jersey State Park or Beach? Not This Holiday Weekend

2017-07-01.abstract: Beyond Budapest, and across generations, people are working to keep the illiberal forces of Viktor Orban at bay.
2017-07-01.snippet: Beyond Budapest, and across generations, people are working to keep the illiberal forces of Viktor Orban at bay.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: PECS, Hungary — It is not always easy or convenient, but you can still find democracy practiced in the increasingly authoritarian Hungary led by Prime Minister Viktor Orban. You might start by driving three hours from Budapest past lush farm fields to Pecs, a storied city on the Croatian border.
2017-07-01.headline_main: A Democracy Road Trip Through Hungary

2017-07-01.abstract: The patriotic tune started off as an insult — until Americans appropriated it.
2017-07-01.snippet: The patriotic tune started off as an insult — until Americans appropriated it.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: The Fourth of July is upon us, so it’s time once again to sing what is arguably our most baffling national ditty, “Yankee Doodle Dandy.” Maybe you’ve noticed: Some of the lyrics seem like the work of a prankster on acid. Who else could have conceived a vignette as bizarre as a man riding a pony into town, then sticking a feather in his cap that, for unknown reasons, he insists on calling “macaroni”?
2017-07-01.headline_main: That Diss Song Known as ‘Yankee Doodle’

2017-07-01.abstract: When I was a teenager, hip-hop meant Big Daddy Kane on my Walkman, not rappers dying of illnesses.
2017-07-01.snippet: When I was a teenager, hip-hop meant Big Daddy Kane on my Walkman, not rappers dying of illnesses.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: I see their names and hold my breath. You do this when you’re a 40-something hip-hop head and you’ve glimpsed the name of an M.C. your age trending in the news. Once it might have meant tawdry scandal or legal shenanigans. Now, too often, it means someone’s been struck down. Not by bullet or blade. But by illness.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Beats, Rhymes and 40-Something Life

2017-07-01.abstract: Readers debate whether the party has a “religion problem.”
2017-07-01.snippet: Readers debate whether the party has a “religion problem.”
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-07-01.headline_main: Are the Democrats Too Secular?

2017-07-01.abstract: China has asserted itself as a global climate leader even as Chinese companies are planning to build half of all new coal plants at home and overseas.
2017-07-01.snippet: China has asserted itself as a global climate leader even as Chinese companies are planning to build half of all new coal plants at home and overseas.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: When China halted plans for more than 100 new coal-fired power plants this year, even as President Trump vowed to “bring back coal” in America, the contrast seemed to confirm Beijing’s new role as a leader in the fight against climate change.

2017-07-01.abstract: It takes a special talent like Patrick Blindauer to make a puzzle like this one.

2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — You don’t need me to tell you that this puzzle is unusual. All you have to do is look at it.
2017-07-01.headline_main: The Long and Winding Road

2017-07-01.abstract: Supplemental benefits for millions of recipients, many of them disabled, would be at risk under Republican proposals to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
2017-07-01.snippet: Supplemental benefits for millions of recipients, many of them disabled, would be at risk under Republican proposals to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. — Frances Isbell has spinal muscular atrophy, a genetic disorder that has left her unable to walk or even roll over in bed. But Ms. Isbell has a personal care assistant through Medicaid, and the help allowed her to go to law school at the University of Alabama here. She will graduate next month.
2017-07-01.headline_main: For Millions, Life Without Medicaid Services Is No Option

2017-07-01.abstract: Billy McFarland, the entrepreneur behind the failed Fyre Festival, appeared at his bail hearing on Saturday, represented by a public defender.
2017-07-01.snippet: Billy McFarland, the entrepreneur behind the failed Fyre Festival, appeared at his bail hearing on Saturday, represented by a public defender.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Billy McFarland, the entrepreneur behind the disastrous Fyre Festival in the Bahamas, lives in a $21,000-a-month penthouse apartment in Manhattan and drives a $110,000 Maserati. When he was arrested by federal agents on Friday on a charge of wire fraud, he was carrying $5,000 in cash.
2017-07-01.headline_main: Fyre Festival Organizer Released on $300,000 Bail

2017-07-01.abstract: Henry Bello graduated from medical school, but struggled with arrests, bankruptcies and homelessness before opening fire in the Bronx, killing one and wounding six others.
2017-07-01.snippet: Henry Bello graduated from medical school, but struggled with arrests, bankruptcies and homelessness before opening fire in the Bronx, killing one and wounding six others.
2017-07-01.lead_paragraph: Fresh out of medical school in the Caribbean, Henry Bello took the first job he could get on the road to working as a doctor: a pharmacy technician with the city’s Health and Hospitals system. Then, in 2014, he got his break, when Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center took a chance on the sharp dresser from California, someone who, in his 40s, was arriving late to the profession. 2017-07-02.abstract: There are few distractions on this rapper’s raw 13th studio album, which responds to Beyoncé’s “Lemonade” and doesn’t strive to sound like the present hip-hop moment.
2017-07-02.snippet: There are few distractions on this rapper’s raw 13th studio album, which responds to Beyoncé’s “Lemonade” and doesn’t strive to sound like the present hip-hop moment.
2017-07-02.lead_paragraph: When rapper self-mythologizing was in its infancy, Jay-Z was its most faithful student. He absorbed the art of the boast, and built on that to create one of pop’s most fascinating characters: the street-corner hustler turned multimillionaire, slick and unbothered. Complex emotions often formed the foundation of his tales of ascendancy, but his greatest talent was making his path seem smooth and inevitable. No matter how high the stakes, he remained cold as ice.
2017-07-02.headline_main: Jay-Z Revels in the Catharsis of Confession on ‘4:44’

2017-07-02.abstract: Jon Meacham looks at three signature works about Watergate — by Elizabeth Drew, Art Buchwald and Theodore H. White — to see how the news of the ’70s resonates.
2017-07-02.snippet: Jon Meacham looks at three signature works about Watergate — by Elizabeth Drew, Art Buchwald and Theodore H. White — to see how the news of the ’70s resonates.
2017-07-02.lead_paragraph: Afterward, she couldn’t recall who had the idea first. It was Tuesday, Sept. 4, 1973, and Elizabeth Drew, a newly hired Washington writer for The New Yorker, came in to see the magazine’s editor, William Shawn, after Labor Day weekend. “I told him that I had an intuition that within a year this country would change vice president and president,” Ms. Drew recalled in an introduction to a 40th-anniversary edition of her 1974 book, “Washington Journal: Reporting Watergate and Richard Nixon’s Downfall.” Vice President Spiro T. Agnew, a popular figure with the growing conservative base of the Republican Party, was facing suspicions of accepting bribes for services rendered during his years as governor of Maryland. More important, President Richard M. Nixon seemed incapable of putting Watergate — a catchall term for the White House’s involvement in political espionage, break-ins and subsequent cover-ups — behind him. The result of the conversation: Ms. Drew would begin to write a journal of life in Washington for the magazine.
2017-07-02.headline_main: ‘I Have Passed the Point of Reacting’: How the Watergate News Cycle Reads Today

But the tweet also shows that by promoting Canadian culture, Mr. Trudeau cannily understands how soft power works.

2017-07-03.abstract: If some people can flout law enforcement and survive, and others obey it and die, law enforcement is not doing its job.

2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: Late last month, in Jacksonville, Fla., Devonte Shipman, who is black, walked across the street. A white sheriff’s officer saw him, and about 20 minutes later, Mr. Shipman had been served a $62 fine for jaywalking and a $136 fine for “failing to provide I.D.” The sheriff’s officer even threatened to arrest Mr. Shipman, saying, “In the state of Florida, you have to have an I.D. card on you identifying who you are, or I can detain you for seven hours until I figure out who you are.”
2017-07-03.headline_main: Jaywalking While Black

2017-07-03.abstract: Anastasia Confections wins the Specialty Food Association’s first product of the year award for a coconut treat drizzled in chocolate.
2017-07-03.snippet: Anastasia Confections wins the Specialty Food Association’s first product of the year award for a coconut treat drizzled in chocolate.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: The Specialty Food Association named a product of the year for the first time at its summer show, held last week at the Javits Convention Center. Coconut Cashew Crunch Chocolate Drizzle, a rather simple but alluring brittle from Anastasia Confections, won the prize. The candy is made in small batches by a company in Orlando, Fla., that specializes in tropical-style sweets. With coconut in the mix, it taps into a major flavor trend, and it stood out for being straightforward and tasty without claiming to improve the mind or muscles or prevent ailments, like so many of the beverages, snacks and other products on display at the trade show:  Coconut Cashew Crunch Chocolate Drizzle, $5.99 for 5.75 ounces, anastasiaconfections.com.
2017-07-03.headline_main: Coconut Brittle Takes Top Prize at Fancy Food Show

Michael Klug, the chocolatier and pastry chef, has turned to seasonal apricots, berries and rhubarb, among others, to create tall, colorful summer coolers that are fresh-tasting, light and not cloying. The drink menu will change with the harvest: Summertime Beverages, $4 to $6.50, L. A. Burdick Chocolates Shop and Café, 156 Prince Street (Thompson Street), 212-796-0143, burdickchocolate.com.

2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: A bull in a china shop? How about a giant pig in a shopping mall? One scene from the new film “Okja” (in theaters and on Netflix) has a girl (An Seo Hyun) and her pet pig trying to escape from the authorities via an underground shopping center. Things don’t go so well. In a recent interview, the director Bong Joon Ho (“Snowpiercer”) discussed how he conceived of the scene and how he chose a John Denver song (“Annie’s Song”), to score part of it. 2017-07-03.abstract: Watching fireworks is a perfect time to practice meditation amid an onslaught of stimulation.
2017-07-03.snippet: Watching fireworks is a perfect time to practice meditation amid an onslaught of stimulation.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: “When we meditate with our eyes open, we can become aware of visual details we often miss in our daily lives, and we also begin to notice how our environment affects our inner experience. This can help us feel connected to the world around us, as it becomes clear that we are in fact part of the environment we are inhabiting, rather than separate from it. Watching fireworks is a perfect time to practice amidst an onslaught of stimulation — from the powerful lights to the sounds, smells and crowds.” — Annaka Harris, a mindfulness teacher and the author of “I Wonder.”
2017-07-03.headline_main: How to Be Mindful Watching Fireworks

2017-07-03.abstract: The latest from Ovenly and Claus Meyer, and other restaurant news.
2017-07-03.snippet: The latest from Ovenly and Claus Meyer, and other restaurant news.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: ISLAND OYSTER This 32,000-square-foot mostly outdoor restaurant is opening on Governors Island. The island is home to food events during the spring, summer and fall, but this is its only stand-alone restaurant. And while its ambience couldn’t be more informal, with a raw bar, lobster rolls, fish tacos, corn and burgers, it has full waiter service for the 600 or so guests it can accommodate at a 100-foot stretch of bar, at banquettes and at tables. The kitchen is built into four shipping containers, and the chef, Kerry Heffernan, a seafood expert, will have oysters playing a major role. Alex and Miles Pincus, who run the restaurant, are supporters of the Billion Oyster Project, a nonprofit organization on the island. They also run Grand Banks, a restaurant on a schooner moored in the Hudson River. This month they also expect to open Pilot, an oyster bar on a historic schooner docked at Pier 6 in Brooklyn Bridge Park: The Ferry Landing, Governors Island, 917-268-0200, islandoyster.com; Pilot, Pier 6, Brooklyn Bridge Park, Dumbo, Brooklyn, 917-810-8550, pilotbrooklyn.com.
2017-07-03.headline_main: Island Oyster, a Vast Seafood Restaurant, Opens on Governors Island

2017-07-03.abstract: The idea that U.S. Communists were Kremlin agents is often treated as a McCarthyite myth. But it was largely true.
2017-07-03.snippet: The idea that U.S. Communists were Kremlin agents is often treated as a McCarthyite myth. But it was largely true.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: From its founding in 1919 in the wake of the Russian Revolution until the demise of the Soviet Union in 1991, the Communist Party of the United States of America was an instrument of Soviet foreign policy. The Communist International, or Comintern, which was set up under Lenin in 1919 and then disbanded by Stalin in 1943 as a gesture of unity to his World War II allies, regularly sent delegates to oversee the C.P.U.S.A. and transmitted orders from Moscow dictating who should lead the American party and what policies it should pursue.
2017-07-03.headline_main: American Reds, Soviet Stooges

2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — As Petra Kvitova continued her improbable return to form with a first-round win at Wimbledon on Monday, she was joined by a special guest whose own skilled hands saved hers. Dr. Radek Kebrle, the surgeon who operated on Kvitova’s left hand after it was wounded during a home invasion in December, came to watch her match on Centre Court, which she won, 6-3, 6-4, over Johanna Larsson.
2017-07-03.headline_main: Kvitova Gets First-Round Win at Wimbledon; Wawrinka Is Ousted

2017-07-03.abstract: In Paul Kruse’s one-act play at Jack in Brooklyn, the humans have their problems, and the chickens have their own issues.
2017-07-03.snippet: In Paul Kruse’s one-act play at Jack in Brooklyn, the humans have their problems, and the chickens have their own issues.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: If someone told you there was a play called “Chickens in the Yard,” about Pennsylvanians who own chickens, you might infer that the cast consisted of humans playing humans. And maybe other humans playing chickens. But in Paul Kruse’s intriguing one-act play by that name — presented at Jack, the hip, tinfoil-walled performance space in Brooklyn — all four cast members play both species. The very idea may sound like a parody of an acting class exercise, but the transitions from walking and speaking to pecking and clucking are sometimes stunning.
2017-07-03.headline_main: Review: ‘Chickens in the Yard,’ and Family Conflict, Too

2017-07-03.abstract: “White nights” and sun that barely sets near the Arctic Circle are an occasion to celebrate for some living things. But a night crawler might want to stay in its burrow.
2017-07-03.snippet: “White nights” and sun that barely sets near the Arctic Circle are an occasion to celebrate for some living things. But a night crawler might want to stay in its burrow.
2017-07-03.lead_paragraph: Around the Arctic Circle during the summer, there’s no need for the saying “I wish this day would never end” — because for a few months, the days don’t. During the period known in some places as “white nights,” the sun barely sets. It just dips down briefly below the horizon before popping back into the sky. Night is replaced with twilight. In more northerly places, the midnight sun, as it’s called, remains visible 24 hours a day.
2017-07-03.headline_main: Partying Under the Midsummer Arctic Sun, Unless You’re a Worm

2017-07-04.snippet: Aaron Judge and Gary Sanchez, who will participate in the upcoming Home Run Derby, scored two runs each as the Yankees defeated the Blue Jays.

2017-07-04.headline_main: No Homers This Time, but a Pair of All-Stars Pace the Yankees Nonetheless

2017-07-04.abstract: London’s cabby wars are less about the disruptive power of an app, or a new business model, than about the disruption of Britain.
2017-07-04.snippet: London’s cabby wars are less about the disruptive power of an app, or a new business model, than about the disruption of Britain.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Shortly before 6 a.m., Zahra Bakkali tiptoed out of her bedroom for morning prayers. She prepared breakfast (black tea and toast with olive oil), saw her children off to school, then rode the elevator to the garage below her southeast London housing project. She unlocked her white Toyota Prius, switched on the Uber app and awaited the day’s first job.
2017-07-04.headline_main: On London’s Streets, Black Cabs and Uber Fight for a Future

2017-07-04.headline_main: Mixed Victory Over Domestic Violence Leave. Also: Australia Rejects Ransom Demands

2017-07-04.abstract: Irina Falconi didn’t lose a set in her qualifying rounds and now finds herself matched against the top-ranked player in the world, Angelique Kerber.
2017-07-04.snippet: Irina Falconi didn’t lose a set in her qualifying rounds and now finds herself matched against the top-ranked player in the world, Angelique Kerber.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — The emotional arc for a qualifying player at a major tennis tournament can be steep. It is not uncommon to go from exhilaration one day to an abrupt realization a day or two later when the draw is released. That is when a qualifier learns the first-round opponent, and it is often someone famous with a top pedigree.
2017-07-04.headline_main: At Wimbledon, Ranked 247 and Suddenly Facing No. 1

2017-07-04.abstract: The North claimed a milestone in its efforts to build nuclear weapons capable of hitting the American mainland, prompting a warning from the United States.
2017-07-04.snippet: The North claimed a milestone in its efforts to build nuclear weapons capable of hitting the American mainland, prompting a warning from the United States.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — The Trump administration on Tuesday confirmed North Korea’s claim that it had launched an intercontinental ballistic missile, and it told Pyongyang that the United States would use “the full range of capabilities at our disposal against the growing threat.”
2017-07-04.headline_main: U.S. Confirms North Korea Fired Intercontinental Ballistic Missile

2017-07-04.abstract: The National Security Agency is so shrouded in mystery that it’s not even clear whether it knows how its weapons were stolen.
2017-07-04.snippet: The National Security Agency is so shrouded in mystery that it’s not even clear whether it knows how its weapons were stolen.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: Twice in the past few months, powerful cyberattacks have wreaked havoc on the world, shutting down tens of thousands of computers, including critical machines in hospitals, a nuclear site and businesses. The attacks were initially thought to be schemes to collect ransom, but their goals — whether money, politics or just chaos — have become increasingly blurred. One thing seems clear: The weapons for the attack were developed by the National Security Agency and stolen from it.
2017-07-04.headline_main: When Cyberweapons Go Missing

2017-07-04.abstract: Stability is easy to take for granted, but impossible to live without.
2017-07-04.snippet: Stability is easy to take for granted, but impossible to live without.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: ONE of the essential, if often unstated, job requirements of an American president is to provide stability, order and predictability in a world that tends toward chaos, disarray and entropy. When our political leaders ignore this — and certainly when they delight in disruption — the consequences can be severe. Stability is easy to take for granted, but impossible to live without.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Declaration of Disruption

2017-07-04.abstract: America has yet to realize his vision of enlightened religion.
2017-07-04.snippet: America has yet to realize his vision of enlightened religion.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: It was an article of Thomas Jefferson’s faith that no government should interfere in anyone’s private religious beliefs. A passionate student of history, Jefferson knew that religious struggles through the ages had caused “rivers of blood” to flow all over the world.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Thomas Jefferson’s Bible Teaching

2017-07-04.abstract: The mean streets were meaner, and though it’s hard to believe, the subway was a lot worse.
2017-07-04.snippet: The mean streets were meaner, and though it’s hard to believe, the subway was a lot worse.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: In “The Taking of Pelham One Two Three,” a film classic about a New York subway hijacking and hostage-taking — the 1974 version, not the pallid 2009 remake — an exasperated transit official only wants to get his train back. He couldn’t care less about the fate of the captive riders. “What the hell did they expect for their lousy 35 cents — to live forever?” he grumbles.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Movies Can Take New Yorkers Back to the ’70s. But Why Go There?

2017-07-04.abstract: America embraced me when I was 16. Now I’m a member of Congress.
2017-07-04.snippet: America embraced me when I was 16. Now I’m a member of Congress.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Seventeen years ago, I celebrated my first Independence Day as a United States citizen. I couldn’t have predicted then that I would one day have the enormous privilege of being the first Indian-American woman to serve in the United States House of Representatives, and one of only six members of Congress who are naturalized citizens.
2017-07-04.headline_main: The Country I Love

2017-07-04.abstract: Want a side of Trump-boosterism with your sports? WFAN has it.
2017-07-04.snippet: Want a side of Trump-boosterism with your sports? WFAN has it.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: In the spring of 2016, the surprising presidential candidacy of Donald J. Trump seemed to be all anybody could talk about. On New York radio stations, much of that talk was decidedly negative. But suddenly, one voice, from an unexpected source, began an eager and aggressive defense of the eventual Republican nominee. WFAN’s Mike Francesa, known as “the pope” of New York sports talk radio, began spending hours on air explaining not only why Mr. Trump was not a racist and sexist, but also why he could win.
2017-07-04.headline_main: These New Yorkers Actually Like Trump

2017-07-04.abstract: The restaurant exposed four Pakistani kids to the crass yet oddly family-friendly side of this country.
2017-07-04.snippet: The restaurant exposed four Pakistani kids to the crass yet oddly family-friendly side of this country.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: It sounds like the beginning of an uncomfortable joke: Four brown kids of Pakistani descent — from Karachi, Dubai, London and Augusta, Ga. — walk into a Hooters on a recent Saturday afternoon.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Going to Hooters and Seeing America

2017-07-04.abstract: The fighting at Con Thien around July 4, 1967, showed American Marines at their best, and America’s political leaders at their worst.
2017-07-04.snippet: The fighting at Con Thien around July 4, 1967, showed American Marines at their best, and America’s political leaders at their worst.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: It was known to local missionaries as “the Hill of Angels,” but to the occupying Marines, Con Thien was a little piece of hell. Just two miles south of the Demilitarized Zone, it was a barren, bulldozed plateau of red dirt 525 feet high and ringed with barbed wire, studded with artillery revetments and crisscrossed with trenches and sand bag-covered bunkers. To the east stretched the “McNamara Line,” the 2,000-foot-wide “barrier” ordered by Secretary of Defense Robert McNamara, which the Marines had cleared and sowed with seismic and acoustic sensors and minefields.
2017-07-04.headline_main: A Little Piece of Hell

2017-07-04.abstract: Rural Republicans often see life and politics through an ethos formed in frontier life.
2017-07-04.snippet: Rural Republicans often see life and politics through an ethos formed in frontier life.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: Over the past two months the Trump administration and the Republicans in Congress have proposed a budget and two health care plans that would take benefits away from core Republican constituencies, especially working-class voters. And yet over this time Donald Trump’s approval rating has remained unchanged, at 40 percent. During this period the Republicans have successfully defended a series of congressional seats.
2017-07-04.headline_main: What’s the Matter With Republicans?

2017-07-04.abstract: Advocates for reforms or better government can be trained to approach their lawmakers and make a difference.
2017-07-04.snippet: Advocates for reforms or better government can be trained to approach their lawmakers and make a difference.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: On Jan. 24, four days after President Trump’s inauguration, the House of Representatives passed the READ Act, which establishes a framework for American leadership on access to basic education in some of the world’s poorest countries. The bill was so broadly supported that it passed on a voice vote.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Putting Citizenship Back in Congress

2017-07-04.abstract: Psychology only goes so far: It will take more than feelings to fix the persistent sluggishness in the U.S. and other advanced nations.
2017-07-04.snippet: Psychology only goes so far: It will take more than feelings to fix the persistent sluggishness in the U.S. and other advanced nations.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: After Donald J. Trump won the presidential election, Americans’ optimism about the economic future soared. But midway through the year, that optimism has not translated into concrete economic gains.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Confidence Boomed After the Election. The Economy Hasn’t.

2017-07-04.abstract: An advocate general’s recommendation to Europe’s highest court said that France could prohibit certain types of transport services it deemed illegal.
2017-07-04.snippet: An advocate general’s recommendation to Europe’s highest court said that France could prohibit certain types of transport services it deemed illegal.

2017-07-04.abstract: Create music playlists, pack snacks and a phone charger, and build in time for sightseeing.
2017-07-04.snippet: Create music playlists, pack snacks and a phone charger, and build in time for sightseeing.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: Unlike flying, which is often stressful, a road trip is a journey that can be as enjoyable as the destination you’re headed to, according to Sheryl Connelly, a trend forecaster for Ford Motor Company, who takes road trips often with her family. “In a world of increasing distractions, being in a car for an extended period of time is a great way to bond with your family or friends and see sights you may not get to otherwise,” she said.
2017-07-04.headline_main: How to Have a Perfect Road Trip

2017-07-04.abstract: Go more than once, purchase tickets ahead of time and check stores for gift cards.

2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: Theme parks can be great fun for all, but tickets, parking, food and incidentals can rapidly mount up to burn a hole in your pocket. Here is a list of tips to help you save a few bucks on that summer theme-park excursion, be it one of the popular Disney parks or your local favorite.
2017-07-04.headline_main: How to Save on Your Trip to a Theme Park

2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: HAUPPAUGE, N.Y. — Matthew Rodriguez is no longer a machine-gunner in the Marines, an infantry member in Afghanistan fighting to push back the Taliban in the town of Marja. He is now a father helping to raise three children, renting a house on Long Island and working for his friend’s family business as an electrician.

2017-07-04.abstract: Lee Kuan Yew, who died in 2015, stipulated that his home should eventually be destroyed. Two of his children have accused the third, the prime minister, of defying those wishes for political gain.

2017-07-04.abstract: Halting drugs is becoming increasingly difficult for the Coast Guard, which has operated with flat budgets even as its mission has expanded.
2017-07-04.snippet: Halting drugs is becoming increasingly difficult for the Coast Guard, which has operated with flat budgets even as its mission has expanded.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: ALAMEDA, Calif. — Vice Adm. Fred Midgette, commander of Coast Guard operations in the Pacific Area, has a challenge almost as vast as the ocean he patrols in search of drug traffickers, with responsibilities for an area that is twice the size of the continental United States.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Coast Guard Faces Challenges at Sea, and at the Budget Office

2017-07-04.abstract: Are anti-pornography laws the new tool of choice for silencing dissent in Indonesia?
2017-07-04.snippet: Are anti-pornography laws the new tool of choice for silencing dissent in Indonesia?
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: JAKARTA, Indonesia — Rizieq Shihab may be the most controversial public figure in Indonesia today. Admired by many, reviled by others, the Great Imam of a leading hardline Muslim organization is wanted for pornography.
2017-07-04.headline_main: The Case of the Sexting Imam

2017-07-04.abstract: A march to Istanbul is helping to unite all those who oppose Mr. Erdogan’s authoritarian government.
2017-07-04.snippet: A march to Istanbul is helping to unite all those who oppose Mr. Erdogan’s authoritarian government.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: The trouble with the authoritarian course President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has chosen is that once you start trying to suppress opposition, you cannot stop. Since a failed coup a year ago, Mr. Erdogan has used emergency powers to purge and arrest tens of thousands of leftists, liberals, Kurds and others. Now thousands of protesters, their numbers steadily swelling, are trudging through the heat on blistered feet from Ankara to Istanbul on a March for Justice.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Turkey’s 250-Mile Protest

2017-07-04.abstract: Thirty-two people from an investment company that backed the enterprise were arrested on suspicion of illegal fund-raising, effectively killing the project.
2017-07-04.snippet: Thirty-two people from an investment company that backed the enterprise were arrested on suspicion of illegal fund-raising, effectively killing the project.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Maybe a giant tram rolling over pesky cars clogging the streets wasn’t the answer to China’s traffic congestion woes. A Chinese inventor’s plan to develop such a vehicle, called a “traffic-straddling bus,” has been effectively killed after 32 people from an investment company that backed the project were arrested.
2017-07-04.headline_main: China’s Vision for a Straddling Bus Dissolves in Scandal and Arrests

2017-07-04.headline_main: The ‘Rewilding’ of a Century-Old Cranberry Bog

2017-07-04.headline_main: Worldpay Group, a British Payments Processor, Fields Two Possible Takeover Bids

2017-07-04.snippet: By forging ahead before the Group of 20 meeting, Europe and Japan threatened to isolate the United States in important industries.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: The European Union and Japan have signaled that they plan to announce a broad agreement on trade on Thursday, a pointed challenge to President Trump, who is scheduled to attend a meeting of world leaders in Germany the next day.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Challenging Trump, E.U. and Japan Push Joint Trade Deal

2017-07-04.abstract: Family issues have made Anja Harteros, whose voice “is one of the most beautiful which has been ever around,” a star who can seem like a secret.
2017-07-04.snippet: Family issues have made Anja Harteros, whose voice “is one of the most beautiful which has been ever around,” a star who can seem like a secret.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — The joy of Elisabeth’s entrance aria in Wagner’s “Tannhäuser” recedes for a line of sadness as she recalls her beloved’s departure. The soprano Anja Harteros, whose performance of the role at the Bayerische Staatsoper here will be streamed at staatsoper.tv on Sunday, July 9, makes of that passing moment an entire anatomy of melancholy.
2017-07-04.headline_main: What’s Keeping One of Opera’s Greatest Sopranos From Singing?

2017-07-04.abstract: The Persian Gulf state, which is under a blockade by Saudi Arabia and others in the region, says it will lift output 30 percent in the next five to seven years.
2017-07-04.snippet: The Persian Gulf state, which is under a blockade by Saudi Arabia and others in the region, says it will lift output 30 percent in the next five to seven years.

2017-07-04.abstract: Her candid interview about being dropped by the magazine and about the sector’s brutality has been the talk of Paris Couture.
2017-07-04.snippet: Her candid interview about being dropped by the magazine and about the sector’s brutality has been the talk of Paris Couture.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Hell hath no fury like a fashion editor fired. At the couture shows in Paris this week, the front row was abuzz — both conversationally and electronically — with news of an incendiary interview with Lucinda Chambers, the former British Vogue fashion director, that was unusual in its frank criticism of the 21st-century fashion ecosystem. Soon after its publication, however, and amid talk of legal action, the piece was taken down, only to sensationally resurface again less than 24 hours later.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Lucinda Chambers, Fired Vogue Director, Gives Fashion Industry a Kicking

2017-07-04.abstract: Robert Pattinson, Bella Hadid and Cara Delevingne were among the guests at the pre-opening party for a sprawling retrospective exhibition on the fashion house.
2017-07-04.snippet: Robert Pattinson, Bella Hadid and Cara Delevingne were among the guests at the pre-opening party for a sprawling retrospective exhibition on the fashion house.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: PARIS — On Monday night, on one of those spectacular Paris summer evenings when the light shimmers off every surface and the sun doesn’t set until around 10, hundreds of fashionably dressed people gathered in the garden of the Musée des Art Décoratifs, enjoying Champagne and hors d’oeuvres as a newly shorn and platinum blond Cara Delevingne looked on from above, standing in the open French doors of a second-floor reception room.
2017-07-04.headline_main: Celebrating 70 Years of Christian Dior

2017-07-04.abstract: The president’s earlier assertion that North Korea would not produce a missile that can reach the United States has now been upended.
2017-07-04.snippet: The president’s earlier assertion that North Korea would not produce a missile that can reach the United States has now been upended.
2017-07-04.lead_paragraph: When President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Twitter in early January that a North Korean test of an intercontinental ballistic missile capable of reaching the United States “won’t happen!” there were two things he still did not fully appreciate: how close Kim Jong-un, the North’s leader, was to reaching that goal, and how limited any president’s options were to stop him.
