2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: The recent Dries Van Noten men’s show featured rubber-soled plimsolls that conveyed a youthful spirit and paired well with creased trousers and muted blazers. For the months ahead, here are six simple renditions of this classic canvas shoe.
2017-07-20.headline_main: 6 Simple Men’s Sneakers

2017-07-20.abstract: In Mohammad Al Attar’s new play, a 20-something Syrian is beaten nearly to death. Will his family and friends (and his country) ever recover?
2017-07-20.snippet: In Mohammad Al Attar’s new play, a 20-something Syrian is beaten nearly to death. Will his family and friends (and his country) ever recover?
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Political theater, with its tendency toward hectoring and grandiosity, is hard to credit these days. After all, both politics and theater have been with us for centuries, barely making an inch of difference in the tide of human brutality. “While I Was Waiting,” a subtly harrowing play by Mohammad Al Attar that opened on Wednesday in a Lincoln Center Festival production, gets around the problem by embracing failure as its central subject: the failure of government, yes, but also of resistance. As a character named Omar says, “How can nothing have changed, after all that happened?”
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: In ‘While I Was Waiting,’ a Man and a Country in Limbo

2017-07-20.abstract: We had to leave a play date early after one little girl dissolved into tears.
2017-07-20.snippet: We had to leave a play date early after one little girl dissolved into tears.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: My 3-year-old daughter is obsessed with Donald Trump.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Help! My 3-Year-Old Is Obsessed With Trump

2017-07-20.abstract: Trump’s people never spoke to any Russians, and if they did they forgot about it, and if they didn’t forget, it was just socializing. Got it?
2017-07-20.snippet: Trump’s people never spoke to any Russians, and if they did they forgot about it, and if they didn’t forget, it was just socializing. Got it?
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump apparently wanted to set the record straight on the Kremlin Kaper in the strange interview he gave this week to The New York Times. Thank goodness for that, because the story line was getting hard to follow.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Everything You Need to Understand About Trump and Russia

2017-07-20.abstract: If you can summarize the plot of Luc Besson’s film adaptation of the graphic-novel science fiction series, you weren’t paying attention.
2017-07-20.snippet: If you can summarize the plot of Luc Besson’s film adaptation of the graphic-novel science fiction series, you weren’t paying attention.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Much as I hesitate to predict the future in such crazy times, I feel I can say with certainty that 2017 will go down in film history as the Year of the Crazy Dane DeHaan Movie. Already so far we have seen Mr. DeHaan, a 31-year-old actor endowed with poise, intelligence and superb eyebrows, in Gore Verbinski’s highly puzzling “A Cure for Wellness.” If you missed that one, it was more or less “The Magic Mountain” with incest and bloodsucking eels.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Valerian’ Is a Rave in Space (but Not Much Fun)

2017-07-20.abstract: Fundraisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.
2017-07-20.snippet: Fundraisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Fundraisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Benefits by the Shore

2017-07-20.abstract: Marthe Keller stars in Barbet Schroeder’s movie, set in Spain in the 1990s, about two Germans who confront the lingering horrors of World War II.
2017-07-20.snippet: Marthe Keller stars in Barbet Schroeder’s movie, set in Spain in the 1990s, about two Germans who confront the lingering horrors of World War II.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Inner peace and reconciliation — as well as historical memory and its burden — are at the heart of Barbet Schroeder’s drama “Amnesia.” The story is simple, the emotions complex. It takes a while for the true depth of all the complicated, confusing feelings to surface, partly because the movie’s most interesting character, the German-born Martha (Marthe Keller), has done a good job of barricading off part of her being. But don’t weep too hard for her: She’s built that wall in enviable splendor on the Spanish island of Ibiza, where she lives alone in a white house overlooking the blue, blue Mediterranean.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: In ‘Amnesia,’ Finding Inner German Peace on a Spanish Isle

2017-07-20.abstract: Fund-raisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.
2017-07-20.snippet: Fund-raisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: The Parrish Art Museum in Water Mill, N.Y., held its summer gala on July 15. The Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation raised more than $1.1 million at its July 15 benefit at Fairview Farm in Bridgehampton, N.Y. The Fire Island Dance Festival, on behalf of Dancers Responding to AIDS, took place on July 15 at the Pines Club. And Lambda Legal, an organization for lesbians, gays, bisexuals, transgender people and those living with H.I.V., gave a benefit on July 15 at a private home in Fire Island Pines.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Benefits by the Shore

2017-07-20.abstract: Kavi Raz’s film, based on the true story of Duleep Singh, never finds a rhythm or dramatic arc.
2017-07-20.snippet: Kavi Raz’s film, based on the true story of Duleep Singh, never finds a rhythm or dramatic arc.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: At the beginning of Kavi Raz’s “The Black Prince” we hear in a stentorian voice-over that the Lion of Punjab, a Sikh king, was “fearsome, fearless and feared.” Alas, the poor Black Prince, son of the Lion … in Mr. Raz’s movie he’s muddled, moody and even a bit mousy.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: A Poor, Little Rich Maharajah in ‘Black Prince’

2017-07-20.abstract: Jordan Spieth almost tied the record for the best first round at Royal Birkdale in the tournament. His failure to do so, he said, is on him.
2017-07-20.snippet: Jordan Spieth almost tied the record for the best first round at Royal Birkdale in the tournament. His failure to do so, he said, is on him.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: SOUTHPORT, England — Jordan Spieth stood over a six-foot birdie putt on his last hole to tie the first-round record at the British Open at Royal Birkdale on Thursday. In 1983, Craig Stadler opened with a 64, and the next three times the tournament was held here, nobody started better.
2017-07-20.headline_main: A British Open Lesson: Golf Is a Sport of Personal Responsibility

2017-07-20.abstract: This Argentine film, very loosely inspired by the Bartok opera “Bluebeard’s Castle,” observes the lives of teenage girls on the verge of adulthood.
2017-07-20.snippet: This Argentine film, very loosely inspired by the Bartok opera “Bluebeard’s Castle,” observes the lives of teenage girls on the verge of adulthood.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: The Argentine film “Kekszakallu” seems designed as a test of how little the director, Gastón Solnicki, can derive from the Hungarian composer Bela Bartok’s only opera, “Bluebeard’s Castle,” while still citing it as his inspiration.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Kekszakallu’ Plunges Into the Unknown

2017-07-20.abstract: In Sébastien Laudenbach’s animated adaptation of a Grimm fairy tale, after her father’s deal with the Devil, a young girl loses her hands and must navigate the world without them.
2017-07-20.snippet: In Sébastien Laudenbach’s animated adaptation of a Grimm fairy tale, after her father’s deal with the Devil, a young girl loses her hands and must navigate the world without them.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Sébastien Laudenbach’s “The Girl Without Hands” is an animated adaptation of the Brothers Grimm fairy tale of the same title. Although this film’s style is soft and colorful, it does not rub out the emotional sharpness of a story dealing with betrayal, suicide and death.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘The Girl Without Hands’ Tells a Dark Tale, Boldly

2017-07-20.abstract: A slimy, many-tentacled alien has sex with several unhappy residents of the Mexican city of Guanajuato in Amat Escalante’s movie.
2017-07-20.snippet: A slimy, many-tentacled alien has sex with several unhappy residents of the Mexican city of Guanajuato in Amat Escalante’s movie.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Resolutely unsmiling and studiously austere, “The Untamed” behaves like a quiet horror movie with a lot on its mind. Its main characters, who live in the central Mexican city of Guanajuato, are young, gloomy, attractive men and women connected by friendship, family ties and sexual longing and divided by those same things. The movie, directed by Amat Escalante from a script he wrote with Gibrán Portela, might be a dour, observant study of modern relationships among the urban middle class were it not for the presence of a slimy, many-tentacled space creature living in a cabin in the countryside.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: In ‘The Untamed,’ Close Encounters. No, Even Closer.

2017-07-20.abstract: The movie, set in an Australian national park, features two families and one set of brutal killers.
2017-07-20.snippet: The movie, set in an Australian national park, features two families and one set of brutal killers.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: “Killing Ground” features a man and a woman who make head-slappingly dumb choices as they flee from a pair of killers who are just as inept. Yet in the end, the most regrettable decision may be that of audience members who fork over money to see the movie.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Killing Ground’ Will Make You Rethink That Camping Trip

2017-07-20.abstract: Jenny Slate, John Turturro and Edie Falco star in Gillian Robespierre’s new comedy, set in 1995.
2017-07-20.snippet: Jenny Slate, John Turturro and Edie Falco star in Gillian Robespierre’s new comedy, set in 1995.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Nostalgia is not what it used to be. “Landline,” a fairly genial, diffident comedy about diffident, fairly generic people, plants its flag in 1995 and surveys a landscape of indie rock, “Must See TV” and the high-waisted bluejeans that have recently started coming back into fashion. Hillary Clinton is on television, sporting a hairband and a pink suit.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: In ‘Landline,’ the Family That Strays Together

2017-07-20.abstract: A documentary finds a group of young people in violence-plagued Richmond, Calif., staging their own version of Romeo and Juliet’s romantic tragedy.
2017-07-20.snippet: A documentary finds a group of young people in violence-plagued Richmond, Calif., staging their own version of Romeo and Juliet’s romantic tragedy.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: “This ain’t got nothing to do with my life,” Donté Clark recalled thinking when, at 15, he picked up “Romeo and Juliet.” At 22, after years of seeing gang warfare and murder on the streets of his hometown, Richmond, Calif., he changed his mind. “That is our story,” he now says of the play. “It’s just told in Verona. In a different language, a different time period.”
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘Romeo Is Bleeding,’ and Shakespeare Is Relevant

2017-07-20.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-07-20.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Our recommendations this week include fare for readers of all ages and stages, starting with “Welcome: A Mo Willems Guide for New Arrivals,” a witty life manual for savvy infants and their attendant grown-ups. “Questions Asked” taps the philosophical tendencies of 5-year-olds and up — all the way up — by venturing playfully into unanswerable territory: “Can anyone do real magic tricks? Do miracles happen sometimes?” A debut Y.A. novel by Andrew McCarthy delves into a 15-year-old girl’s discovery of a family secret. And two books on Jane Austen explore her work, her stuff, her suitors and her legacy.
2017-07-20.headline_main: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week

2017-07-20.abstract: A new crime-thriller series, starring Jason Bateman and Laura Linney, takes some cues from ‘Breaking Bad’ but moves the action to Missouri.
2017-07-20.snippet: A new crime-thriller series, starring Jason Bateman and Laura Linney, takes some cues from ‘Breaking Bad’ but moves the action to Missouri.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Have you been missing Walter White? Are nine-year-old “Breaking Bad” episodes not satisfying your hunger for angry, middle-aged, white male antiheroes?
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: Netflix Is in the Woods With ‘Ozark’

2017-07-20.abstract: Two great French actresses, Catherine Deneuve and Catherine Frot, share the screen in this film about forgiveness and redemption.
2017-07-20.snippet: Two great French actresses, Catherine Deneuve and Catherine Frot, share the screen in this film about forgiveness and redemption.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Catherine Deneuve has played a wide variety of roles over the course of a career now spanning seven decades. But despite her exemplary range, many American viewers maintain an image of her as an aloof, exquisite, possibly imperious, possibly enigmatic beauty. This is largely because she looks like, well, Catherine Deneuve. The woman can’t help it. Even when portraying the needy, nearly shambolic Béatrice in “The Midwife,” Ms. Deneuve is capable of vibrating with an elegance that implies both hauteur and froideur.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘The Midwife’ Is Unflappable, Until the Past Blows In

2017-07-20.abstract: Officer James Frascatore decided on Thursday to proceed with a public disciplinary trial on charges stemming from the 2015 arrest in Midtown Manhattan of the retired tennis player.
2017-07-20.snippet: Officer James Frascatore decided on Thursday to proceed with a public disciplinary trial on charges stemming from the 2015 arrest in Midtown Manhattan of the retired tennis player.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: A New York police officer who tackled the retired tennis player James Blake outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel in a case of mistaken identity has decided not to take a deal that would have spared him a public disciplinary trial on charges of using excessive force during the 2015 encounter.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Officer Accused of Excessive Force in Arrest of James Blake Spurns Plea Deal

2017-07-20.abstract: A film about a prize for excellence in journalism and the arts shares some winners’ insights, but not enough.
2017-07-20.snippet: A film about a prize for excellence in journalism and the arts shares some winners’ insights, but not enough.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Although the Pulitzer Prizes go to literature and drama, they still don’t recognize cinema. But adding movies to the list might only raise questions. Who would judge? Should fiction and documentary receive separate awards?
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘The Pulitzer at 100’ Celebrates Awards More Than Winners

2017-07-20.abstract: In 1950s Estonia, a principal’s envy of a popular teacher leads him to start investigating his background.
2017-07-20.snippet: In 1950s Estonia, a principal’s envy of a popular teacher leads him to start investigating his background.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Inspirational teachers aren’t limited to any one time or place. “The Fencer,” a Finnish-Estonian-German coproduction drawn from a true story, may be set in Estonia in the early 1950s, when the Soviet Union occupied the country, but it follows squarely in the footsteps of “Dead Poets Society” and “Stand and Deliver.”
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: ‘The Fencer’ Is an Inspiring Figure in a Formulaic Tale

2017-07-20.abstract: The Italian directors Tizza Covi and Rainer Frimmel’s hybrid of a film follows a young man on a sort of odyssey across Italy.
2017-07-20.snippet: The Italian directors Tizza Covi and Rainer Frimmel’s hybrid of a film follows a young man on a sort of odyssey across Italy.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: The filmmaking team of Tizza Covi and Rainer Frimmel concoct fictional narratives around the real lives and professions of the nonactors with whom they work. This is an unusual formula but not an entirely novel one. While other examples of this method, or some variant of it, have yielded films that come off as condescending or creepily exploitative, Ms. Covi and Mr. Frimmel’s “Mister Universo” is a disarming and humane picture, an unexpected delight.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: Out of Luck, and Seeking a Strongman in ‘Mister Universo’

2017-07-20.abstract: A sequel to the 2015 TV movie about the children of Disney villains has music, colorful costumes and a lot of talk about hair.
2017-07-20.snippet: A sequel to the 2015 TV movie about the children of Disney villains has music, colorful costumes and a lot of talk about hair.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: The kids are largely on their own in “Descendants 2,” a sequel to the 2015 television movie about the children of Disney villains. That makes for a dumber film, but the target audience for this colorful tuneful fluff won’t care and may even consider it an improvement.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: In Disney’s ‘Descendants 2,’ the Kids Are on Their Own

2017-07-20.abstract: TV shows, movies and more have moved their promotional efforts off-site and off the charts. (Get ready for genetic swabbing, too.)
2017-07-20.snippet: TV shows, movies and more have moved their promotional efforts off-site and off the charts. (Get ready for genetic swabbing, too.)
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — A woman clad entirely in white greeted me with a robotic smile and a warning. “This may be disorienting,” she said. “Are you O.K. with that?” Inside a nearby display case were Old West weapons, including a sawed-off shotgun and a bowie knife. “Please select one,” she said brightly.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Bowie Knives and a Tick Head: Marketing Gets Elaborate at Comic-Con

2017-07-20.abstract: A deep-woods thriller stars Bruce Willis as the local police chief and features a bank robbery gone wrong.
2017-07-20.snippet: A deep-woods thriller stars Bruce Willis as the local police chief and features a bank robbery gone wrong.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: “First Kill,” a decently executed but generic thriller, is most notable for advancing the dubious theory that the best way to help a child who is being bullied is to traumatize the heck out of him.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Review: A Bullied Boy Gets a Hunting Lesson in ‘First Kill’

2017-07-20.abstract: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2017-07-20.snippet: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages — and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

2017-07-20.abstract: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.
2017-07-20.snippet: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Pop, Rock and Jazz in NYC This Week

2017-07-20.abstract: The lion was shot in Zimbabwe during what a researcher said was a legal hunt, two years after Cecil was killed by an American dentist.
2017-07-20.snippet: The lion was shot in Zimbabwe during what a researcher said was a legal hunt, two years after Cecil was killed by an American dentist.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Two years after Cecil the Lion was killed in a national park in Zimbabwe, sparking international outrage, his son Xanda was killed in a trophy hunt.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Cecil the Lion’s Son Xanda Killed by a Trophy Hunter

2017-07-20.abstract: To build a lasting fan base in the relentless world of espionage thrillers, Brad Thor has cranked out 17 books in 16 years, selling nearly 15 million copies.
2017-07-20.snippet: To build a lasting fan base in the relentless world of espionage thrillers, Brad Thor has cranked out 17 books in 16 years, selling nearly 15 million copies.

2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: On a leafy side street in East Harlem is a small park with a wrought-iron gate holding a heart-shaped design. To most, the heart is a charming architectural flourish, but to others, like Migene González-Wippler, it is indisputable proof of occult activity.
2017-07-20.headline_main: In an East Harlem Park, Valentine or Voodoo?

The fastest way to get to them is to burst through a wall as well as many of the worlds in the metropolis of Alpha (the city of the title).

2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: On MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” on Thursday, I presented charts explaining that while President Trump has been dispatching self-congratulatory tweets about his economic stewardship, he has little to brag about, apart from the stock market. The economy continues to grow and add jobs at roughly the same rate it did under President Barack Obama.
2017-07-20.headline_main: The Fading Trump Bump

2017-07-20.abstract: At the start of a conservative-dominated special legislative session in Austin, Democrats used songs, rallies and Hail Mary bills to resist and cope.
2017-07-20.snippet: At the start of a conservative-dominated special legislative session in Austin, Democrats used songs, rallies and Hail Mary bills to resist and cope.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — On the opening day of a special legislative session here Tuesday, a small circle of women stood in the Texas heat near the south steps of the Capitol, making soft, sweet and rebellious music.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Long-Suffering Texas Democrats Suffer On as Lawmakers Meet

2017-07-20.abstract: Over six decades, Mr. Lane built a global business by making it acceptable and chic for women to wear glittering jewelry of unabashed deception.
2017-07-20.snippet: Over six decades, Mr. Lane built a global business by making it acceptable and chic for women to wear glittering jewelry of unabashed deception.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Kenneth Jay Lane, the designer and bon vivant who built a global business from glittering acts of unabashed deception, producing fake and junk jewelry — or, as he liked to say, tongue in cheek, “faque” and “junque” — has died at his home in Manhattan. He was 85.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Kenneth Jay Lane, Jewelry Designer Who Made a Fortune Faking It, Dies at 85

2017-07-20.abstract: The photographer Lauren Welles sees a tableau of collective escape on the beach.
2017-07-20.snippet: The photographer Lauren Welles sees a tableau of collective escape on the beach.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: “I once started out to walk around the world,” the poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti wrote, “but ended up in Brooklyn.” Where he ended up, specifically, was Coney Island, a particular swath of America where “Jellybeans glowed in the semi-gloom” and he learned to fall “in love with unreality.”
2017-07-20.headline_main: Coney Island, Ever Changing

2017-07-20.abstract: Being the Garden State’s correspondent for the Metro desk can at times feel like being a far-flung foreign correspondent.
2017-07-20.snippet: Being the Garden State’s correspondent for the Metro desk can at times feel like being a far-flung foreign correspondent.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: There’s a calm sea breeze billowing near the New Jersey bureau of The New York Times, just offshore enough for some surfable summer waves. There’s also a decent Wi-Fi signal, the occasional parade, a basil and herb farm and a new roller coaster, though the cream-on-brown interior could use a more modern, pleasant upholstery.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Our Jersey Boy

2017-07-20.abstract: Joseph Lhota’s comments came on the heels of another acrimonious exchange between Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio.
2017-07-20.snippet: Joseph Lhota’s comments came on the heels of another acrimonious exchange between Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: With New York City’s transportation system in a state of crisis, the head of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Thursday that it was time for City Hall to contribute more money to repairing and maintaining the subway system that is the lifeblood of the city.
2017-07-20.headline_main: M.T.A. Chief Calls on New York City to Give More to Help Subway System

2017-07-20.abstract: Mr. Grenell, who worked for President George W. Bush and Senator John McCain, would be the first openly gay appointee in the Trump administration.
2017-07-20.snippet: Mr. Grenell, who worked for President George W. Bush and Senator John McCain, would be the first openly gay appointee in the Trump administration.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has offered the post of United States ambassador to Germany to Richard Grenell, a former diplomatic aide to President George W. Bush and a Republican strategist who once worked for Senator John McCain, two people briefed on the conversation said on Thursday.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Trump Picks Richard Grenell, Former Diplomatic Aide, as Envoy to Germany

2017-07-20.abstract: Set in an America where slavery still exists, the show, from the “Game of Thrones” creators, has prompted concerns about its mixture of race, politics and history.
2017-07-20.snippet: Set in an America where slavery still exists, the show, from the “Game of Thrones” creators, has prompted concerns about its mixture of race, politics and history.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: It was supposed to be HBO’s next big thing: a high-concept drama from the creators of “Game of Thrones,” set in an alternate America, where the Southern states had seceded from the Union and slavery continued into the present day.
2017-07-20.headline_main: ‘Confederate’ Poses Test Over Race for ‘Game of Thrones’ Creators and HBO

2017-07-20.abstract: In a time of binge-watching and media overload, a streaming site hosts just one film each week, complementing it with a few other special features.
2017-07-20.snippet: In a time of binge-watching and media overload, a streaming site hosts just one film each week, complementing it with a few other special features.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: One certainty of watching movies on streaming services is uncertainty. It’s difficult to know when some movies are going to show up on specific sites and, even more crucial, when they’re going to be dropped from a site. A subscriber may find an attractive prospect, put it on a watch list and then later see that it’s no longer available. Like in that old Dion song, you just looked around, and it’s gone.
2017-07-20.headline_main: Le CiNéMa Club Presents Its Movie of the Week. What?

2017-07-20.abstract: Glioblastoma is an aggressive cancer, so my way of dealing with it is aggressive. Aggressively positive.
2017-07-20.snippet: Glioblastoma is an aggressive cancer, so my way of dealing with it is aggressive. Aggressively positive.
2017-07-20.lead_paragraph: Millions of Americans will be wondering how Senator John McCain is coping with the news that he has an aggressive form of brain cancer known as glioblastoma. I certainly am: I found out that I had the same type of deadly tumor 18 months ago.
2017-07-20.headline_main: John McCain’s Brain Cancer, and Mine

2017-07-21.abstract: An offhand remark at an Upper East Side bistro pays dividends.
2017-07-21.snippet: An offhand remark at an Upper East Side bistro pays dividends.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-07-21.headline_main: Picking Up the Tab

2017-07-21.abstract: A few players are doing far better than usual, the numbers show, but the team over all does not seem destined to fall.
2017-07-21.snippet: A few players are doing far better than usual, the numbers show, but the team over all does not seem destined to fall.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: The Dodgers have won a stunning 30 of their last 34 games, including 11 in a row, going into Thursday night’s game against the Braves. Their 66-29 record leads all teams and would translate to a 113-win season should they keep it up.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Surprised by Dodgers? Well, It’s Not Just Overachievers

2017-07-21.abstract: Exhibit A for investors bullish on the company’s future helped profitability last quarter more than double from a year ago.
2017-07-21.snippet: Exhibit A for investors bullish on the company’s future helped profitability last quarter more than double from a year ago.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — A few years ago, Microsoft appeared to be another tech has-been, having whiffed on its efforts to compete in mobile phones and internet search. Although it is too soon to say whether Microsoft can pull off a full-blown renaissance the way Apple has, the company is firmly back in favor.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Microsoft Is Rewarded for Turning to the Cloud

2017-07-21.abstract: Once again, in the middle of contentious health care deliberations, a larger-than-life figure in the Senate has learned he has brain cancer.
2017-07-21.snippet: Once again, in the middle of contentious health care deliberations, a larger-than-life figure in the Senate has learned he has brain cancer.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The circumstances are eerily similar. In the middle of contentious health care deliberations, a larger-than-life figure in the Senate learns he has a very serious form of brain cancer. A leading voice goes quiet and the Senate suffers for it.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Eerie Parallels Between John McCain and Edward Kennedy

2017-07-21.abstract: The Trump administration took $3 million off the motorcycle maker’s fine in a pollution case, applying a new policy barring benefits to third parties.
2017-07-21.snippet: The Trump administration took $3 million off the motorcycle maker’s fine in a pollution case, applying a new policy barring benefits to third parties.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Last year the United States government fined Harley-Davidson $15 million for selling devices that shut down its motorcycles’ emissions controls — and said part of that money would go toward a project to reduce pollution from wood-fired stoves.
2017-07-21.headline_main: U.S. Reopens Harley Settlement, Cutting Funds for Pollution Reduction Plan

2017-07-21.abstract: In addition to saying that Justine Damond shouldn’t have been shot, the authorities questioned why the officers’ body cameras weren’t turned on.
2017-07-21.snippet: In addition to saying that Justine Damond shouldn’t have been shot, the authorities questioned why the officers’ body cameras weren’t turned on.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — The mayor and the police chief of this city said on Thursday that Justine Damond, an unarmed Australian woman killed last weekend by a Minneapolis police officer, should not have been shot. The blunt and public critiques were the strongest condemnations yet from officials here, but the mayor and the chief stopped short of calling the shooting legally unjustified.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Woman Shot by Minneapolis Officer ‘Didn’t Have to Die,’ Police Chief Says

2017-07-21.abstract: Lloyd McKenzie is accused of orchestrating the 2012 killing of Brandon Woodard in Midtown Manhattan, but the trial did not reveal who pulled the trigger.
2017-07-21.snippet: Lloyd McKenzie is accused of orchestrating the 2012 killing of Brandon Woodard in Midtown Manhattan, but the trial did not reveal who pulled the trigger.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: For two months, the mother of Brandon L. Woodard, a California man openly killed on a busy street in Midtown, has sat in Part 42 of State Supreme Court in Manhattan, taking notes on an assortment of pads and a worn calendar.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Years After Son’s Killing on Busy Street, Trial Brings Mother No Solace

2017-07-21.abstract: In a sign of a looming showdown with the special counsel, presidential aides are looking for information to get investigators recused or justify firing him.
2017-07-21.snippet: In a sign of a looming showdown with the special counsel, presidential aides are looking for information to get investigators recused or justify firing him.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s lawyers and aides are scouring the professional and political backgrounds of investigators hired by the special counsel Robert S. Mueller III, looking for conflicts of interest they could use to discredit the investigation — or even build a case to fire Mr. Mueller or get some members of his team recused, according to three people with knowledge of the research effort.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Trump Aides, Seeking Leverage, Investigate Mueller’s Investigators

2017-07-21.abstract: Through community effort, a street for fun and games, a summer tradition cut by City Hall, reopened in time for hot summer days.
2017-07-21.snippet: Through community effort, a street for fun and games, a summer tradition cut by City Hall, reopened in time for hot summer days.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Running water, squealing children, a Bronx street planted in the heart and heat of a July morning. All together, summer’s trumpets sounded bright and loud Thursday along 196th Street in the Bronx, despite official indifference or bumbling.
2017-07-21.headline_main: In the Bronx, Fighting for the Right to Play

2017-07-21.abstract: In an interview with The Times, the president attacks those who could hold him to account.
2017-07-21.snippet: In an interview with The Times, the president attacks those who could hold him to account.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: In less than an hour on Wednesday afternoon, President Trump found a way to impugn the integrity and threaten the livelihoods of nearly all of the country’s top law enforcement officials, including some he appointed, for one simple reason: They swore an oath to defend the Constitution, not him.
2017-07-21.headline_main: President Trump’s Contempt for the Rule of Law

2017-07-21.abstract: Abdulaziz al-Huwairini, a veteran security officer, has been chosen to lead a new organization that will aim to combat domestic terrorism “with a high degree of flexibility and readiness.”
2017-07-21.snippet: Abdulaziz al-Huwairini, a veteran security officer, has been chosen to lead a new organization that will aim to combat domestic terrorism “with a high degree of flexibility and readiness.”
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: AMMAN, Jordan — Saudi Arabia announced on Thursday a big promotion for a veteran security officer who United States officials recently said was without a job and confined to his home.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Saudi Official Who Was Thought to Be Under House Arrest Receives a Promotion

2017-07-21.abstract: Mr. Bennington, who died at 41, could sing any way he wanted — guttural and anguished or dreamlike and sweet.
2017-07-21.snippet: Mr. Bennington, who died at 41, could sing any way he wanted — guttural and anguished or dreamlike and sweet.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Beginning in 2000, Linkin Park brought the collision of hard rock and hip-hop to its commercial and aesthetic peak, with its lead singer, Chester Bennington, delivering intense, almost physically palpable emotion alongside the grounded rapping of Mike Shinoda.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Chester Bennington Brought Rock Ferocity to Linkin Park’s Innovations

2017-07-21.abstract: Kids these days, am I right? Oh yes, and Paolo Pasco is back.
2017-07-21.snippet: Kids these days, am I right? Oh yes, and Paolo Pasco is back.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: FRIDAY PUZZLE — Kids these days, am I right? I happen to be the general manager of two of them, not counting the subcontractors that they call their friends, and the one thing I know is that if I say something is black, they will say that it is white. Just to be contrary. Just to rebel, in their own way. And then they will laugh and teleport off somewhere by doing something to their phones that I don’t understand.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Frequent Fodder for Crossword Clues

2017-07-21.abstract: Doug Williams, a sportscaster, acknowledges he is not as well known as his father, Brian, or sister, Allison. “I enjoy being the ‘other one,’” he says.
2017-07-21.snippet: Doug Williams, a sportscaster, acknowledges he is not as well known as his father, Brian, or sister, Allison. “I enjoy being the ‘other one,’” he says.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: On a recent afternoon in the sun-soaked downtown Manhattan office of SNY, the local sports cable channel, Doug Williams was easy to spot.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Another Williams Takes His Turn Before the Camera, at SNY

2017-07-21.abstract: Sentiment in a Pennsylvania county has tracked with a national shift in opinion about the Affordable Care Act amid fears that millions could lose coverage.
2017-07-21.snippet: Sentiment in a Pennsylvania county has tracked with a national shift in opinion about the Affordable Care Act amid fears that millions could lose coverage.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: DOYLESTOWN, Pa. — Five years ago, the Affordable Care Act had yet to begin its expansion of health insurance to millions of Americans, but Jeff Brahin was already stewing about it.
2017-07-21.headline_main: These Americans Hated the Health Law. Until the Idea of Repeal Sank In.

2017-07-21.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Friday, July 21, 2017.
2017-07-21.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Friday, July 21, 2017.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: “If the condition doesn’t kill you, the stress of having it does, in this country.”
2017-07-21.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: They Hated the Health Law. Until the Idea of Repeal Sank In.

2017-07-21.abstract: Though he wore uniform No. 21 with his previous two teams, the newest Frazier on the Yankees squad will be bumped up to No. 29.
2017-07-21.snippet: Though he wore uniform No. 21 with his previous two teams, the newest Frazier on the Yankees squad will be bumped up to No. 29.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The symmetry was too hard for Todd Frazier, the grown-up freckle-faced kid from Toms River, N.J., to ignore.
2017-07-21.headline_main: No No. 21 for Todd Frazier. Instead, He’ll Settle for No. 29.

2017-07-21.abstract: The Islamic State’s central command in Syria has sent tens of thousands of dollars to groups that seized a southern Philippine city, a research group said.
2017-07-21.snippet: The Islamic State’s central command in Syria has sent tens of thousands of dollars to groups that seized a southern Philippine city, a research group said.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: JAKARTA, Indonesia — The central command of the Islamic State in Syria has funneled tens of thousands of dollars to militants in the Philippines over the last year, most likely aiding their spectacular seizure of the southern Philippine city of Marawi, a report released Friday said.
2017-07-21.headline_main: ISIS’ Core Helps Fund Militants in Philippines, Report Says

2017-07-21.abstract: Anthony Scaramucci, who successfully rebutted a CNN story about the Trump campaign’s ties to Russia, may lead the White House’s communications strategy.
2017-07-21.snippet: Anthony Scaramucci, who successfully rebutted a CNN story about the Trump campaign’s ties to Russia, may lead the White House’s communications strategy.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump is expected to name Anthony Scaramucci, a major Republican donor and investor, as his new communications director, a senior administration official said on Thursday.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Trump May Turn to Anthony Scaramucci for White House Communications Post

2017-07-21.abstract: The app “changes friendships and makes them more transactional,” one user said. “It’s nickel-and-diming everything, literally.”
2017-07-21.snippet: The app “changes friendships and makes them more transactional,” one user said. “It’s nickel-and-diming everything, literally.”
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Margaret Pennoyer, an elementary school teacher in Manhattan, had just returned from a bachelorette party in Napa Valley when she received an email that had been sent to all the guests. The two organizers had itemized each woman’s individual expenses, which they had covered, and requested reimbursement through Venmo, an app that transfers money between users who have linked their bank accounts to their phones. Ms. Pennoyer owed $31.98 to one woman and $20.62 to the other.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Thanks to Venmo, We Now All Know How Cheap Our Friends Are

2017-07-21.abstract: A spurned woman confronts the question: When you lose love, should you even try to get over it?
2017-07-21.snippet: A spurned woman confronts the question: When you lose love, should you even try to get over it?
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: The first time he slept over was an accident. He came to watch a movie, which for me became an exercise in remaining perfectly still while I focused on the proximity of his legs. After the credits rolled, we talked until dawn. Then he began listing his hesitations about “us,” even though we had never touched.
2017-07-21.headline_main: The 12-Hour Goodbye That Started Everything

2017-07-21.abstract: Reports say the United States is being inundated with foreign travelers, but many British Muslims are holding back because of the travel ban.
2017-07-21.snippet: Reports say the United States is being inundated with foreign travelers, but many British Muslims are holding back because of the travel ban.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Sulaika Abokor, a Somali-born elementary-school teacher in London, dreams of “a road trip from Seattle to California.” The 34-year-old was planning a vacation to Seattle this summer to see a friend who was recently married. She fell in love with the green, outdoorsy city when she last visited in 2010. But, because of the Trump administration’s travel ban prohibiting most visitors from six predominantly Muslim countries, she now says, “That’s not going to happen.”
2017-07-21.headline_main: Traveling to America While Muslim

2017-07-21.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-07-21.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

2017-07-21.abstract: Jason Bateman plays an angry white money launderer trying to save his life at the Lake of the Ozarks. And Disney adds some new villain kids to its popular fairy-tale mix.
2017-07-21.snippet: Jason Bateman plays an angry white money launderer trying to save his life at the Lake of the Ozarks. And Disney adds some new villain kids to its popular fairy-tale mix.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Still longing for the middle-age male angst of “Breaking Bad”? Check out “Ozark,” starring Jason Bateman as an angry money launderer. “Dunkirk,” a BBC docudrama on BritBox, looks back at the World War II escape by British soldiers. And Disney adds some new villain kids to the fairy-tale mix in “Descendants 2.”

2017-07-21.abstract: Generals resist budget cuts and other officials may follow suit. But France voted for change and the French president seems willing to provide it.
2017-07-21.snippet: Generals resist budget cuts and other officials may follow suit. But France voted for change and the French president seems willing to provide it.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Emmanuel Macron’s entry to the French presidential stage was about as exciting and theatrical as electoral politics gets. Rising from relative obscurity, he seized the Élysée Palace and the National Assembly with huge majorities. He was the wunderkind, at 39 the youngest French head of state since Napoléon, promising radical economic change while restoring the presidency to a Jupiterian level, in his words, after the garish “bling bling” of Nicolas Sarkozy and the tawdry “normality” of François Hollande.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Mr. Macron Starts Making Waves

2017-07-21.abstract: The Trump administration is the worst possible messenger. But its message is the right one.
2017-07-21.snippet: The Trump administration is the worst possible messenger. But its message is the right one.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Leading Democrats in Congress, activists and many survivors of sexual assault are up in arms about possible plans by the Department of Education to overhaul federal policies on campus sexual assault instituted by the Obama administration. They say those changes will weaken protections for survivors, that they will embolden misogynist fringe groups and that they will turn back the clock to a time when rape was ignored.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Betsy DeVos Is Right: Sexual Assault Policy Is Broken

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: At dawn the woodpeckers start in, hammering heads against tree trunks, and you wonder if there’s a better way for a bird to make a living. Oh, the avian migraines. Twilight lingers till nearly 11 p.m.; if there’s a decent moon, you can fish in the silver light of Montana’s longest days.

The man lunges out of the way, but it’s too late: The truck runs him over, causing serious injury. Absent government misconduct, the man would have been just fine.

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Elise writes: My boyfriend, Colin, is a wonderful Scrabble player and often beats me. At the end, he hides the score from me, as he feels that is more sportsmanlike. But I want to know what the score was — win or lose. Is it better to dull the blow by pretending the score doesn’t matter, or should he just tell me how the game played out?

2017-07-21.abstract: Ask before touching. Never diagnose illness or predict death.
2017-07-21.snippet: Ask before touching. Never diagnose illness or predict death.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: ‘‘When you look at someone’s hands, you can see their character in an instant,’’ says Mark Seltman, who has been a palm reader for 40 years, mostly at corporate events and parties in Manhattan. Ask the person to hold up both hands, with his or her palms near your eyes. Focus mostly on the dominant hand. Note shapes, proportions and color. Each person’s palmar creases are believed to be unique, like fingerprints.
2017-07-21.headline_main: How to Read Palms

2017-07-21.abstract: A old story about Elvis Presley inspires a striking line in a new song.
2017-07-21.snippet: A old story about Elvis Presley inspires a striking line in a new song.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: This song lyric happens to be based on a true story. According to Peter Guralnick’s ‘‘Careless Love: The Unmaking of Elvis Presley,’’ the singer did in fact see the face of Stalin in a cloud, in 1965, while driving a bus full of associates through Arizona — and he was in fact deeply unsettled. Then he watched as the cloud transformed into the smiling face of Christ, at which point he pulled over the bus and (according to one of those associates) ran out into the desert weeping, in a state of profound spiritual exaltation. This song isn’t even the first to be written about the experience: There is also, at the very least, Al Stewart’s ‘‘Elvis at the Wheel,’’ from 2008, which imagines Presley as something like Paul the Apostle on the way to Damascus, ‘‘shaking in his footsteps/on the dusty desert road.’’
2017-07-21.headline_main: New Sentences: From Protomartyr’s ‘A Private Understanding’

2017-07-21.abstract: Three books trace the highs and the (very) lows of love and marriage, says our memoir columnist, Meghan Daum.
2017-07-21.snippet: Three books trace the highs and the (very) lows of love and marriage, says our memoir columnist, Meghan Daum.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Marriage takes work. We know, we know! But how do you tell the difference between the work required of any committed relationship and a life sentence of hard labor? A realist might say that if you’re happy 51 percent of the time then you’re ahead of the game, though anyone who’s faced such a conundrum knows it’s hard to apply a metric to domestic despair — or bliss, for that matter. This summer, two memoirs about marriages that take abrupt and chaos-inducing turns may instill a new appreciation for the placidity (or monotony) of your own partnership. A third book, which attempts to uncover the secrets of lasting intimacy, leaves readers with more questions than answers, but that’s pretty much the idea.
2017-07-21.headline_main: New in Memoir: Lessons in Falling in Love, and 2 Accounts of Its Horrors

When her daughter got a little older, Ms. Joefield outfitted the bedroom in their apartment with a princess bed for Deja, while she slept on a pullout couch.

2017-07-21.snippet: Selected by Terrance Hayes.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: John Coltrane once said that he doesn’t play ‘‘jazz’’; he plays only ‘‘John Coltrane.’’ Similarly, Mary Jo Bang writes in her own Mary Jo Banguage. She is a beguiling poet who makes beguiling music with a beguiling mind, but what sort of poem is ‘‘The Chess Set on a Table Between Two Chairs’’? It almost resists being a poem. It’s strange, personal, poemish. And this may be evidence that an entire memoir can be condensed into a single paragraph. Selected by Terrance Hayes

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: It’s Thanksgiving Day in Richard Lange’s latest novel, THE SMACK (Mulholland/Little, Brown, $26), and Rowan Petty is doing what he always does on a national holiday and every other day — swindling gullible people out of their hard-earned cash. “I talk chumps out of their money,” admits Petty, a grifter so down on his luck he has to work his current hustle from a crummy hotel on the Reno strip. When Dandy Don O’Keefe, a fellow con artist, tips him off about a more lucrative scam in Los Angeles, Petty hits the road with a hooker who calls herself Tinafey and is too cute for words.

2017-07-21.abstract: “Down a Dark Road” is the ninth book in Linda Castillo’s series. “I love the juxtaposition of such a bucolic setting and the introduction of evil,” she says.
2017-07-21.snippet: “Down a Dark Road” is the ninth book in Linda Castillo’s series. “I love the juxtaposition of such a bucolic setting and the introduction of evil,” she says.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: BUCOLIC EVIL: “Word has gotten out that if you write about the Amish, you can sell books.” So says a young Amish woman quoted in Valerie Weaver-Zercher’s 2013 study, “Thrill of the Chaste,” about the popularity of Amish-themed romance novels — and, to judge from the success of the crime writer Linda Castillo, what’s true of romance is also true of murder. Castillo’s best-selling Kate Burkholder mysteries feature the police chief of a fictional Amish town, Painters Mill, Ohio; the ninth entry in the series, “Down a Dark Road,” enters the hardcover fiction list at No. 14.

2017-07-21.snippet: The 30-year resident of Roosevelt Island reads the obits, talks to her favorite plant, swims, gardens and makes art.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Arline Jacoby is an artist, art teacher and founder of the Roosevelt Island Visual Art Association (RIVAA), a collective of about 35 artists who are working to establish an art center on the island. Ms. Jacoby lives alone, in a high-rise above Gallery RIVAA on Roosevelt Island, where she has been a resident for over 30 years. When asked her birth date, she demurred. “I don’t tell people because then they judge you,” she said. “And I’m much more capable than my age.”

2017-07-21.abstract: Track fires, which cause significant subway delays, overwhelmingly have a single cause: trash. There is a simple way to reduce it.
2017-07-21.snippet: Track fires, which cause significant subway delays, overwhelmingly have a single cause: trash. There is a simple way to reduce it.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Early last Monday, on the 19th day of the New York City subway system’s designated state of emergency, on a morning in which one’s prevailing hope was to arrive quickly at a polar-chilled office, a track fire erupted near the 145th Street station, on the A line. The system, now 113 years old, does not absorb these disruptions easily; service was halted on several other lines. Nine people were taken to the hospital for treatment of minor injuries. Many morning meetings, it was safe to assume, were sparsely attended.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Subway Delays and the Power of Shame

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Buying an apartment in a co-op is an exercise in financial exhibitionism. A board combs through your bank statements, tax returns and testimonials and then, if you pass muster, grants you access to its cloistered world.

2017-07-21.abstract: If you have decided to switch from PC to Mac (or vice versa), Apple, Microsoft and other software makers can make the transfer process easier than you might think.

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Q. I have been a dedicated PC user since the mid-1980s and have only used Windows-based computers, but I am now contemplating a switch to Apple and have concerns. Will my external backup drives be accessed smoothly once connected to a Mac? I don’t use the cloud because I don’t want my stuff out there and don’t want any additional storage expenses. How do I transfer my desktop items, Google bookmarks, etc.? Will I still be able to use Chrome?

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Two years ago the Oregon songwriter and performer Colin Meloy heard, and fell in love with, the music of the English folk artist Olivia Chaney. He invited Ms. Chaney to collaborate with his band, the Decemberists; the two acts ultimately merged to form Offa Rex, a new group whose excellent debut album, “The Queen of Hearts,” arrived last week. At this Wednesday night concert, expect to hear the British folk covers from the album, as well as reinterpreted songs from Ms. Chaney’s and the Decemberists’ catalogs. SIMON VOZICK-LEVINSON

2017-07-21.snippet: Born to royalty in Burma, Olive Yang, who died last week at 90, rejected her birthright to become a cross-dressing warlord and opium trafficker.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: MUSE, Myanmar — She was born to royalty in British colonial Burma, but rejected that life to become a cross-dressing warlord whose C.I.A.-supplied army established opium trade routes across the Golden Triangle. By the time of her death, last week at 90, she had led hundreds of men, endured prison and torture, generated gossip for her relationship with a film actress and, finally, helped forge a truce between ethnic rebels and the government.
2017-07-21.headline_main: The Female Warlord Who Had C.I.A. Connections and Opium Routes

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: The fashion brand Vetements has never been known to follow the status quo. Beginning today, the brand unveils a window installation at Saks Fifth Avenue’s New York flagship that is anything but a typical department store display: A mountain of old clothing — a combination of donations from Saks employees and out-of-stock merchandise — fills the windows and serves as a kind of direct message on consumerism. The pile will grow every night until August 10, when the items will be donated to RewearABLE, a green clothing initiative that benefits adults with developmental disabilities. Saks Fifth Avenue, 611 Fifth Ave. — ISABEL WILKINSON

2017-07-21.snippet: Gary Panter — known for his punk graphics, the sets of “Pee-wee’s Playhouse” and Jimbo — returns to graphic novels with a phantasmagoric take on “Paradise Regained.”
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Gary Panter is a painter first. But he’s still probably best known for the wild and woolly comics he started scrawling back in the late 1970s and early ’80s for the likes of the Los Angeles punk zine Slash, and Françoise Mouly and Art Spiegelman’s Raw magazine. The Comics Journal has even called him “the greatest living cartoonist.”
2017-07-21.headline_main: When a Comic Book Hillbilly and Milton Collide

2017-07-21.headline_main: Shopping for Low Stools

2017-07-21.snippet: The difficult conditions at the Open accentuate the utility of caddies, who do more than help with choice of club.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: SOUTHPORT, England — At the 12th hole at Royal Birkdale, a 183-yard par 3 with a green long and narrow like a Band-Aid, Matt Kuchar pulled a mid-iron from his bag. As he stood over the ball during the second round of the British Open on Friday, the crosswinds morphed into crossbones.
2017-07-21.headline_main: At British Open, Caddies Have Their Golfers’ Bags, and Backs

2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Today, after 183 days, 58 news conferences, one perfect “Saturday Night Live” skewering, and countless packs of stress gum, Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, has resigned. But first, he slammed the door in an ABC News reporter’s face.

She knew for sure that she was when she took a breath during the final 100 meters of freestyle and caught a glimpse of her college coach, Greg Meehan.
2017-07-21.headline_main: The Shepherd of High-Achieving Swimmers

2017-07-21.snippet: The answer is not clear because no president has ever tried to pardon himself. Some experts say a presidential abuse of pardons could invite prosecution.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has consulted his legal advisers about the possibility of pre-emptively pardoning his associates — and possibly even himself — to undermine the Justice Department’s Russia investigation, The Washington Post reported Thursday night. But on Friday, John Dowd, Mr. Trump’s new personal lawyer, denied to BuzzFeed that any such discussions had taken place.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Can Trump Pardon Himself? Explaining Presidential Clemency Powers

2017-07-21.abstract: Kyra Sedgwick directs her husband, Kevin Bacon, in a Lifetime movie about a teenage victim of slut-shaming.
2017-07-21.snippet: Kyra Sedgwick directs her husband, Kevin Bacon, in a Lifetime movie about a teenage victim of slut-shaming.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Kyra Sedgwick, an Emmy winner as an actress for “The Closer,” proves to have a sensitive touch as a first-time director as well, with “Story of a Girl,” a Lifetime movie on Sunday whose cast includes her husband, Kevin Bacon. Lifetime churns out a lot of movies, and many of them exhibit an assembly-line superficiality, but this tale of a teenager’s long struggle to overcome a slut-shaming incident is delicately told and acted.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Review: ‘Story of a Girl,’ on Overcoming Viral Infamy

2017-07-21.abstract: A tour of savage, skeptical productions in France, Germany and Switzerland shows a range of artists dissatisfied with the state of the world.
2017-07-21.snippet: A tour of savage, skeptical productions in France, Germany and Switzerland shows a range of artists dissatisfied with the state of the world.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: Beneath the artifice, the virtuosic singing and the foreign languages, opera’s stories are deeply familiar: tales of love, loss and duty that anyone could identify with. But lately, there’s another way that opera has been recognizable to many in its audiences: its dissatisfaction with the state of the world.
2017-07-21.headline_main: In Europe, Opera Takes On Our Time

2017-07-21.abstract: President Trump's communications machine has had a major shake-up. Here's a rundown of the people that promote his message.
2017-07-21.snippet: President Trump's communications machine has had a major shake-up. Here's a rundown of the people that promote his message.
2017-07-21.lead_paragraph: President Trump may be the White House communicator-in-chief, but he still relies on a number of associates, both inside the West Wing and on the sidelines, to spar with reporters and amplify his message. With the arrival of Anthony Scaramucci, Sean Spicer’s abrupt departure and the quick promotion of Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the Trump message machine looks a bit different now. Here’s a rundown of the people in the president’s messaging orbit.
2017-07-21.headline_main: Trump’s Communications Orbit

But the clock is ticking on his plans.

2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — A day after vowing to stay in his job despite a reproof from the president, Attorney General Jeff Sessions pressed his immigration agenda on Friday in Philadelphia, a so-called sanctuary city that limits its cooperation with federal immigration authorities.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Sessions Presses Immigration Agenda in Philadelphia, a Sanctuary City

2017-07-22.abstract: The ancient virtue of prudence once meant the wisdom to do the right thing. Now we use it to do nothing at all.
2017-07-22.snippet: The ancient virtue of prudence once meant the wisdom to do the right thing. Now we use it to do nothing at all.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: BACK in the late 1980s, Dana Carvey of “Saturday Night Live” used to do a funny impression of President George H. W. Bush, in which the character would justify his own supposed timidity by muttering “wouldn’t be prudent” to himself about every small risk. The impression neatly captured the contemporary notion of prudence: faintheartedness, caution and a general bias against action.
2017-07-22.headline_main: How the Modern World Made Cowards of Us All

2017-07-22.abstract: A judge ordered the state to pay couples’ lawyer fees after a county clerk, Kim Davis, refused to issue marriage licenses.
2017-07-22.snippet: A judge ordered the state to pay couples’ lawyer fees after a county clerk, Kim Davis, refused to issue marriage licenses.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday ordered Kentucky to pay more than $224,000 in legal fees and costs because one of its county clerks had refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Kentucky Must Pay $224,000 After Dispute Over Same-Sex Marriage Licenses

2017-07-22.abstract: The oil company, punished for violating sanctions against Russia, is fighting a wider threat to its reputation and the possibility of other sanctions to come.
2017-07-22.snippet: The oil company, punished for violating sanctions against Russia, is fighting a wider threat to its reputation and the possibility of other sanctions to come.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The $2 million fine that the Treasury Department levied on Exxon Mobil this week for violating sanctions against Russia is just a sliver of the oil company’s $7.8 billion in profit last year. But Exxon has decided nonetheless to wage a legal battle — one that could make President Trump’s cabinet meetings decidedly awkward.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Stakes for Exxon in Sanctions Case Go Far Beyond a $2 Million Fine

2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Q. My mother’s husband has had a rent-stabilized apartment in Midtown Manhattan since the 1970s. My mother  married him and moved into the apartment in the 1980s. He is now 85 and suffers from dementia. Since she cannot provide the daily care that he needs, my mother has decided to place him in a  nursing facility. The landlord told my mother that she is “not on the lease,” and since the lease renewal her husband signed is for only two years, if he should die during that time, my mother would not have a home. I do not think this can possibly be true. They’ve been married for nearly 30 years. What can she do?

2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: For all that we don’t know about President Trump’s dealings with Russia, one thing should now be clear: Jared Kushner should not be working in the White House, and he should not have a security clearance.

2017-07-22.abstract: The moral and medical costs of coming between parents and their dying child.

2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: In the case of Charlie Gard, the dying British infant whose parents are being denied the right to attempt a long-shot treatment despite having a willing doctor and the money to pay for it, there is a hard question and an easy one.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Charlie Gard and the Experts

2017-07-22.snippet: In memoriam, Sean Spicer. We hardly believed ye.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has finally found a courtier who can give him the buttery, boundless respect he craves.
2017-07-22.headline_main: The Mooch and the Mogul

2017-07-22.abstract: He throws his weight around. Then floats above it all. But gravity has a way of catching up.
2017-07-22.snippet: He throws his weight around. Then floats above it all. But gravity has a way of catching up.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: On Monday, Jared Kushner is set to appear before the Senate Intelligence Committee, but not so that we can listen. Not so that we can watch. It’s a closed-door affair, meaning that unlike Jeff Sessions, Kushner gets to dance in the dark.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Jared Kushner, the Prince of Having It Both Ways

2017-07-22.abstract: The president promised an “America First” foreign policy, but he’s taken on something far more ambitious.
