2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: How did Donald Trump come to speak for Western civilization?
2017-07-22.headline_main: Donald Trump’s Plan to Save Western Civilization

2017-07-22.abstract: Rather than churning out false promises of big factory revival, Mr. Trump should be driving manufacturing’s real-life future.
2017-07-22.snippet: Rather than churning out false promises of big factory revival, Mr. Trump should be driving manufacturing’s real-life future.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: If President Trump were a factory, it would be a wheezing, noisy operation churning out tired old ideas. His meaningless pledges to revive the “rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones” that he mourned at his inauguration ignore the promise American manufacturing holds in the real world.
2017-07-22.headline_main: President Trump and His Way-Back Machine

2017-07-22.abstract: Fraud is essentially nonexistent, but that hasn’t stopped the crusaders from trying to make voting harder.
2017-07-22.snippet: Fraud is essentially nonexistent, but that hasn’t stopped the crusaders from trying to make voting harder.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: The truth can’t be repeated often enough: The Presidential Advisory Commission on Election Integrity, which held its first meeting last week, is a sham and a scam.
2017-07-22.headline_main: The Bogus Voter-Fraud Commission

2017-07-22.abstract: It becomes more fantastical each time Mr. Trump brings it up. But that may not keep Congress from throwing bags of money at it.
2017-07-22.snippet: It becomes more fantastical each time Mr. Trump brings it up. But that may not keep Congress from throwing bags of money at it.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Every time President Trump revamps his campaign promise to build that “tall, powerful, beautiful” wall along the Mexican border he sounds increasingly like a developer ruminating over the blueprints for mythic Xanadu.
2017-07-22.headline_main: The Wall With Mexico, and Xanadu

2017-07-22.abstract: I found the heart of my own country in a classroom full of newcomers.
2017-07-22.snippet: I found the heart of my own country in a classroom full of newcomers.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — In 2015, just as refugees were pouring out of Syria and pictures of terrified children filled every newscast and front page in the world, a small notice appeared in my church bulletin: “Are you looking for a way to help our city’s newest refugees?” It was a call for volunteers to assist in an English-language classroom at a local public school. I was once a high school literature teacher, so I saved it, planning to follow through whenever life slowed down a little. More than a year later, I was still dithering. The day after Donald Trump was elected, I finally volunteered.
2017-07-22.headline_main: What Is America to Me?

2017-07-22.abstract: About half of Ethiopia’s youth are thought to chew khat, a psychotropic leaf. Officials consider such widespread use of the drug, blamed on a lack of work, “a huge problem” for the country’s future.
2017-07-22.snippet: About half of Ethiopia’s youth are thought to chew khat, a psychotropic leaf. Officials consider such widespread use of the drug, blamed on a lack of work, “a huge problem” for the country’s future.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: BAHIR DAR, Ethiopia — Her life revolves around a psychotropic leaf.
2017-07-22.headline_main: For Ethiopia’s Underemployed Youth, Life Can Center on a Leaf

2017-07-22.abstract: Many longtime residents have lost their homes unfairly.
2017-07-22.snippet: Many longtime residents have lost their homes unfairly.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: FIFTY years ago on Sunday the Detroit uprising began. Five days of violence left more than 1,400 buildings burned, more than 7,000 people arrested and 43 people dead — 33 African-Americans and 10 whites. TV sets transported images of cars and buildings engulfed in orange flames and black smoke into American living rooms. After the uprising, whites and middle-class African-Americans fled the city, leaving poor and working-class African-American families to fend for themselves.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Don’t Let Detroit’s Revival Rest on an Injustice

2017-07-22.abstract: A debate over how many visas the United States should issue to seasonal workers has stranded thousands in Mexico with diminished job prospects.
2017-07-22.snippet: A debate over how many visas the United States should issue to seasonal workers has stranded thousands in Mexico with diminished job prospects.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: TLAPACOYAN, Mexico — Francisco Trujillo heads north each summer to do a job that few Americans want: a four-month stint operating carnival rides, mopping up vomit and sleeping in a cramped trailer with other workers.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Without Visas, Carnival Workers Are Trapped at Home in Mexico

2017-07-22.abstract: White House officials acknowledge that the president would all but have to sign legislation punishing Russia for its election interference.
2017-07-22.snippet: White House officials acknowledge that the president would all but have to sign legislation punishing Russia for its election interference.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional leaders have reached an agreement on sweeping sanctions legislation to punish Russia for its election meddling and aggression toward its neighbors, they said Saturday, defying the White House’s argument that President Trump needs flexibility to adjust the sanctions to fit his diplomatic initiatives with Moscow.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Congress Reaches Deal on Russia Sanctions, Setting Up Tough Choice for Trump

2017-07-22.abstract: Iago’s villainy makes us cheer his tormentors.
2017-07-22.snippet: Iago’s villainy makes us cheer his tormentors.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Durham, N.C. — In September, the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Washington will hear Salim vs. Mitchell, a case brought by the American Civil Liberties Union on behalf of three former C.I.A. detainees. The lawsuit names as defendants the two psychologists who devised the “enhanced interrogation techniques” that became the basis for the C.I.A. torture program described in shocking detail in the Senate Intelligence Committee’s 2014 report.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Shakespeare’s Torture Test

2017-07-22.abstract: There are worse things to do than nothing.
2017-07-22.snippet: There are worse things to do than nothing.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Summer is the silent season, when vacations offer virtually the only chance for legions of beleaguered workers to escape their responsibilities. A wanton slumber on a hot afternoon offers the luxurious expanse of wasted time. The world can keep turning without us for a while.
2017-07-22.headline_main: The Glory of a Summer Sleep

2017-07-22.abstract: Innovation is overrated. When it comes to technology, we need to celebrate upkeep.
2017-07-22.snippet: Innovation is overrated. When it comes to technology, we need to celebrate upkeep.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: It’s been a bad summer for maintenance, especially in New York. Last month Gov. Andrew Cuomo declared a state of emergency for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, underscoring a problem that New York subway riders understand all too well: The M.T.A. relies heavily on emergency repairs because it does not conduct sufficient preventive upkeep. Likewise, in the wake of two recent derailments that caused major disruptions, Pennsylvania Station this month closed aging tracks for repairs and reduced the number of trains serving the station — another example of the costs of neglecting maintenance.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Let’s Get Excited About Maintenance!

2017-07-22.abstract: The new middle age in America is a sad tale of artisanal stress.
2017-07-22.snippet: The new middle age in America is a sad tale of artisanal stress.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Starting sometime in the mid-1950s, baby boomers became the center of American cultural attention. Toni Home Permanents, cap guns, Hostess cupcakes, “American Bandstand,” lovingly packed lunches, the Beatles, “The Man From U.N.C.L.E.,” Motown, Madras shorts, the SATs, undoing Nixon, the civil rights movement, ending the Vietnam War — all came into existence just at the time we, age-appropriately, could ingest, wear or wallop them.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Why Are the Baby Boomers in Such a Bad Mood?

2017-07-22.abstract: I didn’t need the latest ruling on the Trump administration’s Muslim ban to understand that our relationship was real.
2017-07-22.snippet: I didn’t need the latest ruling on the Trump administration’s Muslim ban to understand that our relationship was real.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Until his untimely death in 1986, my grandfather was my best friend. On weekend mornings he’d let my parents sleep in while he brought me downstairs to watch cartoons. We made regular trips to the San Jose, Calif., flea market where he’d buy me cheap toys and impress me with his masterful bargaining, which made them even cheaper. We’d watch Clint Eastwood movies, with him in his La-Z-Boy and me on his lap.
2017-07-22.headline_main: My Grandfather, My ‘Bona Fide’ Best Friend

2017-07-22.abstract: A Vietnamese refugee unexpectedly offers help to a Syrian seeking a home in America.
2017-07-22.snippet: A Vietnamese refugee unexpectedly offers help to a Syrian seeking a home in America.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: A Vietnamese refugee unexpectedly offers help to a Syrian seeking a home in America.
2017-07-22.headline_main: House Hunting with No Credit, No Job History

2017-07-22.abstract: Marchers filled the streets of Berlin days after a marriage equality law was passed. Supporters say the next step is to change the Constitution.
2017-07-22.snippet: Marchers filled the streets of Berlin days after a marriage equality law was passed. Supporters say the next step is to change the Constitution.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Esther Thiane, a student in Berlin, does not know yet if she wants to marry a man or a woman — but now she can decide without worrying about the legality of whatever she chooses.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Gay Marriage Backers Celebrate in Germany: ‘We Don’t Need to Hide’

2017-07-22.abstract: The obituary for the astronaut Sally Ride set off a debate over how to report on her previously undisclosed sexuality.
2017-07-22.snippet: The obituary for the astronaut Sally Ride set off a debate over how to report on her previously undisclosed sexuality.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: Five years have passed since the death of Sally Ride, the first American woman to fly in space. Her New York Times obituary — specifically, the way we addressed her sexuality — provoked an intense debate that still echoes from time to time.
2017-07-22.headline_main: A Deadline Call on Posthumous Privacy

2017-07-22.abstract: The 16-year-old, missing since last summer, was found in a basement in Mosul. She may face criminal charges in Iraq. Some reports say she worked with the Islamic State police.
2017-07-22.snippet: The 16-year-old, missing since last summer, was found in a basement in Mosul. She may face criminal charges in Iraq. Some reports say she worked with the Islamic State police.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Germany — A German teenager missing for more than a year, who was believed to have converted to Islam and run away to join the Islamic State, has been found in Iraq, a state prosecutor said on Saturday.
2017-07-22.headline_main: German Teenager Suspected of Trying to Join ISIS Is Found in Iraq

2017-07-22.abstract: Two Times journalists knew their ride-along with ICE agents could be sanitized theater, but it was also a rare chance to see the impact on the families left behind.
2017-07-22.snippet: Two Times journalists knew their ride-along with ICE agents could be sanitized theater, but it was also a rare chance to see the impact on the families left behind.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: After hundreds of undocumented immigrants were arrested in February, it became clear that the new president had begun making good on a campaign promise to crack down on illegal immigration. Having written about immigration before, we knew other, subtler changes were most likely already happening — from how immigration officers make their arrests and who they take in to the lives of those left behind. To understand those changes, we had to see enforcement on the ground.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Traveling in the Wake of Immigration Arrests

2017-07-22.abstract: Bettis, 28, who was battling testicular cancer when his baby daughter, Everleigh, arrived, said, “I kind of found out where baseball stood.”
2017-07-22.snippet: Bettis, 28, who was battling testicular cancer when his baby daughter, Everleigh, arrived, said, “I kind of found out where baseball stood.”
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: HARTFORD — Life does not always give choices. Chad Bettis did not choose to receive a diagnosis of testicular cancer — not on his first wedding anniversary, not with his first child on the way in the spring, not after his best season as a starting pitcher for the Colorado Rockies. That is just what happened.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Fatherhood, and Illness, Retools the Priorities of Rockies Starter Chad Bettis

2017-07-22.abstract: Caleb Madison sings us the song of his people.
2017-07-22.snippet: Caleb Madison sings us the song of his people.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Most solvers expect to see a daily crossword theme in the longer Across answers. On Sundays, the increased size of the grid means theme entries can also occupy some of the Down answers, but sometimes the theme material is not where you expect to find it.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Back on the Charts

2017-07-22.abstract: President Trump flew to Norfolk, Va., to preside over a ceremony welcoming the first of a new generation of powerful aircraft carriers into the fleet.
2017-07-22.snippet: President Trump flew to Norfolk, Va., to preside over a ceremony welcoming the first of a new generation of powerful aircraft carriers into the fleet.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: NORFOLK, Va. — With flag-hoisting, gun-firing, horn-blowing fanfare, the United States Navy opened a new era on Saturday as it commissioned the first of a generation of more powerful, technologically advanced aircraft carriers that will transform the fleet in decades to come.
2017-07-22.headline_main: U.S. Navy Opens New Era With Commissioning of Gerald R. Ford

2017-07-22.abstract: Ms. Holdman was a pioneer in unearthing legal reasons to spare the lives of the convicted, often working on the cases of those convicted of heinous crimes.
2017-07-22.snippet: Ms. Holdman was a pioneer in unearthing legal reasons to spare the lives of the convicted, often working on the cases of those convicted of heinous crimes.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: In the tight-knit world of defense lawyers who focus on the death penalty, Scharlette Holdman, who died on July 12 at 70, was a revered figure, a nonlawyer who taught her peers how to persuade jurors and prosecutors to spare the lives of men and women convicted of heinous crimes.
2017-07-22.headline_main: Scharlette Holdman, a Force for the Defense on Death Row, Dies at 70

2017-07-22.abstract: Mr. Heard played pained characters in dramas but was best known as the dad who embarked on a family trip to Paris without his youngest son.
2017-07-22.snippet: Mr. Heard played pained characters in dramas but was best known as the dad who embarked on a family trip to Paris without his youngest son.
2017-07-22.lead_paragraph: John Heard, an actor who played pained characters in dramas but was probably best known for his role as the father who mistakenly left his youngest son behind on a family trip to Paris in the comedy “Home Alone,” died on Friday in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 71.
2017-07-22.headline_main: John Heard, the Frazzled Father in ‘Home Alone,’ Dies at 71

2017-07-22.snippet: The actor rebutted an article saying that his days as the Caped Crusader were numbered.

The studio also confirmed that its superhero lineup in the decade ahead will include “Wonder Woman 2,” “Bat Girl” and “Green Lantern Corps.”

Northam of Virginia on Saturday used the first debate of the state’s race for governor to assail President Trump as a liar and a “dangerous man,” wagering that the growing backlash against the president will overwhelm Ed Gillespie, the Republican nominee, in a state drifting to the political left.

2017-07-23.abstract: On a day when Grace became the first man to shoot a 62 in a major championship, Spieth extended his British Open lead to an 11-under 199.
2017-07-23.snippet: On a day when Grace became the first man to shoot a 62 in a major championship, Spieth extended his British Open lead to an 11-under 199.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: SOUTHPORT, England — Saturday morning at the British Open belonged to Branden Grace, a South African who became the first man to shoot a 62 in a major championship. Grace’s eight-under-par score at Royal Birkdale was a sublime individual performance, but no more breathtaking than the work of the final twosome, Jordan Spieth and Matt Kuchar, who shot a combined nine under.
2017-07-23.headline_main: Branden Grace Secures a Record, but Jordan Spieth Owns the Day

2017-07-23.abstract: Since college, Andrew Moore has written in a journal after every game to make notes about his game or a hitter’s. After facing Judge on Friday, he had a lot to add.
2017-07-23.snippet: Since college, Andrew Moore has written in a journal after every game to make notes about his game or a hitter’s. After facing Judge on Friday, he had a lot to add.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When Andrew Moore was pitching in college, he began to keep a journal in which he would make notations after each game — cues he could begin to use as a personal reference library. It might be something he wanted to improve on in his next game, the location of a particular pitch to a particular hitter, or his mentality that led to a success or failure.

2017-07-23.snippet: Spieth, who held a three-stroke lead heading into the final round, saw it turn into a one-shot deficit. But a bogey, of all things, on No. 13 was the catalyst for a rally.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: SOUTHPORT, England — Jordan Spieth’s ball was nestled in the knotty grass on a knoll, more than 120 yards right of the fairway he had aimed to reach. His hands flew to his head in mortification as he watched the shot’s wayward path. His first thought was that he would be lucky to escape with a double-bogey 6 on the hole, No. 13.
2017-07-23.headline_main: Spieth Goes From Hunted to Hunter, and Back Again, in Winning British Open

2017-07-23.snippet: The newspaper strip “Arctic Circle” will focus on global warming this week to coincide with the sequel to the documentary “An Inconvenient Truth.”
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: The newspaper comic strip “Arctic Circle,” by the environmentally minded cartoonist Alex Hallatt, is about talking penguins and their fellow creatures living in the north. Starting Monday, under a caption that says “An Inconvenient Truth,” the menagerie will find their world shrinking and their conversations will be about global warming.
2017-07-23.headline_main: A Comic Strip Mirrors the Ravages of Climate Change

2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: At the end of their live show currently touring the country, Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim — better known as Tim and Eric — leave the stage after introducing their final act, a third performer who comes off as a parody of a 1980s observational comic, his jokes drowned out by loud music.

2017-07-23.abstract: In his new book, James Suzman writes about the Bushmen hunter-gatherers and what they have taught him about how the modern world lives.
2017-07-23.snippet: In his new book, James Suzman writes about the Bushmen hunter-gatherers and what they have taught him about how the modern world lives.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: The mantra of the 21st century might be that the world is interconnected everywhere, but the anthropologist James Suzman knows better. For more than two decades, Suzman has researched and gotten to know various groups of Bushmen throughout southern Africa. In “Affluence Without Abundance,” he writes of what he’s learned about these hunter-gatherers and their way of life, how they have clashed with (and avoided) modernity, and what their society has taught him about how the rest of the world lives. Along with its anthropological insights, the book offers personal portraits of several Bushmen. Below, Suzman discusses why he chose to bring together his years of experience in this book, our society’s obsession with work, his respect for documentary photographers and more.
2017-07-23.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: ‘Affluence Without Abundance’

2017-07-23.abstract: TBS brings back its alien-abductee comedy, which evolved from a sci-fi goof into a charming story of people (and space people) looking to connect.
2017-07-23.snippet: TBS brings back its alien-abductee comedy, which evolved from a sci-fi goof into a charming story of people (and space people) looking to connect.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: The first question any sci-fi story about alien contact raises is: What do they want from us? On TBS’s “People of Earth,” the answer is nebulous — information, possibly domination. But also, not unlike E.T., they love our junk food. Be proud, humans: We have amazing junk food.
2017-07-23.headline_main: Review: ‘People of Earth’ Returns for Affectingly Close Encounters

2017-07-23.abstract: The much-in-demand composer Mason Bates and the librettist Mark Campbell have given Jobs’s thorny life a sappier, more stale arc.
2017-07-23.snippet: The much-in-demand composer Mason Bates and the librettist Mark Campbell have given Jobs’s thorny life a sappier, more stale arc.
2017-07-23.lead_paragraph: SANTA FE, N.M. — The products he created are some of the most innovative and important of our time. But if Steve Jobs the man is interesting, it’s because he was such a jerk. He’s frustrating fodder for that eternal question: How could someone with such elegant, sensitive visions be so unremittingly willful, tyrannical, unfeeling, ungiving?

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Throughout 2016, both Donald J. Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin complained that American-led sanctions against Russia were the biggest irritant in the plummeting relations between the two superpowers. And the current investigations, which have cast a shadow over Mr. Trump’s first six months in office, have focused on whether a series of contacts between Mr. Trump’s inner circle and Russians were partly about constructing deals to get those penalties lifted.

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: In August 2012, the federal government abruptly changed the terms of the bailout provided to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the mortgage finance giants that had been devastated by the financial crisis. 2017-07-24.snippet: The state is making a bold global statement with its cap-and-trade program.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: California, which has long been a pioneer in fighting climate change, renewed its commitment to reducing greenhouse gas emissions last week by extending, to 2030, its cap-and-trade program, which effectively puts a price on emissions. It’s a bold, bipartisan commitment that invites similarly ambitious policies from other states, and it sends a strong signal to the world that millions of Americans regard with utmost seriousness a threat the Trump administration refuses to acknowledge, let alone reckon with.

2017-07-24.abstract: African hunter-gatherers created the first “affluent society.” They were rich in time.
2017-07-24.snippet: African hunter-gatherers created the first “affluent society.” They were rich in time.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Every year automation and computerization squeeze out new segments of the labor force. In response, trade unions and workers anxiously wring their hands while savvy politicians demonize the “sinister” forces of globalization and make promises about job retention that they almost certainly won’t be able to keep.
2017-07-24.headline_main: The Bushmen Who Had the Whole Work-Life Thing Figured Out

2017-07-24.abstract: Communism’s promise of a workers’ paradise chimed with the utopian imagination of science fiction. To strange effect.
2017-07-24.snippet: Communism’s promise of a workers’ paradise chimed with the utopian imagination of science fiction. To strange effect.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: H. G. Wells’s foundational work of political science fiction, “The Time Machine,” predicted a future in which a small utopia of sprightly elites is kept running by a subclass that lives below the ground and is reduced to bestial violence. This prediction, carried to a horrifically logical extent, represented the intense wealth disparity of the Victorian England in which Wells wrote the novel. Judging from the major political narratives of the fictions of our era, films like “The Hunger Games,” “Elysium” and “Snowpiercer,” the certainty of a future rendered increasingly barbarous by class division remains essentially the same.
2017-07-24.headline_main: ‘Make It So’: ‘Star Trek’ and Its Debt to Revolutionary Socialism

2017-07-24.abstract: The communications problem in this administration is that no one cares about the truth.
2017-07-24.snippet: The communications problem in this administration is that no one cares about the truth.

2017-07-24.snippet: Harf Zimmermann recorded the day-to-day of his East German neighborhood during the ’80s.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The first time Harf Zimmermann visited East Berlin’s Hufelandstrasse neighborhood, he sensed it was unlike any other neighborhood he’d known in East Germany. Linden trees lined the streets, as did many privately-owned shops, an unusual sight in a socialist state.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Exposing Life Behind the Berlin Wall

2017-07-24.snippet: States are moving to punish child care centers that enroll the unvaccinated, dismissing the objections of those who resist immunization without a valid medical reason.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: This much is clear: Australia’s strict vaccination laws are working — and they’re set to become even stricter. The state of South Australia has introduced legislation that would ban the enrollment of unvaccinated children in preschool and child care centers.

2017-07-24.abstract: The decision was a setback for the governing party, though a bill giving it more control over local courts was still set for approval.

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Andrzej Duda was a relatively obscure member of the right-wing Law and Justice party when the leader of the party and the most powerful man in the country plucked him from the chorus line to become its candidate for president in 2015. For most of the party’s first 20 months in power, he was a reliable proponent of the governing party’s nationalist initiatives.

2017-07-24.abstract: During their migration between Europe and Africa, hundreds of millions of birds stop in Israel to rest and refuel. Hop aboard a government-sponsored tractor spreading birdseed and corn to keep the birds away from local crop fields.

2017-07-24.abstract: Everywhere Denis Johnson went, he portrayed himself as an openhearted American bumbler not unlike his hapless characters.
2017-07-24.snippet: Everywhere Denis Johnson went, he portrayed himself as an openhearted American bumbler not unlike his hapless characters.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: I was working as an editor at Esquire in 1990 when I sent the novelist and poet Denis Johnson a photograph I’d clipped from The New York Times of a Liberian fighter in the country’s civil war, posing at the edge of a field, resplendently horrific in a wedding gown, cradling an automatic rifle, a woman’s wig perched jauntily atop his head. Donning such finery was said to have protected its wearers from bullets while wreaking terror in their enemies. The picture summoned for me the syncretic, post-apocalyptic imagery of Denis’s second novel, “Fiskadoro,” in which the long-dead Bob Marley is an actual god for the hard-bitten people of the Florida Keys.
2017-07-24.headline_main: A Lot Like Prayer: Remembering Denis Johnson

2017-07-24.abstract: Airplanes rely on different cooling systems, and sometimes switching from one to the other results in overly warm cabins. Here are ways to stay cool.
2017-07-24.snippet: Airplanes rely on different cooling systems, and sometimes switching from one to the other results in overly warm cabins. Here are ways to stay cool.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: When outside temperatures soar, how exactly do airlines keep their passengers cool on board? The topic of airplane cabin temperature has garnered headlines this summer with a handful of instances in which passengers have complained about sweltering cabin heat.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Why Planes Get Hot — and How to Stay Cool When They Do

2017-07-24.abstract: Hotel and car reservations through Amazon’s Alexa, speedier Global Entry enrollment, automatic flight check-in and more aim to make travel smoother.
2017-07-24.snippet: Hotel and car reservations through Amazon’s Alexa, speedier Global Entry enrollment, automatic flight check-in and more aim to make travel smoother.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Travel is supposed to be about the journey. The goal isn’t to get there first. Yet a variety of new services are aiming to speed things along, be it automatically checking you in for your flight, accompanying you through security, reserving a car or hotel with voice commands, or whisking you to the French countryside on new high-speed trains. Here’s a look at half a dozen of the latest innovations.
2017-07-24.headline_main: New Ways to Help Speed Up Your Travel Planning

2017-07-24.abstract: The foursome of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” talk trust, lust and the art of stage kissing.
2017-07-24.snippet: The foursome of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” talk trust, lust and the art of stage kissing.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The course of true love hardly ever runs smooth? Agreed. But few romances are as extravagantly potholed as Shakespeare’s “A Midsummer Night’s Dream.” Yes, the play ends with an extravagant wedding, but the path down the aisle is cratered with a death threat, an elopement, pixie interference and the greatest catfight in world literature. Also, botanical date-rape drugs.
2017-07-24.headline_main: ‘You Create That Chemistry’: How Actors Fall in Instant Love

2017-07-24.abstract: A researcher expresses some surprise that patient satisfaction scores are “useful signals of quality.”
2017-07-24.snippet: A researcher expresses some surprise that patient satisfaction scores are “useful signals of quality.”
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The relatively recent movements toward transparency and quality in health care have collided to produce dozens of publicly available hospital quality metrics. You might consider studying them in advance of your next hospital visit. But how do you know if the metrics actually mean anything?
2017-07-24.headline_main: Which Metrics on Hospital Quality Should Patients Pay Attention To?

2017-07-24.abstract: Routine blood tests may fail to detect insufficient thyroid hormone, leaving patients without an accurate explanation for their symptoms.
2017-07-24.snippet: Routine blood tests may fail to detect insufficient thyroid hormone, leaving patients without an accurate explanation for their symptoms.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Problems with estrogen and testosterone, the body’s main sex hormones, tend to attract widespread public interest. But we might all be better off paying more attention to a far more common endocrine disorder: abnormal levels of thyroid hormone. Thyroid disorders can affect a wide range of bodily functions and cause an array of confusing and often misdiagnosed symptoms.
2017-07-24.headline_main: The Subtle Signs of a Thyroid Disorder

2017-07-24.abstract: There is a place for pro-Second Amendment black women in modern feminism.
2017-07-24.snippet: There is a place for pro-Second Amendment black women in modern feminism.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: It was my first year as a public policy graduate student at the University of Texas, Dallas, and I was taking all my classes at night so I could work during the day. Every evening, after class got out around 10, I had to walk through the sprawling parking lots to get to my car. I dreaded that time of day. I would pray that no one was lurking in dimly lit areas or behind cars, and I’d try not to think about the campus police alerts I’d seen about sexual assaults in the area.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Why I Bring My Gun to School

2017-07-24.snippet: A televised match race between the 23-time Olympic gold medalist and a great white shark seemed about as realistic as a sharknado.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: For nearly 30 years, Shark Week has been a reliable way for the Discovery Channel to create buzz for itself once a year. The public’s appetite for shark-based programming seems inexhaustible. And this year, the channel outdid itself.

2017-07-24.abstract: The tiny federal agency investigates industrial fires and explosions, and its findings can prevent future accidents.
2017-07-24.snippet: The tiny federal agency investigates industrial fires and explosions, and its findings can prevent future accidents.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Calif. — The United States Chemical Safety Board is a federal watchdog with more bark than bite. It has five board members, a tiny staff of less than 50 and a budget of some $11 million a year. Its mission is to investigate fires and explosions in oil refineries and chemical plants.

The hospital had been struggling to find doctors to work in its E.R., and turning to EmCare was something hundreds of other hospitals across the country had done.

2017-07-24.abstract: Sindyanna of Galilee employs Palestinians and Israelis to make its cold-pressed extra-virgin olive oils.
2017-07-24.snippet: Sindyanna of Galilee employs Palestinians and Israelis to make its cold-pressed extra-virgin olive oils.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: These oils have Palestinian and Israeli roots. Palestinian women cultivate and harvest olives from groves north of Galilee for use in the nonprofit company Sindyanna of Galilee’s olive oils, which are made by Israeli women. At Kalustyan’s in New York, Dona Abramson, a manager, has the cold-pressed, fair-trade, extra-virgin olive oils on a shelf between Israeli and Palestinian oils. The store carries three of them. The pungent, peppery Coratina and the lightly herbaceous Barne’a are the most distinctive: $15.99 for 17 ounces; an organic variety is $12.99 for 8.45 ounces, $18.99 for 17 ounces, Kalustyan’s, 123 Lexington Avenue (29th Street), 212-685-3451.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Finding a Common Language Through Olive Oil

2017-07-24.abstract: Ben Horowitz is one of the most influential tech investors of his generation. His father is influential, too. But in a very different way.
2017-07-24.snippet: Ben Horowitz is one of the most influential tech investors of his generation. His father is influential, too. But in a very different way.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: If you work in the tech industry, it’s a good bet you know who Ben Horowitz is: Venture capitalist. Entrepreneur. Netscape veteran. Serious fan of hip-hop music.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Daily Report: A Venture Capitalist and His Famous Father

2017-07-24.abstract: The Perceval knife, popular with chefs, is available in America in nine colors.
2017-07-24.snippet: The Perceval knife, popular with chefs, is available in America in nine colors.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: I am one of those people in restaurants who turns over the dinner plate or the base of stemware to find out the maker. At the new Union Square Cafe, the straightforward, comfortable steak knives stamped 9.47 caught my eye. The model was by Perceval knives, made in Thiers, France, a town west of Lyon that’s been known for cutlery since the 14th century. The blade is simple, not serrated, and based on the design of the company’s pocketknife. I have seen these beauties at Pasquale Jones and at Le Coucou, whose chef, Daniel Rose, also uses them in his Paris restaurants. They are now available for retail in nine handle colors, five wood grains and carbon fiber in the United States: Perceval steak knives, $95 each for colored handle, $175 to $990 each for wood handle, TableArt, 323-653-8278, tableartonline.com.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Steak Knives, Favored by Chefs, Now Available for Your Table

2017-07-24.abstract: Altesi, on the Upper East Side, sells hearty sandwiches with drinks and dessert.
2017-07-24.snippet: Altesi, on the Upper East Side, sells hearty sandwiches with drinks and dessert.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: A freshly made, well-stuffed sandwich with a side dish, a drink and a dessert pastry can be had on the Upper East Side, just steps from Central Park. Altesi sells an assortment of made-to-order panini on ciabatta at its 64th Street and SoHo locations. Fillings include breaded chicken cutlet with arugula; vegetable frittata; caprese with tomato, mozzarella and pesto; and prosciutto and cheese: A2Go panini, $20, available noon to 4 p.m., Altesi Madison, 26 East 64th Street, 212-759-8900, and Altesi Downtown, 200 Spring Street (Sullivan Street), 212-431-1212, altesinyc.com.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Ready-Made Panini Picnic Steps From Central Park

2017-07-24.abstract: Actors Jacob Anderson and Nathalie Emmanuel discuss the hopes and difficulties their characters face as they try to consummate their romance.
2017-07-24.snippet: Actors Jacob Anderson and Nathalie Emmanuel discuss the hopes and difficulties their characters face as they try to consummate their romance.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: It was a mixed week for eunuchs on “Game of Thrones.” Dany expressed doubt about Varys’s loyalty and Theon abandoned his sister in the midst of battle. Grey Worm, however ... he did all right. Most couples on this series are doomed, or at least face insurmountable odds. For Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) and Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel), those challenges include the emotional conditioning he underwent in order to become one of the Unsullied. Oh, also the fact that he was castrated long ago.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Q. and A.: Grey Worm and Missandei’s Tender Moment on ‘Game of Thrones’

2017-07-24.abstract: A minute alteration in the planet’s trajectory around the sun would have disastrous results, a scientist estimates.
2017-07-24.snippet: A minute alteration in the planet’s trajectory around the sun would have disastrous results, a scientist estimates.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Q. Let’s say Earth’s orbit moved closer to the sun. How small a change would be disastrous?
2017-07-24.headline_main: Even Tiny Changes in Earth’s Orbit Would Yield Global Catastrophe

2017-07-24.abstract: Some investing decisions don’t fit neatly into a spreadsheet. If you’re taking more career risk, it might be smart to keep more money in cash right now.
2017-07-24.snippet: Some investing decisions don’t fit neatly into a spreadsheet. If you’re taking more career risk, it might be smart to keep more money in cash right now.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: If you’re a bit scared about investing your money right now, you’re not alone. I’ve received many emails and comments recently from people who have money to invest. They even know how it should be invested. But they just can’t get themselves to put the money into the stock market.
2017-07-24.headline_main: You’re No Coward if You’re Keeping Some Money Out of Stocks

2017-07-24.abstract: The chef Maricel E. Presilla’s new book, “Peppers of the Americas,” is an encyclopedia of facts and recipes.
2017-07-24.snippet: The chef Maricel E. Presilla’s new book, “Peppers of the Americas,” is an encyclopedia of facts and recipes.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: In this colorful, encyclopedic book on peppers, the chef Maricel E. Presilla, an expert on Latin American cooking, explains the New World origins of the pepper genus in Bolivia, how chiles eventually traveled around the world, what accounts for their heat and how they are used. True to its title, the book dwells on the New World, with very brief detours to Asia, Eastern Europe, Spain and elsewhere. Sections on dried chiles, growing and preparing peppers, and recipes for condiments and chile-centric dishes are included: “Peppers of the Americas: The Remarkable Capsicums That Forever Changed Flavor” by Maricel E. Presilla (Lorena Jones Books, $35).
2017-07-24.headline_main: For the Chile Aficionado, a Good Book

2017-07-24.abstract: After days of violent protests and a diplomatic crisis with Jordan over the placement of metal detectors at the entrances to the Aqsa Compound, the Israeli government said it would remove them.

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — After days of violent protests, bloodshed and a diplomatic crisis with Jordan over the placement of metal detectors at the entrances to the Aqsa Mosque Compound in Jerusalem’s Old City, the Israeli government said early Tuesday it would remove them.

2017-07-24.abstract: After months of deliberation, Republicans have reached the moment when they have to vote. But they still don’t know what exactly they’ll be voting on.
2017-07-24.snippet: After months of deliberation, Republicans have reached the moment when they have to vote. But they still don’t know what exactly they’ll be voting on.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republican leaders, keeping alive their push to dismantle the Affordable Care Act, are barreling toward a showdown vote on Tuesday to begin debating a repeal of the health law. And Senator John McCain announced Monday night that he will be on hand to cast his vote, despite a diagnosis of brain cancer.

2017-07-24.abstract: Most of us are ruled by time. Not Tiler Peck, of New York City Ballet. And this spring, she took her mastery to a new level.
2017-07-24.snippet: Most of us are ruled by time. Not Tiler Peck, of New York City Ballet. And this spring, she took her mastery to a new level.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Most of us, most of our days, are subject to time. We follow calendars and clocks like slaves. The finest dancers, however, seem to govern time, to find and possess it without haste and even, for moments, to suspend it altogether. The music’s pulse runs on apace; but they pack every measure with important-seeming activity, now and then playing with the beat, here a hairbreadth behind and there a bit ahead of the music, sometimes pausing miraculously amid the pressing momentum of the dance.
2017-07-24.headline_main: The Ballerina Who Can Stop Time (and Restart It, Too)

2017-07-24.abstract: In some countries, companies offer women paid time off for period pain. But some experts fear these policies reinforce dated stereotypes.
2017-07-24.snippet: In some countries, companies offer women paid time off for period pain. But some experts fear these policies reinforce dated stereotypes.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Recently Akanksha Seda got in her car at 10:30 a.m., as usual, and rode 45 minutes to her company’s office in Mumbai, India. A few hours later, she got her period and, she recalled, “the eighteen-wheeler truckload of cramps.”
2017-07-24.headline_main: In Some Countries, Women Get Days Off for Period Pain

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The new Jay-Z album, “4:44,” an intimate, sometimes borderline-uncomfortable self-examination from this 47-year-old rapper (who also happens to be Beyoncé’s husband), is sustaining people’s attention. And hip-hop in general is doing the same, occupying all five spots on the Billboard Top 5 this week, largely thanks to streaming.

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: It’s been a rough start for my friend Anthony Scaramucci as President Trump’s surprise — and surprising — choice as the new White House communications director. That’s too bad, because I would like nothing better than for him to succeed wildly in his new job. Lord knows Mr. Trump can use the help.

2017-07-24.abstract: Why don’t we speak openly about mental illness?
2017-07-24.snippet: Why don’t we speak openly about mental illness?
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Chester Bennington, the lead singer of the band Linkin Park, was found dead on Thursday in his home near Los Angeles. The coroner’s office has confirmed that the 41-year-old died of suicide. That’s something I — and so many millions of other Americans suffering from mental illness — have considered.

2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: LE BUGUE, France — As the police chief of the sleepy fictional town of St.-Denis in the Périgord region of southwestern France, Bruno Courrèges has battled murderers and arsonists, truffle fraud and archaeological vandalism, drug pushers and terrorists.

2017-07-24.abstract: Eataly Flatiron drowns scoops of gelato in espresso for its new affogato menu.
2017-07-24.snippet: Eataly Flatiron drowns scoops of gelato in espresso for its new affogato menu.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Affogato means drowned in Italian. It also refers to the coffee confection made by drenching a scoop or two of gelato with a shot or two of espresso. Now at the gelato bar at Eataly NYC Flatiron, there is a menu of seven affogati, some fairly simple and others more elaborate, including the Antico, made with pistachio, hazelnut and sweet milk gelati, espresso and whipped cream. The Moderno swaps out the coffee for chocolate sauce: Affogati, $5.50 to $10.80, Eataly NYC Flatiron, 200 Fifth Avenue (23rd Street), 212-229-2560 eataly.com.
2017-07-24.headline_main: A Cool Confection With a Caffeinated Kick

2017-07-24.abstract: A city’s challenges mirror those confronting a lot of urban centers across New York, which has set up a program to offer them grants.
2017-07-24.snippet: A city’s challenges mirror those confronting a lot of urban centers across New York, which has set up a program to offer them grants.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: ONEONTA, N.Y. — Amid a handful of whimsical businesses like Green Toad Bookstore and the Yellow Deli, this city’s downtown still emits a listless feel, with signage that, in some cases, is so old that it seems intentionally retro.
2017-07-24.headline_main: For Oneonta’s Aging Downtown, a $10 Million Face-Lift

2017-07-24.abstract: Kansai Yamamoto, the designer that helped outfit David Bowie during the Ziggy Stardust era, is an unlikely inspiration for contemporary designers.
2017-07-24.snippet: Kansai Yamamoto, the designer that helped outfit David Bowie during the Ziggy Stardust era, is an unlikely inspiration for contemporary designers.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Kansai Yamamoto isn’t a name that readily trips off the tongue when speaking about Japanese fashion design. Yohji is the Yamamoto that leaps to mind, a designer who upended Western ideas of dress alongside Rei Kawakubo’s Comme des Garçons in Paris in the early 1980s.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Fashion’s Ultimate Fantasist Makes a Comeback

2017-07-24.abstract: Barrie Kosky banned Wagner from his opera house. Now he’s confronting his most nationalistic work — as the first Jewish director in the Bayreuth Festival’s 141-year history.
2017-07-24.snippet: Barrie Kosky banned Wagner from his opera house. Now he’s confronting his most nationalistic work — as the first Jewish director in the Bayreuth Festival’s 141-year history.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — In 2013, as opera companies worldwide celebrated Richard Wagner’s 200th birthday, Barrie Kosky, who had recently arrived as artistic director of the Komische Oper in Berlin, declared an informal ban in his new house on works by that composer, toward whom he has long felt ambivalent.
2017-07-24.headline_main: A ‘Gay Jewish Kangaroo’ Takes on Wagner at Bayreuth

2017-07-24.abstract: Andrew Scott’s portrayal in a London production of “Hamlet” almost banishes other performances from memory.
2017-07-24.snippet: Andrew Scott’s portrayal in a London production of “Hamlet” almost banishes other performances from memory.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A chronic theatergoer may be excused for believing that all roads lead to Hamlet. I spent my first evening here this month in the company of that Danish prince, who is being embodied with such compelling, thin-skinned agitation by Andrew Scott that I felt I could see his heart palpitating, and breaking apart, within his chest.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Hamlet and the Surveillance State of Denmark

2017-07-24.abstract: Just days before the drummer Stanton Moore was set to make a new album, he heard that Toussaint had died. The recording sessions turned into a celebration of Toussaint’s music.
2017-07-24.snippet: Just days before the drummer Stanton Moore was set to make a new album, he heard that Toussaint had died. The recording sessions turned into a celebration of Toussaint’s music.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: In 1960s Detroit, a group of songwriters and producers built a Motown sound that was funky and cosmopolitan, but also warm of spirit and broadly appealing. Around the same time, one man was accomplishing something similar in New Orleans, largely on his own.
2017-07-24.headline_main: An Allen Toussaint Tribute by New Orleans’s Modern-Day All-Stars

2017-07-24.abstract: James Smith’s solo show, part of Soulpepper’s New York residency, examines his family’s history of disorders with a striking lack of bitterness.
2017-07-24.snippet: James Smith’s solo show, part of Soulpepper’s New York residency, examines his family’s history of disorders with a striking lack of bitterness.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: James Smith was in his first year of college when his older brother Josh asked him, on Facebook, if he had obsessive-compulsive disorder. Mr. Smith ignored the question.

2017-07-24.abstract: Members of Congress are defending him much less than is typical for a new president, and his level of popular support is declining.
2017-07-24.snippet: Members of Congress are defending him much less than is typical for a new president, and his level of popular support is declining.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Again and again over the past year, Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan have had to decide what kind of behavior they are willing to tolerate from Donald Trump. Again and again, McConnell and Ryan have bowed down to Trump.

2017-07-24.abstract: Madkins, who previously worked for the team as a scout under Isiah Thomas, also worked with the Knicks’ new general manager, Scott Perry, in Seattle.
2017-07-24.snippet: Madkins, who previously worked for the team as a scout under Isiah Thomas, also worked with the Knicks’ new general manager, Scott Perry, in Seattle.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: When the Knicks hired Scott Perry as general manager this month, everyone from the owner James L. Dolan on down promised a culture change in the organization. President Steve Mills pledged that Perry would have the leeway to bring other people into the front office to work alongside him.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Knicks Expected to Add Gerald Madkins as Assistant G.M.

2017-07-24.abstract: The website, known for debunking viral misinformation, claims a vendor is withholding its advertising revenue. The vendor has a different story.
2017-07-24.snippet: The website, known for debunking viral misinformation, claims a vendor is withholding its advertising revenue. The vendor has a different story.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: Snopes, the fact-checking website that once focused on debunking flimsy internet rumors but has expanded into a 16-person operation that calls out political leaders for dishonesty, is locked in a legal battle that it says has drained the money it needs to survive.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Snopes, in Heated Legal Battle, Asks Readers for Money to Survive

2017-07-24.abstract: A fighter approached the American spy plane from below and then slowed down directly in front, behavior a Pentagon spokesman said was unusual for Chinese pilots.
2017-07-24.snippet: A fighter approached the American spy plane from below and then slowed down directly in front, behavior a Pentagon spokesman said was unusual for Chinese pilots.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A United States Navy spy plane had to take evasive action to avoid crashing into a Chinese fighter jet that suddenly pulled up in front of the American plane in contested skies above the East China Sea on Sunday, the Pentagon said.
2017-07-24.headline_main: U.S. Navy Plane Takes ‘Evasive Action’ to Avoid Chinese Fighter Jet

2017-07-24.abstract: Ayobami Adebayo’s “Stay With Me,” like great works by Chinua Achebe and Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, explores the pull between tradition and modernity in Nigeria.
2017-07-24.snippet: Ayobami Adebayo’s “Stay With Me,” like great works by Chinua Achebe and Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, explores the pull between tradition and modernity in Nigeria.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The two narrators of Ayobami Adebayo’s stunning debut novel — a Nigerian woman named Yejide and her husband, Akin — remember the stories they heard when they were children, and they hope to pass on these stories to their own sons and daughters. They are folk tales featuring talking animals and magic potions, but while they often come with an old-fashioned moral (“He who has children owns the world”), Yejide devises her own versions, adding new bits and pieces as she goes along, turning them into allegories that speak to her own life and that of her country.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Portrait of a Nigerian Marriage in a Heartbreaking Debut Novel

2017-07-24.snippet: Democrats gathered in a small town in Virginia on Monday to unveil the economic themes they hope to run on in 2018 as they look beyond President Trump.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: BERRYVILLE, Va. — For more than a year, Democrats have raged against now-President Trump, projecting their opposition as the party’s central message. In so doing, they have maintained their minority status in Congress, sustained the most stunning loss in modern presidential history and left voters with little sense of what they represent.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Democrats Try to Find Economic Message After Railing Against Trump

2017-07-24.snippet: The executive committee of the organization that governs amateur boxing overwhelmingly approved a no-confidence motion against Ching-kuo Wu.

2017-07-24.abstract: President Trump’s visit emboldened the Law and Justice party to attempt a judicial coup, and Washington has been a mere bystander since.
2017-07-24.snippet: President Trump’s visit emboldened the Law and Justice party to attempt a judicial coup, and Washington has been a mere bystander since.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Polish democracy won a partial, momentary reprieve on Monday when President Andrzej Duda vetoed two controversial bills that would have given the ruling Law and Justice party direct power over Poland’s courts. Partial, because President Duda did sign a bill giving the Justice Ministry control over local courts. And momentary, because Mr. Duda has said he would introduce his own versions of the legislation soon.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Poland Turns Away From Democracy, Thanks to the U.S.

2017-07-24.abstract: New York City, where 1.7 million people receive food stamps, now allows eligibility documents to be submitted via smartphones.
2017-07-24.snippet: New York City, where 1.7 million people receive food stamps, now allows eligibility documents to be submitted via smartphones.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: About 1.7 million people in New York City receive food stamps. To qualify, they must produce dozens of documents to prove their eligibility, including birth certificates, pay stubs, leases and children’s school records.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Applying for Food Stamps in New York? There’s an App for That

2017-07-24.abstract: Rose, the former league M.V.P., could give the Cavs some insurance in the backcourt after his disappointing one-year tenure with the Knicks.
2017-07-24.snippet: Rose, the former league M.V.P., could give the Cavs some insurance in the backcourt after his disappointing one-year tenure with the Knicks.
2017-07-24.lead_paragraph: The long and winding basketball odyssey of Derrick Rose took its latest turn on Monday when he agreed to a one-year deal with the Cleveland Cavaliers, according to a person with direct knowledge of the agreement. The deal is worth $2.1 million, according to the person, who requested anonymity because it had not yet been announced.
2017-07-24.headline_main: Derrick Rose and Cavaliers Are Said to Agree to One-Year Deal

2017-07-25.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration issued its priorities for the subway rescue plan, and officials repeated that they would not pay for the fixes.

Andrew M. Cuomo on Monday by issuing its own list of priorities, including focusing on the basic needs of the transit system rather than on more cosmetic changes.

2017-07-25.snippet: In a scathing memo, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis called the purchase of uniforms for Afghan troops ‘an example of a complacent mode of thinking.’

2017-07-25.abstract: A girl in South Africa, born infected with the virus, was given early treatment and remained free of the infection eight years later, scientists reported on Monday.
2017-07-25.snippet: A girl in South Africa, born infected with the virus, was given early treatment and remained free of the infection eight years later, scientists reported on Monday.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: For the third time in recent years, a child born with H.I.V. has been found free of the virus for a long period after a high dose of treatment early in life.

2017-07-25.abstract: Los Angeles has much talent to withstand the loss, but it also has the resources to go for another top starter such as Justin Verlander or Yu Darvish.
2017-07-25.snippet: Los Angeles has much talent to withstand the loss, but it also has the resources to go for another top starter such as Justin Verlander or Yu Darvish.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Dodgers were dealt a blow on Sunday as Clayton Kershaw sustained a back injury that will keep him out for an estimated four to six weeks, according to multiple reports. The silver lining for Los Angeles was that if any team could withstand the loss of a pitcher as talented as Kershaw, it is the Dodgers.

2017-07-25.abstract: Newly released footage of a gunfight that left three Americans dead in November shows a deliberate attack that was initially explained as a mistake.
2017-07-25.snippet: Newly released footage of a gunfight that left three Americans dead in November shows a deliberate attack that was initially explained as a mistake.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Newly released video of the killing of three American Special Forces soldiers in November at the gate of a military base in Jordan shows that the episode, which was initially explained as a split-second mistake by a Jordanian guard firing on Americans who failed to stop, was actually a six-minute gun battle where Americans crouched behind barriers and repeatedly waved their hands in surrender as the gunman closed in and killed them.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Video Shows U.S. Soldiers Surrendering Before Fatal Shooting in Jordan

2017-07-25.abstract: Mr. Pilgrim joined a brother in taking over a Texas feed store owned by their father and transformed it into a company with 35,000 employees and operations in 17 states and Mexico.
2017-07-25.snippet: Mr. Pilgrim joined a brother in taking over a Texas feed store owned by their father and transformed it into a company with 35,000 employees and operations in 17 states and Mexico.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Bo Pilgrim, a small-town Texan who transformed a tiny feed and seed store into one of the biggest chicken producers in the United States and put himself in its logo — in the form of a silhouetted profile under a black, buckled Pilgrim’s hat — died on Friday at his home in Pittsburg, Tex. He was 89.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Bo Pilgrim, Founder of Pilgrim’s Pride Poultry Products, Dies at 89

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The 30 signs affixed to lampposts inside Prospect Park in Brooklyn over the weekend carried a dire warning from the parks department: “An aggressive squirrel has attacked and bitten 5 people in this area.” The squirrel, reportedly unprovoked, had sunk its teeth into at least five people over the past week, including a 7-year-old girl.

2017-07-25.abstract: An attack on judicial independence is vetoed, but the ruling party is still trying to destroy democracy.
2017-07-25.snippet: An attack on judicial independence is vetoed, but the ruling party is still trying to destroy democracy.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: It took one of Jaroslaw Kaczynski’s accomplices in the ruling party he controls to put the brakes to his ruthless assault on Poland’s democracy. To general surprise, President Andrzej Duda, a former Law and Justice party backbencher loyal to Mr. Kaczynski, vetoed two bills that would have ended the judiciary’s independence and crippled the rule of law. That is heartening, but not the end of the problem.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Poland Pulls Back From the Brink, for Now

2017-07-25.snippet: I came back from 13 months with the Marines in Vietnam. But my last assignment was the hardest.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: In late October 1968, I came home from Vietnam. With six months to go before the end of my four-year enlistment, I was assigned to the Marine Corps Supply Depot, Philadelphia. In late December I sat at a desk addressing envelopes when my sergeant walked over to tell me to report to the first sergeant’s office.

2017-07-25.abstract: Haight-Ashbury’s flower-bedecked hippie scene may have gotten most of the attention during 1967’s Summer of Love, but Nathan Farb’s photos from the Lower East Side that summer show a grittier side.
2017-07-25.snippet: Haight-Ashbury’s flower-bedecked hippie scene may have gotten most of the attention during 1967’s Summer of Love, but Nathan Farb’s photos from the Lower East Side that summer show a grittier side.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Nathan Farb arrived on the Lower East Side of New York in the mid 1960’s searching for adventure and his Jewish roots. He lamented being “too late for the Beats and too early for the hippies,” but the year after he discovered photography in 1966 he stumbled upon the East Village’s “Summer of Love,” a scene propelled by rock music, drugs, sexual abandon and anti-Vietnam War sentiment.
2017-07-25.headline_main: 1967’s Other Summer of Love

2017-07-25.abstract: The Mayweather-McGregor bout and N.B.A. free agency call into question the structure of labor and compensation in American professional sports.
2017-07-25.snippet: The Mayweather-McGregor bout and N.B.A. free agency call into question the structure of labor and compensation in American professional sports.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: As the sports world fell into the early days of its annual summer coma, a series of portentous moments were taking place. At a glance, and taken individually, they looked a lot like the peripheral or back-­office goings-on that typically fill the quieter months until football season starts. But by the time Lonzo Ball, the Lakers rookie point guard, whose passing ability is exceeded by only his father’s self-promotional thirst, lit up the N.B.A.’s summer league in Las Vegas in early July, a pattern was emerging. Beyond all the insiderish commentary about N.B.A. free agency and where Gordon Hayward, a borderline All Star, might end up, there was a steady stream of news that seemed to call into question the structure of labor and compensation in American professional sports.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Should Superstar Athletes Make More Money and Run Their Leagues?

2017-07-25.abstract: As the global spotlight on the nation’s domestic policies has dimmed, lawyers for dissidents increasingly face a terrible choice: acquiescence or imprisonment.
2017-07-25.snippet: As the global spotlight on the nation’s domestic policies has dimmed, lawyers for dissidents increasingly face a terrible choice: acquiescence or imprisonment.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Liang Xiaojun had just finished breakfast when he received the first instant message: His friends were disappearing from their homes and offices. By itself, this news was unremarkable. As a human rights lawyer in China, Liang had come to accept that periodic spasms of repression were an unavoidable risk of his profession. He also had grown intimately familiar with the rituals of pressure and coercion by which China kept its dissidents in line — the meetings over tea with government minders, the frequent check-ins from the judicial bureau, the police harassment. But on the morning of July 10, 2015, Liang knew that something far graver was underway.
2017-07-25.headline_main: ‘Flee at Once’: China’s Besieged Human Rights Lawyers

2017-07-25.abstract: Some Americans’ allergy to apology meets up with exasperation over so-called political correctness. For others, there’s celebration in defiance.
2017-07-25.snippet: Some Americans’ allergy to apology meets up with exasperation over so-called political correctness. For others, there’s celebration in defiance.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: We’re living in sorry times, people. And by ‘‘sorry,’’ I mean ‘‘not sorry.’’ Right now, the far-right website Breitbart News is selling T-shirts emblazoned with the words ‘‘Unapologetically American.’’ The shirt’s label is printed with the Breitbart logo, ‘‘Made in USA’’ and ‘‘#WAR.’’ This is a shirt that wants to be starting something. Jamming ‘‘unapologetically’’ in front of ‘‘American’’ like that, with all those aggro fixin’s, implies that anybody wearing a different shirt doesn’t love America.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Is Being ‘Unapologetic’ the New Patriotic — or a Form of Resistance?

2017-07-25.abstract: The Australian Football League is trying to present itself as a force for inclusion, becoming an unlikely ally in the fight for same-sex marriage.

2017-07-25.abstract: Nicholas Kristof met Abel when he was a 17-year-old orphan, and the effective head of a household. I caught up with him 7 years later.
2017-07-25.snippet: Nicholas Kristof met Abel when he was a 17-year-old orphan, and the effective head of a household. I caught up with him 7 years later.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The last time you may have read about Abel Moyo, he was a gangly 17-year-old orphan, and the head of a household of five, living in rural Zimbabwe. Back then, in 2010, Abel walked 9 miles to high school, which teachers let him attend even though he could not afford the school fees. When he came home, he cooked mush for the younger kids (ranging in age from 8 to 11), dispensing comfort and discipline as the surrogate father, and did his homework by firelight. The family was effectively two families that came to live together after their parents had died of AIDS and other causes — a not uncommon story in Zimbabwe.
2017-07-25.headline_main: ‘Born Poor, Die Poor’

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: SEN SAKANA After many delays, this ambitious restaurant will give New York a taste of Nikkei cuisine. The food, a mash-up of Peruvian and Japanese using ingredients and techniques from both cultures, traces its origins to the influx of Japanese people who settled in Peru starting in the late 19th century. Nigiri sushi pairing the Japanese fish madai with nori and Peruvian ají Amarillo chile is one example of the cuisine. Tiradito, a raw fish preparation like sashimi, but with a spicy sauce, is another. The chef Mina Newman has Peruvian roots, and she’s teamed up with Taku Nagai, a Japanese chef. “I always wanted to do a Peruvian restaurant,” Ms. Newman said, adding that she knew she needed the help of a Japanese chef. The owner, Allan Wartski, had a Japanese place in the theater district. He also owns the Edison Ballroom on West 47th Street and Christos Steak House in Astoria, Queens. Sen Sakana, decorated with lots of slatted pale wood, has 190 seats divided between a ground-floor dining room and a mezzanine level that also has a sushi bar. (Opens Wednesday): 28 West 44th Street, 212-221-9560, sensakana.com.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Sen Sakana Brings Nikkei Cuisine to Midtown

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Keep your barbecue-flavored potato chips. A Spanish company, Torres, is far more inventive with flavors that convey an air of luxury. Iberian ham is nicely meaty, sparkling wine is alluring and a trifle sweet, black truffle is slightly funky, and caviar definitely has a fishy flavor: Torres potato chips, $9 to $79 for three to six bags (1.41 ounces and up) online, $2.95 to $6.95 for single bags at Chelsea Market Baskets, 459 West 15th Street (Ninth Avenue), 888-727-7887, chelseamarketbasket.com.

On the right, allies of President Trump are devising ways to punish Mr. Flake for his outspoken rejection of Mr. Trump last year.

2017-07-25.abstract: Double Dutch requires athleticism, finesse and musicality. Lincoln Center honors its history and place in African-American culture.
2017-07-25.snippet: Double Dutch requires athleticism, finesse and musicality. Lincoln Center honors its history and place in African-American culture.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The main ingredients? A pair of swirling ropes, two turners to maneuver them and at least one jumper to feel out the rhythm, slip seamlessly in between the ropes and bounce in perfect time. Double Dutch may sound like child’s play, but it’s more than just skipping rope. This game that came to life in the streets of New York City — practiced mainly by girls — is an integral piece of African-American culture.
2017-07-25.headline_main: The Art and Artistry of Double Dutch

2017-07-25.abstract: Richard Atkins was at the beginning of a promising musical career — until a single disastrous performance changed the course of his life.

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: This film recounts the rise, fall and ultimate second coming of the talented psychedelic folk musician Richard Atkins. In 1968, Atkins was building toward success he was certain would approach that of the Byrds or Simon & Garfunkel. He’d won a contract with Mercury Records, and recorded with the Wrecking Crew, a group of Los Angeles session musicians famous for their work with the Beach Boys.

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: I’m a sucker for any novel full of atmosphere, history and a fully realized sense of place — great terroir, as a wine writer might be expected to put it. All the better if the characters love food and wine and if meals can be savored vicariously right off the page.

2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The Ballet Festival at the Joyce Theater this July is a classy affair. The first two (of five) programs — by Emery LeCrone Dance and Claudia Schreier & Company — abounded in live music, played and sung well. The lighting, by Brandon Stirling Baker, was artful without drawing attention to itself. And the dancers! There are so many moonlighting members of New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theater that it’s practically summer camp for Lincoln Center dance royalty.

2017-07-25.abstract: McConnell’s norm-breaking is a lot like Trump’s.
2017-07-25.snippet: McConnell’s norm-breaking is a lot like Trump’s.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: Like many people, I have a sick sense of anger over what just happened in the Senate, which just voted to proceed on a health care bill without any information on what will be in the bill. There’s still hope that in the next few hours, moderates who just caved in will balk at the horrible things they’re being asked to vote for. And I do mean hours: there will be no time for reflection or serious debate.
2017-07-25.headline_main: The Great Health Care Coverup

2017-07-25.abstract: Lauren Gunderson’s “The Book of Will,” making part of its rolling world premiere, finds drama in family relationships and Renaissance publishing.
2017-07-25.snippet: Lauren Gunderson’s “The Book of Will,” making part of its rolling world premiere, finds drama in family relationships and Renaissance publishing.
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: GARRISON, N.Y. — Before Shakespeare was a billion-dollar industry, he was a workaday playwright. And before he was a playwright, he was a guy with a high school education, a flintlock wedding, three young kids and the ravening ambition to vault himself out of a sheep-related career in a small market town and into the dicey, disreputable world of Elizabethan theater.
2017-07-25.headline_main: In the Hudson Valley, Shakespeare as Man, Myth and Drinking Buddy

2017-07-25.abstract: Catherine Bainbridge’s “Rumble: The Indians Who Rocked the World” celebrates performers who never fully got their due for their musical contributions.

2017-07-25.headline_main: Review: ‘Rumble’ Gives Due to Unheralded Native American Pop Musicians

2017-07-25.abstract: In this engaging documentary, Michael Almereyda looks at the screenwriter Hampton Fancher, one of the seers behind the 1982 “Blade Runner.”
2017-07-25.snippet: In this engaging documentary, Michael Almereyda looks at the screenwriter Hampton Fancher, one of the seers behind the 1982 “Blade Runner.”
2017-07-25.lead_paragraph: The writer Hampton Fancher, one of the seers behind the 1982 masterpiece “Blade Runner,” has led the kind of fantastically eventful life that seems the stuff of fiction. Born in East Los Angeles in 1938 to a white American father and Mexican-American mother, he announced to them at 11 that he was leaving school — and did. He ran wild, studied ballet and, after seeing a biopic about the silent-screen legend Rudolph Valentino, renamed himself Mario Montejo. By 15, Mario was en route to Spain to study flamenco. On the ship home, Marlon Brando invited him to dinner. A bashful Mario declined.
2017-07-25.headline_main: Review: ‘Escapes’ Recounts a Hollywood Storyteller’s Inventive Life

2017-07-25.snippet: In Ingrid Jungermann’s droll comedy, ex-lovers who produce a podcast about serial killers find themselves at odds when a new romantic interest emerges.

2017-07-25.headline_main: Review: She Hosts ‘Women Who Kill,’ and May Be in Love With One

Dutifully practicing the credo of physician heal thyself, he lived to 105.

2017-07-26.snippet: A public outcry led the Coast Guard to ease a security zone at Trump National Golf Club on the river for boats, kayaks and other watercraft.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It is not often that the interests of a quiet rural community overtake those of the president. But after opposition from veterans, Olympians and children’s summer camps, the Coast Guard is retreating from plans to increase security on the Potomac River behind the Trump National Golf Club in Virginia.

2017-07-26.abstract: Fueled by insatiable demand in the gulf states, the Italian marble trade is booming. A look at how the stone is wrenched from the earth.
2017-07-26.snippet: Fueled by insatiable demand in the gulf states, the Italian marble trade is booming. A look at how the stone is wrenched from the earth.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The story of Italian marble is the story of difficult motion: violent, geological, haunted by failure and ruin and lost fortunes, marred by severed fingers, crushed dreams, crushed men. Rarely has a material so inclined to stay put been wrenched so insistently out of place and carried so far from its source; every centimeter of its movement has had to be earned. “There is no avoiding the tyranny of weight,” the art historian William E. Wallace once put it. He was discussing the challenge, in Renaissance Italy, of installing Michelangelo’s roughly 17,000-pound statue of the biblical David. This was the final stage of an epic saga that, from mountain to piazza, actually began before Michelangelo’s birth and involved primitive and custom-engineered machinery and, above all, great sweating armies of groaning, straining men. But the tyranny of weight was in effect long before that, and long after, and it remains in effect today.
2017-07-26.headline_main: The Majestic Marble Quarries of Northern Italy

2017-07-26.abstract: The Space Corps, which would be created within the Air Force, has formidable skeptics, including the defense secretary and members of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Space Corps, which would be created within the Air Force, has formidable skeptics, including the defense secretary and members of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump’s campaign against his attorney general, Jeff Sessions, in which he is seemingly attempting to insult and humiliate and tweet-shame Sessions into resignation, is an insanely stupid exercise. 2017-07-26.abstract: The actor and producer on duck-lips selfies and the intersection of feminism and porn.
2017-07-26.snippet: The actor and producer on duck-lips selfies and the intersection of feminism and porn.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: In 2015, you produced a documentary about young pornography performers, ‘‘Hot Girls Wanted,’’ that was eventually turned into a new Netflix documentary series. But in 2013, you wrote a pretty strident essay in Glamour against the ‘‘pornification’’ of everything, where you recount using the hashtag #stopactinglikewhores, in regard to the mainstreaming of, say, V-strings and stripper poles. What changed? I was impulsive. Being old isn’t a good excuse for it, but using the word ‘‘whore’’ was absolutely not appropriate. I didn’t even know what ‘‘slut shaming’’ meant at the time, and I have educated myself. But that was sort of the beginning of my relationship with all this work — I wanted to see if my feelings had any validity in the real world, or if I was just being close-minded.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Why Rashida Jones Changed Her Mind About Porn
