2017-07-26.headline_main: Trump Says Transgender People Will Not Be Allowed in the Military

2017-07-26.abstract: After rigorous testing of brewing and grinding equipment for coffee, here are the results.
2017-07-26.snippet: After rigorous testing of brewing and grinding equipment for coffee, here are the results.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The staff at The Wirecutter and Sweethome, The New York Times’s product evaluation sites, seem just a little obsessed with coffee. They have evaluated a lot of brewing and grinding equipment, so I spoke with Michael Zhao, senior editor at The Wirecutter, about their findings.
2017-07-26.headline_main: The Technology Behind Good Coffee

2017-07-26.abstract: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.
2017-07-26.snippet: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.
2017-07-26.headline_main: A Farmhouse in the Czech Republic

2017-07-26.abstract: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.
2017-07-26.snippet: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: A 19th-century farmstead with six bedrooms and five bathrooms renovated with an eye to historic detail is for sale in Racice, a small town near Prague in the Czech Republic.
2017-07-26.headline_main: House Hunting in … the Czech Republic

2017-07-26.abstract: The company’s Family Link software for managing children’s Android phones can be undone the instant a young user turns 13.
2017-07-26.snippet: The company’s Family Link software for managing children’s Android phones can be undone the instant a young user turns 13.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The only consensus among parents about the right age for a child to have unfettered access to a smartphone is that there is no magic number.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Google’s New Parental Control App Has a Flaw: Puberty

2017-07-26.abstract: The automaker’s quarterly profit rose 4 percent thanks to a surge in profit from its lending arm, Ford Credit.
2017-07-26.snippet: The automaker’s quarterly profit rose 4 percent thanks to a surge in profit from its lending arm, Ford Credit.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Jim Hackett has said little about his plans to revitalize Ford Motor since he was named its chief executive two months ago, but the first earnings report in his tenure points to some of the trouble spots he must address.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Ford Reports a Small Profit, but Its New Chief Faces Slowing Sales

2017-07-26.abstract: One rock venue after another in Brooklyn has closed, so Bar Matchless — home of heavy-metal karaoke — has become a place “you want to play.”
2017-07-26.snippet: One rock venue after another in Brooklyn has closed, so Bar Matchless — home of heavy-metal karaoke — has become a place “you want to play.”
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: On a Saturday night in May, Scott Wolf arrived in the band room early at Bar Matchless in a tightfitting denim jacket. His band Bound and Buried was the headliner on a four-band bill at the club, which is in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. The local band Brogues started things off for a small but steadily growing crowd by blasting through a set of pop punk. The thick distorted guitar sounds were loud enough to make a seasoned heavy metal fan’s ears ring.
2017-07-26.headline_main: For Those About to Rock, Bar Matchless Is Ready

2017-07-26.abstract: Metropol Parasol, a contemporary structure with Roman ruins underneath, spurred revitalization, including hip boutiques.
2017-07-26.snippet: Metropol Parasol, a contemporary structure with Roman ruins underneath, spurred revitalization, including hip boutiques.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Seville never used to be a destination for shoppers. Up until about five years ago, travelers to this southern Spanish city could expect to find stores selling not much more than old-fashioned flamenco dresses or touristy knickknacks. The offerings became more inspiring with the 2011 opening of Metropol Parasol, a mushroomlike contemporary structure with Roman ruins and a market underneath and views of the city and countryside from the top. These days, the cluster of surrounding narrow streets lined with 16th- and 17th-century buildings is dotted with hip, locally run boutiques that show off the increasingly modern side of a metropolis steeped in history and tradition.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Five Places to Shop in Seville

2017-07-26.abstract: Training camps are about to open, with the top job on the line.
2017-07-26.snippet: Training camps are about to open, with the top job on the line.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The Patriots, the Falcons, the Cowboys and most other successful N.F.L. teams don't spend much time worrying about who their starting quarterback is going to be. They just pencil in Brady, Ryan or Prescott and hope he doesn’t get hurt.
2017-07-26.headline_main: In the N.F.L., It’s Quarterback Controversy Season

2017-07-26.abstract: Several states have moved in recent months to strengthen their laws against child marriage.
2017-07-26.snippet: Several states have moved in recent months to strengthen their laws against child marriage.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: State legislators in the U.S. can no longer plead ignorance about child marriage in America. Not now that research shows an estimated quarter-million children, at least as young as 10, were married in the United States between 2000 and 2010. National and international news outlets are paying attention.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Despite Progress, Child Marriage Is Still Legal in All 50 States

2017-07-26.abstract: The ban follows similar announcements by France, India and Norway, and is the latest move in a growing push toward the use of electric vehicles.
2017-07-26.snippet: The ban follows similar announcements by France, India and Norway, and is the latest move in a growing push toward the use of electric vehicles.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Scrambling to combat a growing air pollution crisis, Britain announced on Wednesday that sales of new diesel and gas cars would reach the end of the road by 2040, the latest step in Europe’s battle against the damaging environmental impact of the internal combustion engine.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Britain to Ban New Diesel and Gas Cars by 2040

2017-07-26.abstract: The nations were criticized for hampering efforts to relieve the burden on Greece and Italy, where refugees arrived in huge numbers in 2015 and 2016.
2017-07-26.snippet: The nations were criticized for hampering efforts to relieve the burden on Greece and Italy, where refugees arrived in huge numbers in 2015 and 2016.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — A top European Union legal adviser denounced Hungary and Slovakia on Wednesday for refusing to participate in a plan devised in 2015 to relocate migrants from Greece and Italy as the migration crisis reached its height.
2017-07-26.headline_main: E.U. Court Urged to Punish Hungary and Slovakia for Resisting Migrant Plan

2017-07-26.abstract: Mr. de Montebello, the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s former director, will be a director of Acquavella Galleries, effective immediately.
2017-07-26.snippet: Mr. de Montebello, the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s former director, will be a director of Acquavella Galleries, effective immediately.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Philippe de Montebello, the former director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, doesn’t exactly need another job.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Philippe de Montebello, Former Met Chief, Joins Acquavella

2017-07-26.abstract: A Little Night Music, the popular series of late-night, hourlong programs, returns to the elegant and intimate Kaplan Penthouse at Lincoln Center.
2017-07-26.snippet: A Little Night Music, the popular series of late-night, hourlong programs, returns to the elegant and intimate Kaplan Penthouse at Lincoln Center.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The Mostly Mozart Festival has started, which means the return of A Little Night Music — intimate, hourlong programs in Lincoln Center’s Kaplan Penthouse. Starting at 10 p.m., these events offer the closest New York can get to an elegant nightclub for classical music.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Mostly Mozart Festival: So Percussion and Ksenija Perform

2017-07-26.abstract: In “Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow,” the playwright Halley Feiffer reimagines Chekhov.
2017-07-26.snippet: In “Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow,” the playwright Halley Feiffer reimagines Chekhov.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Just so you know, “Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow,” at the Williamstown Theater Festival through Aug. 6, does not portray the mental landscape of beleaguered members of the Trump family in recent weeks. It is a revisionist comic portrait of another clan for whom Russia’s best-known metropolis towers in the imagination.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Williamstown Theater Festival: Three Sisters and Lots of Kvetching

2017-07-26.abstract: This exhibition is a collaboration with the Equal Justice Initiative.
2017-07-26.snippet: This exhibition is a collaboration with the Equal Justice Initiative.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Some exhibitions are as much about life as about art. “The Legacy of Lynching: Confronting Racial Terror in America,” at the Brooklyn Museum, is a collaboration with the Equal Justice Initiative, founded by the lawyer and MacArthur fellow Bryan Stevenson to target racism in the criminal justice system.
2017-07-26.headline_main: ‘The Legacy of Lynching,’ at the Brooklyn Museum, Documents Violent Racism

2017-07-26.abstract: The latest exhibition in the Manhattan park’s robust art program features three colorful structures for dancers, poets and musicians to perform in, on and around.
2017-07-26.snippet: The latest exhibition in the Manhattan park’s robust art program features three colorful structures for dancers, poets and musicians to perform in, on and around.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: With its verdant seven acres, Madison Square Park is one of those oases of foliage and calm amid the concrete mania of Manhattan. It’s home to the usual amenities, like playgrounds for dogs and kids, but also some more unusual sights thanks to the park’s robust public art program, which has hosted dozens of large-scale sculptures and installations since 2004.
2017-07-26.headline_main: ‘Prismatic Park,’ an Oasis of Art in Madison Square Park

2017-07-26.abstract: The Quad schedules seven “Pink Panther” movies, but only five star Peter Sellers in his bread-and-butter role.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Quad schedules seven “Pink Panther” movies, but only five star Peter Sellers in his bread-and-butter role.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Peter Sellers’s film career was highlighted by two wildly different Oscar-nominated performances 15 years apart: “Dr. Strangelove, or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb” in 1964 and “Being There” in 1979. But what might be considered his bread-and-butter role was the ridiculous Inspector Jacques Clouseau in “The Pink Panther” (1964) and a slew of sequels.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Clouseau, Clouseau and More Clouseau: A ‘Pink Panther’ Fest

2017-07-26.abstract: The drummer expands on his recent release, “Kinfolk: Postcards From Everywhere,” which combines intricate percussion with oral history.
2017-07-26.snippet: The drummer expands on his recent release, “Kinfolk: Postcards From Everywhere,” which combines intricate percussion with oral history.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: We don’t talk a lot about percussion having a flavor. But on the drummer Nate Smith’s “Kinfolk: Postcards From Everywhere,” released this spring, all sorts of sounds participate in building the rhythm: taut but resonant bass notes, clipped guitar playing, zagging saxophone lines. The result is a sound that’s tart, bittersweet and almost nostalgic.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Nate Smith Brings ‘Kinfolk’ to Jazz Standard

2017-07-26.abstract: The mind-bending animated story of a crazed scientific genius and his grandson begins Season 3.
2017-07-26.snippet: The mind-bending animated story of a crazed scientific genius and his grandson begins Season 3.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Being a “Rick and Morty” fan is a sort of exquisite torture, in several ways. For one thing, merely watching this outlandish animated Adult Swim series can hurt the brain. The tales of Rick, a crazed scientific genius, his grandson Morty, and their travels through space and time move so quickly and are such a mishmash of physics, pseudoscientific jargon and pop-culture references that merely keeping up is heavy mental exercise. But another part of the torture is waiting for new episodes; the seasons tend to be rather widely spaced out.
2017-07-26.headline_main: ‘Rick and Morty,’ With Adult Swim’s Oddest Duo, Returns. Finally.

2017-07-26.abstract: New Yorkers United Together appears to be the third nonprofit formed by allies of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to emerge in support of his policies.
2017-07-26.snippet: New Yorkers United Together appears to be the third nonprofit formed by allies of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to emerge in support of his policies.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: At the end of a video promoting Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s immigration policies, a disclaimer noted the advertisement’s funding source: an obscure anti-discrimination group called New Yorkers United Together.
2017-07-26.headline_main: No Links to Cuomo? Their Ad Was Labeled ‘Client: Andrew Cuomo’

2017-07-26.abstract: An unusual trial has featured victims who actually made money and defense lawyers who paint their client as an erratic misfit and want more victims to testify.
2017-07-26.snippet: An unusual trial has featured victims who actually made money and defense lawyers who paint their client as an erratic misfit and want more victims to testify.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: In February 2013, Martin Shkreli was contemplating a deal that involved acquiring shares of Retrophin, the pharmaceutical company he ran, at below the market price.
2017-07-26.headline_main: The Strange Case of Martin Shkreli Is Wrapping Up

2017-07-26.abstract: The president’s third straight day of publicly complaining about Jeff Sessions, the attorney general, came during speculation that Mr. Trump could fire Mr. Sessions.
2017-07-26.snippet: The president’s third straight day of publicly complaining about Jeff Sessions, the attorney general, came during speculation that Mr. Trump could fire Mr. Sessions.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump publicly attacked Attorney General Jeff Sessions for a third consecutive day on Wednesday, questioning why Mr. Sessions has not fired the acting director of the F.B.I. over his wife’s political ties to Hillary Clinton.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Trump Attacks Sessions Again, This Time Over the Acting F.B.I. Director

2017-07-26.abstract: Unruly pets, vocal sex, Fleetwood Mac turned up loud: In Britain, any of these can get you tagged as a public nuisance.
2017-07-26.snippet: Unruly pets, vocal sex, Fleetwood Mac turned up loud: In Britain, any of these can get you tagged as a public nuisance.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Dogs cannot safely bark in this city.
2017-07-26.headline_main: How an American in London Learned to Fear the ASBO

2017-07-26.abstract: The execution of Ronald Phillips was the first in Ohio since the state changed its methods after an inmate took an unusually long time to die.
2017-07-26.snippet: The execution of Ronald Phillips was the first in Ohio since the state changed its methods after an inmate took an unusually long time to die.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: An Ohio prisoner convicted of raping and murdering a toddler in Akron in 1993 was put to death on Wednesday morning, the state’s first execution in more than three years.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Ohio Carries Out Its First Execution Since 2014

2017-07-26.abstract: When tragedy befalls your garden, move forward: Start with some spaghetti carbonara, and move into other comforts.
2017-07-26.snippet: When tragedy befalls your garden, move forward: Start with some spaghetti carbonara, and move into other comforts.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Crushed Tomatoes

2017-07-26.abstract: President Trump has reversed an Obama administration policy that evolved rapidly. Here is how The Times covered the issue.
2017-07-26.snippet: President Trump has reversed an Obama administration policy that evolved rapidly. Here is how The Times covered the issue.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s announcement on Twitter Wednesday morning that transgender people would be barred from the United States military “in any capacity” marked a sudden reversal of a policy that had evolved rapidly under the Obama White House.
2017-07-26.headline_main: How U.S. Military Policy on Transgender Personnel Changed Under Obama

2017-07-26.abstract: An author discusses the response to a recent Op-Ed on the president’s foreign policy.
2017-07-26.snippet: An author discusses the response to a recent Op-Ed on the president’s foreign policy.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: An article in this week’s Sunday Review, “Donald Trump’s Plan to Save Western Civilization” by Stephen Wertheim, a historian at King’s College at the University of Cambridge, argued that in his first six months in office, President Trump has put forward the outlines of a foreign policy doctrine, one focused on the “defense” of “Western civilization.” Professor Wertheim’s article attracted hundreds of comments on nytimes.com and hundreds more on social media. Max Strasser, a staff editor in The New York Times Opinion section, and Professor Wertheim discussed the article and how readers responded to it.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Did We Take Trump Too Seriously?

2017-07-26.abstract: Thanks to the app’s ability to download interactive maps, you can still see where you’re going without having to be online.
2017-07-26.snippet: Thanks to the app’s ability to download interactive maps, you can still see where you’re going without having to be online.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Q. I will use only my Verizon plan iPhone and Google Maps for driving directions in Europe. What plans or workarounds can I use to minimize data use?
2017-07-26.headline_main: Packing Google Maps, but Not an Internet Connection

2017-07-26.abstract: Secured at high cost by the American troop surge in 2010, the critical Afghan province of Kandahar again seems at risk from heavier insurgent assaults.
2017-07-26.snippet: Secured at high cost by the American troop surge in 2010, the critical Afghan province of Kandahar again seems at risk from heavier insurgent assaults.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan — In a bloody overnight attack in Kandahar Province in Afghanistan on Wednesday, the Taliban routed an Afghan Army outpost, killing dozens of soldiers and raising fears of a concerted insurgent offensive in the province, a former seat of Taliban power that took years of effort by coalition and Afghan forces to secure.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Taliban Slaughter Soldiers in Pattern of Attacks in Kandahar

2017-07-26.abstract: Jill Dawson’s novel “The Crime Writer” uses the life of Patricia Highsmith to explore the territory between reality and fantasy.
2017-07-26.snippet: Jill Dawson’s novel “The Crime Writer” uses the life of Patricia Highsmith to explore the territory between reality and fantasy.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: THE CRIME WRITER By Jill Dawson 246 pp. Harper Perennial. Paper, $15.99.
2017-07-26.headline_main: A Fictional Patricia Highsmith as Strange as the Real One

2017-07-26.abstract: The Broad? Meet the Cheech: A champion of Latino art moves beyond his personal collection to found a new museum.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Broad? Meet the Cheech: A champion of Latino art moves beyond his personal collection to found a new museum.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Cheech Marin, Searching for a ‘Chicano Rockwell’

2017-07-26.abstract: Sven Lau was sentenced to more than five years in prison for recruiting people to fight with a pro-Islamic State group in Syria.
2017-07-26.snippet: Sven Lau was sentenced to more than five years in prison for recruiting people to fight with a pro-Islamic State group in Syria.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A German court on Wednesday sentenced one of the country’s best-known Islamic extremists to more than five years in prison for raising money and recruiting people for the Islamic insurgency in Syria.
2017-07-26.headline_main: German Islamic Extremist Is Convicted of Supporting Terror Group

2017-07-26.abstract: A company known for its software and its failure to make good gadgets is making advances in personal computers. Consider the ingenuity of the Surface Studio big-screen desktop.
2017-07-26.snippet: A company known for its software and its failure to make good gadgets is making advances in personal computers. Consider the ingenuity of the Surface Studio big-screen desktop.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Microsoft devices used to be a joke. Even putting those two words together — Microsoft and devices — would elicit a giggle. After all, Microsoft was good at making software, not at making gadgets.
2017-07-26.headline_main: The Surprising New PC Innovator? Microsoft

2017-07-26.abstract: For its opening night, the Mostly Mozart festival offered a program of symphony and song featuring the Young People’s Chorus of New York.
2017-07-26.snippet: For its opening night, the Mostly Mozart festival offered a program of symphony and song featuring the Young People’s Chorus of New York.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Give the Mostly Mozart festival credit for trying something different to open its 2017 season on Tuesday at David Geffen Hall. Instead of the typical gala evening of Mozart favorites, the festival orchestra was joined by the wonderful Young People’s Chorus of New York City for a thoughtful program of symphony and song.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Review: A Youthful Experiment Kicks Off Mostly Mozart

2017-07-26.abstract: The city’s popular new ferry service keeps getting better, as riders discover the delights of a beer or a glass of rosé on the slow boat to a night out.
2017-07-26.snippet: The city’s popular new ferry service keeps getting better, as riders discover the delights of a beer or a glass of rosé on the slow boat to a night out.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: When Nate Hodge’s mother-in-law was visiting from Massachusetts, he and his wife, Catherine Greeley, wanted to treat her to a drink before dinner. It was a gorgeous weekend evening in New York City, 75 degrees and sunny, so they wanted to be outside. They could have gone to a cafe with a patio or a rooftop bar, but they opted for a more unlikely venue for cocktail hour: the South Brooklyn ferry to Manhattan.
2017-07-26.headline_main: On the East River Ferry, a Party Before the Party

2017-07-26.abstract: The New York Times would like to hear from people who are affected by President Trump’s decision to ban transgender people from military service.
2017-07-26.snippet: The New York Times would like to hear from people who are affected by President Trump’s decision to ban transgender people from military service.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The New York Times would like to hear from people who are affected by President Trump’s decision to ban transgender people from military service.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Are You Affected by Trump’s Ban on Transgender Service Members?

2017-07-26.abstract: The prospect of regulatory requirements raises the question of whether the offerings provide any advantage over crowdfunding, venture capital or initial public offerings.
2017-07-26.snippet: The prospect of regulatory requirements raises the question of whether the offerings provide any advantage over crowdfunding, venture capital or initial public offerings.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The ballooning market for so-called initial coin offerings — which has boomed to $1.3 billion so far this year — just got a reality check.
2017-07-26.headline_main: A Test for the Market in Initial Coin Offerings

2017-07-26.abstract: Ben Barenholtz helped kick-start the careers of Mr. Lynch, the Coen brothers and John Sayles. Now he’s finally trying his hand at his own drama.
2017-07-26.snippet: Ben Barenholtz helped kick-start the careers of Mr. Lynch, the Coen brothers and John Sayles. Now he’s finally trying his hand at his own drama.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Ben Barenholtz’s many credits — though he dismisses them with a wave — include kick-starting the careers of David Lynch, the Coen brothers and John Sayles.
2017-07-26.headline_main: He Gave David Lynch His Start. Now, at 82, He’s a New Director.

2017-07-26.abstract: The Kremlin said that news of the proposed American measures was “sad” and that relations between Moscow and Washington would be further damaged.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Kremlin said that news of the proposed American measures was “sad” and that relations between Moscow and Washington would be further damaged.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russian legislators called on Wednesday for “painful” measures against the United States in response to plans for new American sanctions, while the Kremlin focused more on the damage to relations between Washington and Moscow.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Lawmakers in Russia Call for Retaliation Against New U.S. Sanctions

2017-07-26.abstract: Dog owners spent 30 fewer minutes a day being sedentary than those who didn’t own a dog.
2017-07-26.snippet: Dog owners spent 30 fewer minutes a day being sedentary than those who didn’t own a dog.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Just how good is dog walking for you? Older dog owners who walked their dogs at least once a day got 20 percent more physical activity than people without dogs, a British study found, and spent 30 fewer minutes a day being sedentary, on average. Regular exercise has well-known benefits for health and longevity.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Quantifying the Benefits of Owning a Dog

2017-07-26.abstract: Athletes whose results from past world championships have been upgraded because of others’ doping violations will receive the flag and anthem treatment next month in London.
2017-07-26.snippet: Athletes whose results from past world championships have been upgraded because of others’ doping violations will receive the flag and anthem treatment next month in London.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: When the world championships of track and field begin next month in London, there will be a few extra medal ceremonies.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Cheated World Track Medalists to Finally Have a Proper Ceremony

2017-07-26.abstract: The Federal Reserve is wrapping up its post-crisis economic stimulus campaign, and said the next step would come “relatively soon,” so long as moderate economic growth continues.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Federal Reserve is wrapping up its post-crisis economic stimulus campaign, and said the next step would come “relatively soon,” so long as moderate economic growth continues.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve moved into the ready position Wednesday for the next phase of its retreat from its post-crisis economic stimulus campaign. In a statement after a two-day meeting of its policy-making committee, the Fed said it would start reducing its bond holdings “relatively soon” so long as moderate economic growth continues.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Fed, Leaving Rates Unchanged, Expects to Wind Down Stimulus ‘Relatively Soon’

2017-07-26.abstract: Dan Bell takes us on a visual journey through some of the dying pleasure palaces of his youth.
2017-07-26.snippet: Dan Bell takes us on a visual journey through some of the dying pleasure palaces of his youth.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Dan Bell takes us on a visual journey through some of the dying pleasure palaces of his youth.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Portfolio: Dead Malls

2017-07-26.abstract: Farewell, pleasure palaces of days past. A filmmaker’s series chronicles a way of life as it reaches its end.
2017-07-26.snippet: Farewell, pleasure palaces of days past. A filmmaker’s series chronicles a way of life as it reaches its end.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: One day in 2015, Dan Bell left his home in Baltimore and drove into the suburbs to visit the Owings Mills Mall. It was a trip out of memory. As a 9-year-old boy, he had attended the grand opening of this 820,000-square-foot shopping emporium with his family.
2017-07-26.headline_main: An Ode to Shopping Malls

2017-07-26.abstract: Mr. Patinkin, a Tony winner, will return to Broadway in a role that was previously played by Josh Groban.
2017-07-26.snippet: Mr. Patinkin, a Tony winner, will return to Broadway in a role that was previously played by Josh Groban.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Mandy Patinkin is returning to Broadway. The Tony-winning actor will assume the lead male role in “Natasha, Pierre & The Great Comet of 1812” for three weeks, from Aug. 15 through Sept. 3. He’ll take over from the “Hamilton” alumnus Okieriete Onaodowan in a show that picked up 12 Tony nominations and continues to perform strongly at the box office.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Mandy Patinkin to Star in ‘The Great Comet’

2017-07-26.abstract: The crime blotter item came from Arlington, a city in the ninth year of a 10-year plan to eradicate homelessness.
2017-07-26.snippet: The crime blotter item came from Arlington, a city in the ninth year of a 10-year plan to eradicate homelessness.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Usually, the floorboards creaking above you in the middle of the night are the house settling. Or perhaps a raccoon. But for a woman in Arlington, Va., it was the footsteps of a man living in her attic.
2017-07-26.headline_main: A Virginia Woman Hears a Noise in the Attic, and the Police Find a Man Living There

2017-07-26.abstract: The two nuclear powers are fighting over a border, but their battle is really over the shape of Asia’s future.
2017-07-26.snippet: The two nuclear powers are fighting over a border, but their battle is really over the shape of Asia’s future.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: On a remote pass through Himalayan peaks, China and India, two nuclear-armed nations, have come near the brink of conflict over an unpaved road. It is one of the worst border disputes between the regional rivals in more than 30 years.
2017-07-26.headline_main: How India and China Have Come to the Brink Over a Remote Mountain Pass

2017-07-26.abstract: The Treasury Department ordered assets in the United States frozen for 13 well connected Venezuelan figures and barred Americans from doing business with them.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Treasury Department ordered assets in the United States frozen for 13 well connected Venezuelan figures and barred Americans from doing business with them.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Treasury Department imposed financial sanctions on a host of current and former senior Venezuelan officials on Wednesday and threatened to take more stringent action if President Nicolás Maduro proceeds with plans for a constituent assembly on Sunday that critics consider a danger to democracy.

2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: “By one terrific blow the British on June 7, 1917, smashed the strong German salient south of Ypres [Belgium], where for two-and-a-half years the Allied armies had held the enemy in check, but where all that time they had been harassed by German guns on the Messines-Wytschaete Ridge,” the Mid-Week Pictorial said a century ago this week, as it offered readers some of the most amazing pictures yet of the Great War.

2017-07-26.snippet: The director Christopher Nolan sent composer Hans Zimmer a windup pocket watch and suggestion to borrow from Elgar. The result was unbearable tension.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The Christopher Nolan film “Dunkirk,” about the dramatic rescue of Allied troops from a French beach in World War II, ignores many conventions of war movies — most prominently, a heroic score. Instead of sweeping strings and get-out-the-cavalry horns, “Dunkirk” is set to a droning beat that ratchets ever up in intensity.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Ticking Watch. Boat Engine. Slowness. The Secrets of the ‘Dunkirk’ Score.

2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: They flow ceaselessly through the text panels on our smartphones, these ubiquitous ideograms used to convey facts or feelings or perhaps nothing at all. They have come to infiltrate both our memes and our dreams. They appeared on Nippon Telegraph and Telephone mobile devices in the ’90s, went global when Apple made them standard on iPhones and have become so universal that Sony has turned them into an animated movie.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Digital Artist Yung Jake Scores With Emoji Portraits

2017-07-26.abstract: Cristóbal de Villalpando’s Baroque altarpiece hasn’t left Puebla, Mexico, since 1683. It’s now at the Met, and it’s overpowering.
2017-07-26.snippet: Cristóbal de Villalpando’s Baroque altarpiece hasn’t left Puebla, Mexico, since 1683. It’s now at the Met, and it’s overpowering.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Bound up the steps to the front door of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, open your bag for inspection, pay your $25 or 25 cents for a ticket, and walk straight forward. You’ll be in the dim Medieval Sculpture Hall, with its giant iron choir screen — but something unusual, something brilliant, is peeking out beyond it. The usually empty doorway to the Lehman Collection, at the back of the museum, is overwhelmed with dumbstruck apostles, swaddled in silks of rose and lilac; there are prophets with long white beards, backlit by dazzling sun. In the center of it all, beckoning tour groups to his fellowship, is the white-clad, mustachioed son of God, his body halfway between flesh and light.
2017-07-26.headline_main: From Colonial Mexico, a Towering Vision of Grace

2017-07-26.abstract: Brothers Irving and Samuel Morano pleaded guilty to selling and offering for sale ivory artifacts priced at more than $4.5 million at their Midtown Manhattan shop.
2017-07-26.snippet: Brothers Irving and Samuel Morano pleaded guilty to selling and offering for sale ivory artifacts priced at more than $4.5 million at their Midtown Manhattan shop.

Despite everyone I know telling me not to read YouTube comments, I do it anyway because I am a contrarian. I read the following:
2017-07-26.headline_main: Trolls Insulted My Body. So I Made This Music Video for Them.

2017-07-26.abstract: An exhibition at the Smithsonian American Art Museum asks, whose images have influenced our view of cities? Would someone who lived in these cities picture them differently than an outsider?
2017-07-26.snippet: An exhibition at the Smithsonian American Art Museum asks, whose images have influenced our view of cities? Would someone who lived in these cities picture them differently than an outsider?

2017-07-26.abstract: A crop of year-round resort-wear labels are the next best thing to a vacation.
2017-07-26.snippet: A crop of year-round resort-wear labels are the next best thing to a vacation.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: The merits of a life of leisure are up for debate, but there is no harm in dressing the part. A slew of new and under-the-radar resort labels are making the case for vacation as a year-round pursuit, not a twice-a-year indulgence. And they may be onto something. Despite the explosion of health and wellness goods on the market, Americans still report higher levels of stress than ever before. Maybe it’s time to ditch the chakra-balancing crystals and magnesium-infused smoothies and go in for some good old-fashioned sartorial R & R, even if the only place you wear the free-spirited items is to the office. Here, five labels that inspire, and are inspired by, travel.
2017-07-26.headline_main: 5 Resort Labels to Inspire Wanderlust

2017-07-26.abstract: The war-torn Syrian city held a concert at its famed citadel, even as residents rely on aid agencies for basic supplies in parts of the devastated city.
2017-07-26.snippet: The war-torn Syrian city held a concert at its famed citadel, even as residents rely on aid agencies for basic supplies in parts of the devastated city.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Music echoed through the amphitheater of the iconic citadel in Aleppo, Syria, on Tuesday night as the site hosted its first concert since the country’s war began in 2011.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Aleppo Has Little Food or Water, but for a Night, Music

2017-07-26.abstract: A loss of coverage for millions, less market competition and a bigger bill for the government.
2017-07-26.snippet: A loss of coverage for millions, less market competition and a bigger bill for the government.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Skinny is often read as good today. We like skinny jeans, skinny models and, apparently, skinny health reform. It is likely that the Senate, which has just rejected repeal-and-replace and repeal-without-replace bills, will vote on a “skinny repeal” of the Affordable Care Act. What does this actually mean, and what would it produce?
2017-07-26.headline_main: Why ‘Skinny’ Obamacare Repeal Is a Terrible Idea

2017-07-26.abstract: Twenty-seven years after the Americans With Disabilities Act, we remain shunned and marginalized. And the G.O.P. is determined to make it worse.
2017-07-26.snippet: Twenty-seven years after the Americans With Disabilities Act, we remain shunned and marginalized. And the G.O.P. is determined to make it worse.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: In Denver in 1978, just after the July 4 holiday, 19 men and women with disabilities positioned themselves in front of public buses at the busy intersection of Colfax Avenue and Broadway. They chanted “We will ride!” until city transportation officials were willing to hear their complaints: Namely, that lack of access to public transportation led to disenfranchisement and discrimination, which led to joblessness, homelessness, despair and misery.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Why Is Our Existence as Humans Still Being Denied?

2017-07-26.headline_main: Your Venture’s Not Ready for Prime Time? This Site Can Help

2017-07-26.abstract: This new HBO anthology, like “Black Mirror” and other series, explores the appeal of a quick, weird tale in the era of long-form TV stories.
2017-07-26.snippet: This new HBO anthology, like “Black Mirror” and other series, explores the appeal of a quick, weird tale in the era of long-form TV stories.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: If you think of TV in real-estate terms, it increasingly asks viewers to sign long-term leases. Serial and complex shows, designed to be binge-watched, demand hour upon hour, season upon season. Unpack your bags, a “Game of Thrones” or “The Walking Dead” says: You’re going to stay awhile.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Review: In the Binge-TV Age, ‘Room 104’ Offers a 30-Minute Escape

2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Putting to rest a mystery that initially puzzled investigators, the New York City medical examiner’s office ruled on Wednesday that the death of Sheila Abdus-Salaam, the first black woman to serve on New York State’s highest court, was a suicide.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Death of Pioneering New York Judge Is Ruled a Suicide

2017-07-26.abstract: An article about the bill-splitting app Venmo provoked a lively discussion among readers about generosity, pettiness and courteousness.
2017-07-26.snippet: An article about the bill-splitting app Venmo provoked a lively discussion among readers about generosity, pettiness and courteousness.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: In his recent article, “Thanks to Venmo, We Now All Know How Cheap Our Friends Are,” Teddy Wayne argued that instead of easing payments between friends, payment and bill-splitting apps like Venmo (Divvy is another) encourage pettiness in people requesting payment. Such apps make the payee less likely to courteously round down, instead expecting to be reimbursed for every penny.
2017-07-26.headline_main: ‘Is It Wrong to Get Separate Checks?’ Readers Debate Apps Like Venmo

2017-07-26.abstract: “To the End of the Land” and “Yitzhak Rabin: Chronicle of an Assassination,” staged at the Lincoln Center Festival, underscore the elusiveness of concord.
2017-07-26.snippet: “To the End of the Land” and “Yitzhak Rabin: Chronicle of an Assassination,” staged at the Lincoln Center Festival, underscore the elusiveness of concord.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: We know how to wage war. When waging peace, the strategies are less certain. That tenuous battle has inspired two fitfully involving Israeli plays at this year’s Lincoln Center Festival: an adaptation of David Grossman’s novel “To the End of the Land,” produced by Ha’Bima National Theater and the Cameri Theater of Tel Aviv, and “Yitzhak Rabin: Chronicle of an Assassination,” directed by the filmmaker Amos Gitai.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Review: In Two Israeli Plays, the Promise of Peace Keeps Receding

2017-07-26.snippet: This lucid, graceful book by Cory Taylor addresses her struggles with cancer after a diagnosis of melanoma. She died in July 2016 at 61.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: DYINGA MemoirBy Cory Taylor141 pages. Tin House Books. $18.95.
2017-07-26.headline_main: ‘Dying: A Memoir’ Is a Bracing Illumination of Terminal Illness

2017-07-26.abstract: Ahead of Barcelona’s “friendly Clásico” with Real Madrid in Miami, the Barcelona president discussed expansion plans in the United States, the club’s legal issues and, of course, Neymar.
2017-07-26.snippet: Ahead of Barcelona’s “friendly Clásico” with Real Madrid in Miami, the Barcelona president discussed expansion plans in the United States, the club’s legal issues and, of course, Neymar.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: By F.C. Barcelona’s standards, it has been a trying couple of years. The club’s archrival, Real Madrid, won last season’s Spanish league title and has captured three of the last four Champions League titles. Barcelona’s manager, Luis Enrique, announced his resignation before the end of last season, and another Spaniard, Ernesto Valverde, has slid into the regularly hot seat he vacated. Sandro Rosell, the team’s former president, was arrested in May on money laundering charges. Lionel Messi was found to have violated Spanish tax laws, and Barcelona’s current president, Josep Maria Bartomeu, and the star forward Neymar — currently the focus of multimillion-dollar transfer rumors — will both stand trial on corruption charges related to Neymar’s transfer to the club in 2013.
2017-07-26.headline_main: F.C. Barcelona President Josep Maria Bartomeu on Touring, Taxes and a Potential Neymar Transfer

2017-07-26.abstract: For the Trump administration, no lie is too small to be weaponized.
2017-07-26.snippet: For the Trump administration, no lie is too small to be weaponized.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Last week the White House told a lie. It was a small lie and, given the epic scale of this administration’s mendacity, an inconsequential one. It just happened to be about me.
2017-07-26.headline_main: When the White House Lies About You

2017-07-26.abstract: President Trump’s announcement that the military would no longer allow transgender people to serve led to warnings about the return of an era of secrecy and shame.

2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-07-26.headline_main: Republican Party, Russia, Venezuela: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

2017-07-26.abstract: Kathryn Bigelow’s new movie, set amid the Detroit riots of 1967, grapples with the legacy of American racism.
2017-07-26.snippet: Kathryn Bigelow’s new movie, set amid the Detroit riots of 1967, grapples with the legacy of American racism.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Racial slurs fly fast and furious in Kathryn Bigelow’s “Detroit,” but the most troubling and divisive words uttered onscreen are variations on the simple pronouns “they” and “them.” The words may be perfectly neutral in themselves, but when used to separate one group of people from another they take on an insidious, implicitly violent connotation.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Detroit,’ Black Lives Caught in a Prehistory of the Alt-Right

2017-07-26.abstract: The cameras must now be turned on when officers are dispatched to 911 calls, a change prompted by questions about an officer’s killing of an Australian woman this month.
2017-07-26.snippet: The cameras must now be turned on when officers are dispatched to 911 calls, a change prompted by questions about an officer’s killing of an Australian woman this month.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: Minneapolis police officers will be required to turn on their body cameras as soon as they start responding to 911 calls, part of a policy overhaul announced on Wednesday as fallout continues from the fatal shooting of an unarmed Australian woman by an officer who was wearing a camera but not recording.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Minneapolis Police Change Body Camera Policy After Fatal Shooting

2017-07-26.abstract: “It was only in cleaning out all the drawers and leaving the cupboards as empty as I found them that I saw how I had covered this part of the world.”
2017-07-26.snippet: “It was only in cleaning out all the drawers and leaving the cupboards as empty as I found them that I saw how I had covered this part of the world.”
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: On one of my last nights in Nairobi, Kenya, after serving as The New York Times’s East Africa bureau chief for more than a decade, I sat down on the office floor under one of those grim energy-saver light bulbs that gave off a cold bluish light, pulled open the file cabinets and began excavating.
2017-07-26.headline_main: A Reporter’s East Africa File Cabinets Yield Untold Stories

2017-07-26.abstract: The Irish playwright Conor McPherson weaves an American tale of nomads out of the Bob Dylan songbook in this play at the Old Vic Theater in London.
2017-07-26.snippet: The Irish playwright Conor McPherson weaves an American tale of nomads out of the Bob Dylan songbook in this play at the Old Vic Theater in London.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Irish playwright Conor McPherson has gone a-wanderin’ in a Minnesota of the mind, a bleak and soulful place conjured by the songs of Bob Dylan. As portrayed in “Girl From the North Country” — the truly sui generis new work written and directed by Mr. McPherson, with a multitude of songs by Mr. Dylan — this cold corner of the United States is a place where it is all too easy to lose your way.
2017-07-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Girl From the North Country,’ Rolling Stones Gather Regrets

2017-07-26.abstract: President Trump repeated misstatements about the Iran deal, jobs and health care — and uttered new falsehoods about Lebanon and veterans.
2017-07-26.snippet: President Trump repeated misstatements about the Iran deal, jobs and health care — and uttered new falsehoods about Lebanon and veterans.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: In just a few hours on Tuesday, President Trump made seven misleading statements: about Middle East politics, during a joint news conference with Prime Minister Saad Hariri of Lebanon; about veterans affairs reforms, in remarks to “American heroes”; and about jobs and health care, to supporters in Ohio. Here’s an assessment.
2017-07-26.headline_main: One Day, Three Events, Seven Falsehoods From Trump

2017-07-26.abstract: His widow had asked the hospital to preserve his sperm hours after he died. On Tuesday, a daughter was born to the widow of Officer Wenjian Liu.
2017-07-26.snippet: His widow had asked the hospital to preserve his sperm hours after he died. On Tuesday, a daughter was born to the widow of Officer Wenjian Liu.
2017-07-26.lead_paragraph: When New York City Police Officer Wenjian Liu and his partner were shot and killed in their patrol car in Brooklyn in December 2014, Officer Liu had been married not quite three months. That night, as his family and his fellow officers grieved, his wife asked the hospital to retrieve his sperm, so that someday she might have his child.

2017-07-27.abstract: What can writers’ diaries tell us about our vexed relationship with time?
2017-07-27.snippet: What can writers’ diaries tell us about our vexed relationship with time?
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: For more than 50 years, the German novelist Christa Wolf kept an unusual diary: She recorded the events of just one day — Sept. 27. The project began as an assignment by a Russian newspaper, but she discovered she couldn’t stop. Until her death in 2011, she faithfully jotted down what she ate on that day, and where she went, what she saw and whom. “I began to await with a certain sense of tension what this day of the year, as I soon called it, would bring me each time,” she wrote. “Noting down the details became a sometimes delightful, sometimes inconvenient duty. It also became an exercise in preventing blindness to reality.” The final volume of the diary, “One Day a Year: 2001-2011” (Seagull Books, $21), edited by her husband, Gerhard Wolf, and translated by Katy Derbyshire, was published this spring.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Remains of the Day

2017-07-27.abstract: Charlize Theron plays a spy in “Atomic Blonde,” which comes off like a highlight reel of car crashes and inventively choreographed fights.
2017-07-27.snippet: Charlize Theron plays a spy in “Atomic Blonde,” which comes off like a highlight reel of car crashes and inventively choreographed fights.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: “Atomic Blonde” is going to make an excellent highlight reel. It already is one, in a manner of speaking, given that its strengths are lavishly violent, inventively choreographed fights that have been glued together by nonsense and Charlize Theron. The nonsense involves spies chasing secrets in Berlin just before the fall of the wall, which may suggest John le Carré but plays closer to a dumb and dumber take on Boris and Natasha. Mostly, the movie is an excuse to watch a beautiful, deviously clever female avatar as she is stripped naked, dolled up and repeatedly beaten down only to rise again.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Dressed to Kill, ‘Atomic Blonde’ Also Shoots to Kill
