2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The United States and Venezuela are on a collision course as President Trump promises to inflict economic pain if President Nicolás Maduro goes through with an election intended to enhance his powers.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Wider U.S. Sanctions on Venezuela Risk Biting Both Countries

2017-07-27.abstract: If Gov. Sam Brownback of Kansas is confirmed, as expected, to a post in the Trump administration, Lt. Gov. Jeff Colyer will step in to lead the state.
2017-07-27.snippet: If Gov. Sam Brownback of Kansas is confirmed, as expected, to a post in the Trump administration, Lt. Gov. Jeff Colyer will step in to lead the state.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The governor of Kansas, Sam Brownback, is expected to be nominated as the United States ambassador at large for international religious freedom. If Mr. Brownback is confirmed, as expected, the state’s lieutenant governor, Jeff Colyer, will step in to lead the state.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Waiting in the Wings in Kansas: Who Is Lt. Gov. Jeff Colyer?

2017-07-27.abstract: Seeking vengeance for the rape of his 12-year-old sister, a man was authorized by the council to rape her assailant’s 16-year-old sister.
2017-07-27.snippet: Seeking vengeance for the rape of his 12-year-old sister, a man was authorized by the council to rape her assailant’s 16-year-old sister.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — The Pakistani police arrested 25 people in a rural village on Thursday, after the village council ordered a man to rape a teenage girl publicly to avenge the sexual assault of his sister.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Pakistani Village Council Arrested After Ordering Teenage Girl’s Rape

2017-07-27.abstract: Faced with an apocalyptic hypothetical question, the commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet reiterated the principle of civilian control of the military.
2017-07-27.snippet: Faced with an apocalyptic hypothetical question, the commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet reiterated the principle of civilian control of the military.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The commander of the United States Pacific Fleet was asked a hypothetical question during a talk on Thursday in Australia: If President Trump ordered a nuclear strike on China, would he comply?
2017-07-27.headline_main: What if Trump Ordered a Nuclear Strike on China? I’d Comply, Says Admiral

2017-07-27.abstract: There were no further details on when life support would be removed from the chronically ill infant.
2017-07-27.snippet: There were no further details on when life support would be removed from the chronically ill infant.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British High Court decided on Thursday that Charlie Gard, the chronically ill British infant whose condition has spurred widespread debate about end-of-life care and parents’ rights, will spend his last moments in a hospice before he is taken off life support.
2017-07-27.headline_main: British Court Decides Charlie Gard Will Be Moved to a Hospice to Die

2017-07-27.abstract: Florida officials are looking into the video, which was posted on Instagram, but it remains unclear exactly what the creature was, whether it was alive and where the video was taken.
2017-07-27.snippet: Florida officials are looking into the video, which was posted on Instagram, but it remains unclear exactly what the creature was, whether it was alive and where the video was taken.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The video is short but disturbing: In about 10 seconds, it seems to show a shark flipping chaotically across the water as it is dragged, on a rope, behind a speedboat. At least four people appear to be onboard, watching the spectacle.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Video of Shark, Seemingly Bound and Dragged by a Boat, Under Investigation

2017-07-27.abstract: Mr. Fleming wrote prolifically about powerful men, including Washington, Jefferson, Franklin and Hamilton, and pivotal moments like the battles of Bunker Hill, Lexington and Concord.
2017-07-27.snippet: Mr. Fleming wrote prolifically about powerful men, including Washington, Jefferson, Franklin and Hamilton, and pivotal moments like the battles of Bunker Hill, Lexington and Concord.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Thomas Fleming, a prolific historian with a zealous interest in America’s founding fathers and a historical novelist whose plots included a British conspiracy to kidnap George Washington, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 90.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Thomas Fleming, Historian of the Revolution, Dies at 90

2017-07-27.abstract: A bump in the price of Amazon shares was enough to move Mr. Bezos, briefly, above Mr. Gates, the Microsoft co-founder.
2017-07-27.snippet: A bump in the price of Amazon shares was enough to move Mr. Bezos, briefly, above Mr. Gates, the Microsoft co-founder.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Jeff Bezos on Thursday took something away from a billionaire neighbor in the Seattle area, Bill Gates — the mantle of world’s richest person.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Move Over, Bill Gates. Jeff Bezos Gets a Turn as World’s Richest Person.

2017-07-27.abstract: The attorney general insists on probity and the letter of the law. Republicans know that.
2017-07-27.snippet: The attorney general insists on probity and the letter of the law. Republicans know that.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: MOBILE, Ala. — Donald Trump and Jeff Sessions, the Queens-born developer and the Alabama lawyer, are finding that similar positions on political issues can mask deep differences on underlying principles.
2017-07-27.headline_main: With Sessions, Trump Is Picking on the Wrong Guy

2017-07-27.abstract: The police said there were “reasonable grounds to suspect” that managers of the London high rise that burned last month might have committed various crimes.
2017-07-27.snippet: The police said there were “reasonable grounds to suspect” that managers of the London high rise that burned last month might have committed various crimes.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The London police investigating the fire at Grenfell Tower that left at least 80 people dead have told survivors that there are “reasonable grounds to suspect” that the organizations managing the high rise might have committed corporate manslaughter.
2017-07-27.headline_main: London Police Weigh Corporate Manslaughter in Inquiry of Grenfell Tower Blaze

2017-07-27.abstract: Vehicles can track phone calls and texts, and log queries to websites. Who gets what information and for what purposes? This is what you should know.
2017-07-27.snippet: Vehicles can track phone calls and texts, and log queries to websites. Who gets what information and for what purposes? This is what you should know.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Cars have become rolling listening posts. They can track phone calls and texts, log queries to websites, record what radio stations you listen to — even tell you when you are breaking the law by exceeding the speed limit.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Cars Suck Up Data About You. Where Does It All Go?

2017-07-27.abstract: The unusual brief came in a Long Island case that could prove to be a test of whether federal anti-discrimination laws should cover gay workers.
2017-07-27.snippet: The unusual brief came in a Long Island case that could prove to be a test of whether federal anti-discrimination laws should cover gay workers.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has filed court papers arguing that a major federal civil rights law does not protect employees from discrimination based on sexual orientation, taking a stand against a decision reached under President Barack Obama.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Justice Department Says Rights Law Doesn’t Protect Gays

2017-07-27.abstract: Rick Perry, the Energy secretary, spoke by phone for more than 20 minutes with a man he thought was Volodymyr Groysman, the prime minister of Ukraine.
2017-07-27.snippet: Rick Perry, the Energy secretary, spoke by phone for more than 20 minutes with a man he thought was Volodymyr Groysman, the prime minister of Ukraine.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Earlier this month, Energy Secretary Rick Perry spoke by phone for more than 20 minutes with a man he thought was Volodymyr Groysman, the prime minister of Ukraine. They talked about coal exports and sanctions against Russia, the Paris climate accord and a Russian natural gas project. By all accounts, the tone of the conversation was positive.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Rick Perry Fell for a Prank Call, but He Is Not the First

2017-07-27.abstract: Too many people think they “can’t” solve a crossword. Let us help you get from “can’t” to “can.”
2017-07-27.snippet: Too many people think they “can’t” solve a crossword. Let us help you get from “can’t” to “can.”
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Too many people think they “can’t” solve a crossword. Let us help you get from “can’t” to “can.”
2017-07-27.headline_main: How to Get Started Solving The New York Times Crossword Puzzle

2017-07-27.abstract: Viacom’s exit clears the path for Discovery Communications to strike a deal to buy the owner of Food Network and HGTV.
2017-07-27.snippet: Viacom’s exit clears the path for Discovery Communications to strike a deal to buy the owner of Food Network and HGTV.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The race for the owner of Food Network and HGTV, Scripps Networks Interactive, has come down to one finalist.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Discovery Said to Be in Final Stages of Talks to Acquire Scripps

2017-07-27.abstract: I know the harms caused by official discrimination and denial of who we are. We’re not going back there.
2017-07-27.snippet: I know the harms caused by official discrimination and denial of who we are. We’re not going back there.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: With three tweets, the leader of the largest employer in the country just tried to lay off all trans people in the military. Many service members who were just told “we want you” are suddenly being told “go away.” The sudden reversal by the administration, from allowing trans people to serve openly in the military to outright banning us, is a devastating blow to our livelihoods, our basic humanity, our survival. It is also a devastating blow to the entire credibility of the United States military for years to come.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Chelsea Manning: President Trump, Trans People in the Military Are Here to Stay

2017-07-27.abstract: A blistering summer has left parts of Europe parched and plagued by wildfires, but it is a particular indignity in the Eternal City.
2017-07-27.snippet: A blistering summer has left parts of Europe parched and plagued by wildfires, but it is a particular indignity in the Eternal City.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: ROME — Rome’s cold, clean water has flowed through ancient aqueducts, gurgled in baroque fountains and poured incessantly from thousands of the 19th-century spouts that still grace the city streets. For millenniums, water has symbolized Rome’s dominion over nature, its engineering prowess and deep, seemingly inexhaustible spring of good fortune.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Rome, City of Ancient Aqueducts, Faces Water Rationing

2017-07-27.abstract: A reassuring new study found that hearing impairment rates among teens have dropped since an alarming spike in hearing loss was reported a decade ago.
2017-07-27.snippet: A reassuring new study found that hearing impairment rates among teens have dropped since an alarming spike in hearing loss was reported a decade ago.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Young people continue to listen to loud music on their headphones. But a reassuring new analysis found that hearing impairment rates among teens have dropped since an alarming spike in hearing loss was reported a decade ago.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Good News on Headphones and Hearing Loss

2017-07-27.abstract: The aviation industry represents a big part of the carbon footprint left by Americans. Here are some ways to reduce your impact when you fly.
2017-07-27.snippet: The aviation industry represents a big part of the carbon footprint left by Americans. Here are some ways to reduce your impact when you fly.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Take one round-trip flight between New York and California, and you’ve generated about 20 percent of the greenhouse gases that your car emits over an entire year.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Flying Is Bad for the Planet. You Can Help Make It Better.

2017-07-27.abstract: Besides his numerous ventures in the arts and media, Mr. Paulson also strove to make chess a popular spectator sport on television.
2017-07-27.snippet: Besides his numerous ventures in the arts and media, Mr. Paulson also strove to make chess a popular spectator sport on television.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Andrew Paulson, an expatriate American serial entrepreneur who became a media mogul in Moscow and envisioned transforming world chess into a sports extravaganza, died on July 18 in London. He was 58.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Andrew Paulson, Chess Impresario and Serial Entrepreneur, Dies at 58

2017-07-27.abstract: Recent results show that the Americans are far from invincible. But the players and their coach say that’s O.K. — for the moment.
2017-07-27.snippet: Recent results show that the Americans are far from invincible. But the players and their coach say that’s O.K. — for the moment.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — If fans of the United States women’s national soccer team have grown accustomed to anything over the years, it is winning. The team wins often. Sometimes it wins narrowly, other times more comfortably. But the general theme over the team’s history is that it wins. A lot.
2017-07-27.headline_main: For U.S. Women’s Soccer Team, Some Space to Work Out the Kinks

2017-07-27.abstract: Also: outrage at a baby shower hosted by a mother-to-be; the case of the missing blender; and a forgotten salad order arouses suspicions of dementia.
2017-07-27.snippet: Also: outrage at a baby shower hosted by a mother-to-be; the case of the missing blender; and a forgotten salad order arouses suspicions of dementia.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: I saw a friend I hadn’t seen in a while, though we text frequently. The changes in her face horrified me. It was much broader, her cheeks were huge, and there wasn’t a wrinkle in sight. (We’re in our late 40s.) I thought she’d gained weight, but her body was slim. Later, a mutual friend told me she’s been doing Botox and fillers. The Botox user and I talk freely about our kids and husbands. We’re good friends. I’m surprised she hasn’t told me about the injections. Can I suggest she slow down?
2017-07-27.headline_main: My Friend Uses Too Much Botox. May I Tell Her?

2017-07-27.abstract: The Justice Department filed court papers arguing that a major federal civil rights law does not protect employees from discrimination based on sexual orientation.
2017-07-27.snippet: The Justice Department filed court papers arguing that a major federal civil rights law does not protect employees from discrimination based on sexual orientation.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department filed court papers arguing that a major federal civil rights law does not protect employees from discrimination based on sexual orientation.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Justice Department Brief on Gay Rights

2017-07-27.abstract: The military’s policy is unchanged until the White House alters the rules, a top Pentagon official said a day after President Trump announced that the armed services would bar transgender members.
2017-07-27.snippet: The military’s policy is unchanged until the White House alters the rules, a top Pentagon official said a day after President Trump announced that the armed services would bar transgender members.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Transgender people can continue to serve in the military for now, Pentagon leaders said on Thursday, scrambling to clarify the confusion surrounding President Trump’s abrupt announcement a day earlier that transgender people would no longer be accepted or allowed in uniform.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Transgender People Can Still Serve for Now, U.S. Military Says

2017-07-27.abstract: A policy analyst for a mental health nonprofit writes that such checkups can go a long way toward eradicating the stigma of mental illness.
2017-07-27.snippet: A policy analyst for a mental health nonprofit writes that such checkups can go a long way toward eradicating the stigma of mental illness.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-07-27.headline_main: Mental Health Checkups for Kids

2017-07-27.abstract: The Oregon musician arrives with an amiable, joyously off-kilter debut album, “Good for You.”
2017-07-27.snippet: The Oregon musician arrives with an amiable, joyously off-kilter debut album, “Good for You.”
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, ORE. — There is a door at Portland State University that doesn’t quite lock, and one afternoon in early April, the rapper Aminé walked up to it and gave it a hopeful tug. It popped open with an easy exhale, and he smiled. A couple of years ago, when he was still a student here studying marketing but plotting a music career, he would sneak into this building, make his way to a nondescript beige room on the second floor, and, in the quiet of night, accompanied by no one, work on his songs.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Meet Aminé, a Joyful Rapper With an Eye on Politics

2017-07-27.abstract: Tasty has been so profitable through its brand-sponsored videos that it is now turning its digital food machine into real-world products.
2017-07-27.snippet: Tasty has been so profitable through its brand-sponsored videos that it is now turning its digital food machine into real-world products.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Overhead instructional videos of people making food have swept the internet. Making sliders or onion rings? Such videos online have snagged more than 160 million views each.
2017-07-27.headline_main: BuzzFeed Is Turning Food Videos Into a Profit Empire

2017-07-27.abstract: Multiple antivirus applications generally do not coexist well together on the computer because they need to monitor the same areas of your system.
2017-07-27.snippet: Multiple antivirus applications generally do not coexist well together on the computer because they need to monitor the same areas of your system.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Q. Should I use more than one Windows 10 antivirus program on my PC?
2017-07-27.headline_main: Why One Antivirus Program Is Better Than Two

2017-07-27.abstract: A lawsuit says that the education department’s use of vouchers for special education services is unjust and that children often don’t get help they need.
2017-07-27.snippet: A lawsuit says that the education department’s use of vouchers for special education services is unjust and that children often don’t get help they need.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Two students with disabilities and their mothers, along with a Bronx nonprofit organization, sued the New York City Education Department in Federal District Court on Thursday, saying that it had violated their right to a “free appropriate public education.”
2017-07-27.headline_main: City Violates Disabled Students’ Rights, Suit Claims

2017-07-27.abstract: Jean-Christophe Maillot’s version of Shakespeare’s comedy is a postmodern mess that replaces the troupe’s reckless hugeness with slapstick cuteness.
2017-07-27.snippet: Jean-Christophe Maillot’s version of Shakespeare’s comedy is a postmodern mess that replaces the troupe’s reckless hugeness with slapstick cuteness.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Brush away your Shakespeare! Start wrecking him now! The Bolshoi’s latest calling card — at the David H. Koch Theater this week as part of the Lincoln Center Festival — is Jean-Christophe Maillot’s staging of “The Taming of the Shrew.” This is a postmodern mess that begins by untelling the familiar story of Shakespeare’s vivid but controversial play.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: In Bolshoi’s Ballet, No Shrew to Tame

2017-07-27.abstract: “What Happened,” a forthcoming memoir by Hillary Clinton, promises to be a candid account of what the 2016 election was like for her.
2017-07-27.snippet: “What Happened,” a forthcoming memoir by Hillary Clinton, promises to be a candid account of what the 2016 election was like for her.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton hasn’t shied away from the public stage in the months since her defeat in the 2016 election. She’s been giving speeches, sitting on panels, going to the theater, and taking selfies with supporters, and this fall, she’ll be publishing a book that promises to be “her most personal memoir yet,” according to her publisher, Simon & Schuster.
2017-07-27.headline_main: New Details From Hillary Clinton’s Memoir Revealed

2017-07-27.abstract: Ms. Foray cackled, chirped, meowed and sometimes sang her way through nearly 300 productions. Rocky the flying squirrel was among her most popular characters.
2017-07-27.snippet: Ms. Foray cackled, chirped, meowed and sometimes sang her way through nearly 300 productions. Rocky the flying squirrel was among her most popular characters.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: June Foray, an actress of a thousand voices, who portrayed Rocky the flying squirrel and the fiendish spy Natasha Fatale on the wickedly satirical animated adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle in the 1960s and myriad other animated creatures and characters on television and film, died on Wednesday in Los Angeles. She was 99.
2017-07-27.headline_main: June Foray, Virtuoso of Cartoon Voices, Notably Rocky’s, Dies at 99

2017-07-27.abstract: The house’s fall/winter 2017 show featured posters inspired by political and movie signage.
2017-07-27.snippet: The house’s fall/winter 2017 show featured posters inspired by political and movie signage.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: When guests walked onto the set of Prada’s fall/winter 2017 women’s show in February, they were met with a surprise: Instead of the elaborate venue typically constructed for fashion shows, the space was designed to feel surprisingly intimate. Offsetting the high-arched ceilings of Prada’s Milan headquarters were neatly-appointed beds, wall lamps and low-slung chairs. Stickers and posters lined the walls. The effect was like walking into a quintessential childhood bedroom — in an unspecific time period, and an unspecific place.
2017-07-27.headline_main: The Story Behind Prada’s Fall/Winter 2017 Set

2017-07-27.abstract: Every month, as various licenses expire, streaming services lose movies and TV series from their catalogs. Here are seven movies leaving Netflix in August.
2017-07-27.snippet: Every month, as various licenses expire, streaming services lose movies and TV series from their catalogs. Here are seven movies leaving Netflix in August.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: There’s more to watch than ever before and there are more streaming services on which to watch it. Here at Watching, a film and TV recommendation website from The New York Times, we direct you toward what’s new and what’s good.
2017-07-27.headline_main: 7 Good Movies Expiring From Netflix in August

2017-07-27.abstract: Three artists were chosen for what the Brooklyn Academy of Music says is its first formal relationship with a residency partner.
2017-07-27.snippet: Three artists were chosen for what the Brooklyn Academy of Music says is its first formal relationship with a residency partner.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The Brooklyn Academy of Music, in what it says is its first formal relationship with a residency partner, will join forces with the budding Lumberyard Contemporary Performing Arts organization in upstate New York to commission and nurture three new dance works.
2017-07-27.headline_main: BAM and Lumberyard Create New Dance Residencies

2017-07-27.abstract: Three months after an infamous video, United Airlines’ earnings were surprisingly robust, perhaps proof that people ultimately shop for convenience and price.
2017-07-27.snippet: Three months after an infamous video, United Airlines’ earnings were surprisingly robust, perhaps proof that people ultimately shop for convenience and price.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: After videos of David Dao, a medical doctor who in April was dragged kicking and screaming off an overbooked United Airlines plane, went viral and set off a global uproar, the outlook for United looked grim. Within days, the Twitter hashtag #BoycottUnited had been used over 3.5 million times.
2017-07-27.headline_main: The Boycott That Wasn’t: How United Weathered a Media Firestorm

2017-07-27.abstract: An art installation by the Finnish design team Company; a group show that richly surveys the battlefield that is life; and more in Manhattan spaces.
2017-07-27.snippet: An art installation by the Finnish design team Company; a group show that richly surveys the battlefield that is life; and more in Manhattan spaces.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Through Aug. 4. Gladstone Gallery, 515 West 24th Street, Manhattan; 212-206-9300, gladstonegallery.com.
2017-07-27.headline_main: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week

2017-07-27.abstract: Four Americans made this year’s longlist of 13 works — which will be pared down to a list of six in September.
2017-07-27.snippet: Four Americans made this year’s longlist of 13 works — which will be pared down to a list of six in September.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The Man Booker Prize for Fiction announced its 2017 longlist on Wednesday, featuring 13 works by a variety of literary heavyweights.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Man Booker Longlist Features Arundhati Roy and Colson Whitehead

2017-07-27.abstract: “Beloved.” “Infinite Jest.” “White Teeth.” “Team of Rivals.” Four decades of signature reviews and essays by The Times’s Pulitzer Prize-winning book critic.
2017-07-27.snippet: “Beloved.” “Infinite Jest.” “White Teeth.” “Team of Rivals.” Four decades of signature reviews and essays by The Times’s Pulitzer Prize-winning book critic.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: For nearly four decades, Michiko Kakutani, who has decided to step down as chief book critic of The New York Times, has anointed new talent, charted the peaks and valleys of literary careers and memorialized writers when they’re gone. She has stayed up all night reading embargoed memoirs by ex-presidents and novels about boy wizards. She has chronicled the changing landscape of technology and its impact on reading; culture in the wake of 9/11; fiction in an era of war.
2017-07-27.headline_main: 38 Years on Books: The Essential Michiko Kakutani Reader

2017-07-27.abstract: Lazard, Evercore and Moelis beat earnings estimates by wider margins than their big bank peers. Yet advice ought to be easier to track than trading.
2017-07-27.snippet: Lazard, Evercore and Moelis beat earnings estimates by wider margins than their big bank peers. Yet advice ought to be easier to track than trading.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Merger shops are becoming the new black boxes of Wall Street.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Merger Advisory Boutiques Become Wall Street’s New Black Boxes

2017-07-27.abstract: This narrow Thai restaurant in Woodside, Queens, makes few concessions to Western palates.
2017-07-27.snippet: This narrow Thai restaurant in Woodside, Queens, makes few concessions to Western palates.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: This narrow Thai restaurant in Woodside, Queens, makes few concessions to Western palates.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Playground

2017-07-27.abstract: Sudarat Yingyong serves many dishes, like a salad of red weaver ants, that make no concessions to Western palates.
2017-07-27.snippet: Sudarat Yingyong serves many dishes, like a salad of red weaver ants, that make no concessions to Western palates.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The red weaver ant larvae are creamy white, clinging and plump. In the low light, they look as harmless as quinoa. They deflate softly in the mouth, somewhere between a squish and a pop, tasting faintly of the mango leaves their parents once fed on.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Thai Dishes, Beloved and Rare, at Playground in Woodside, Queens

2017-07-27.abstract: Teens who were overweight were at significantly increased risk for developing colon cancer as adults.
2017-07-27.snippet: Teens who were overweight were at significantly increased risk for developing colon cancer as adults.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Teenagers who were overweight at 17 were at significantly increased risk for developing colon cancer later in adulthood, and those who were obese were at increased risk for rectal cancer as well, according to a new report.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Overweight at 17? Your Colon Cancer Risk Rises

2017-07-27.abstract: After receiving a request from Libya to operate in its waters, Italy hopes to have a freer hand in stemming a rising tide of migrants.
2017-07-27.snippet: After receiving a request from Libya to operate in its waters, Italy hopes to have a freer hand in stemming a rising tide of migrants.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: ROME — Italy’s prime minister convened top cabinet ministers on Thursday to discuss a plan to send Italian warships into Libyan territorial waters to combat smugglers who have sent thousands of migrants to Italian shores.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Italy Plans Naval Mission Off Libya to Stop Migrant Boats

2017-07-27.abstract: John Urschel, who has pursued a doctorate in math at M.I.T., retired a couple of days after a report on a brain disease linked to repeated hits to the head.
2017-07-27.snippet: John Urschel, who has pursued a doctorate in math at M.I.T., retired a couple of days after a report on a brain disease linked to repeated hits to the head.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: One of the N.F.L.’s smartest players did the math and decided to retire after just three years in the league.
2017-07-27.headline_main: For Ravens’ John Urschel, Playing in the N.F.L. No Longer Adds Up

2017-07-27.abstract: Protesting their own newspaper, the printing pressmen stopped the presses for nearly 15 minutes, earning the thanks of President Richard M. Nixon.
2017-07-27.snippet: Protesting their own newspaper, the printing pressmen stopped the presses for nearly 15 minutes, earning the thanks of President Richard M. Nixon.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: “A Resolution to Impeach Richard M. Nixon as President of the United States,” said the headline across a two-page political advertisement in The New York Times.
2017-07-27.headline_main: 1972 | Pressmen Balk at an Impeachment Ad in The Times

2017-07-27.abstract: Researchers predict that increased rainfall from a warming climate will wash more nitrogen from fertilizers into American rivers and coastal waters, causing more algae blooms and dead zones.
2017-07-27.snippet: Researchers predict that increased rainfall from a warming climate will wash more nitrogen from fertilizers into American rivers and coastal waters, causing more algae blooms and dead zones.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Nitrogen-based fertilizers, which came into wide use after World War II, helped prompt the agricultural revolution that has allowed the Earth to feed its seven billion people.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Fertilizers, a Boon to Agriculture, Pose Growing Threat to U.S. Waterways

2017-07-27.abstract: Republican negotiators hope to pass the first major revision of the tax code since 1986, after dropping a contentious border adjustment tax on imports.
2017-07-27.snippet: Republican negotiators hope to pass the first major revision of the tax code since 1986, after dropping a contentious border adjustment tax on imports.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After six months of deliberations and occasional quarreling, the top Republican tax negotiators in Congress and the Trump administration declared on Thursday that they had united behind a set of common principles that would guide them as they rush to complete the first overhaul of the tax code in three decades — and that they would do it by the end of this year.
2017-07-27.headline_main: White House and G.O.P. Leaders Reach Deal on Principles of Tax Overhaul

2017-07-27.abstract: A new study says North Korea’s army of hackers has formed new groups that are more intent on obtaining hard currency than on stirring up trouble abroad.
2017-07-27.snippet: A new study says North Korea’s army of hackers has formed new groups that are more intent on obtaining hard currency than on stirring up trouble abroad.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea’s state-sponsored hackers are increasingly going after money rather than secrets, according to a report published on Thursday by a South Korean government-backed institute.
2017-07-27.headline_main: North Korea Tries to Make Hacking a Profit Center

2017-07-27.abstract: The war in Congress over repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act has brought anxiety to the people whose health insurance is at risk.
2017-07-27.snippet: The war in Congress over repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act has brought anxiety to the people whose health insurance is at risk.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Ever since the November election, when the fate of her family’s health coverage was suddenly up for grabs, Meghan Borland has been consumed by each twitch and turn of the political debate. She has gone to protests, met with her congressman, lost sleep, shed tears.
2017-07-27.headline_main: ‘I Am Totally Burned Out’: Patients Watch Health Care Debate With Dread

2017-07-27.abstract: Kirsten Childs’s 2000 musical about internalized racism gets a playful, poignant production at Encores! Off-Center.
2017-07-27.snippet: Kirsten Childs’s 2000 musical about internalized racism gets a playful, poignant production at Encores! Off-Center.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Little on New York stages right now is as much flat-out fun as “The Skate,” a “let’s learn a new dance” number in the middle of the first act of “The Bubbly Black Girl Sheds Her Chameleon Skin.”
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Bubbly Black Girl’ Lets a Smile Be Her Camouflage

2017-07-27.abstract: President Trump’s nominees to oversee large banks said in a hearing that the government should roll back some post-crisis strictures.
2017-07-27.snippet: President Trump’s nominees to oversee large banks said in a hearing that the government should roll back some post-crisis strictures.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Randal Quarles, nominated by President Trump to supervise the nation’s largest banks, told senators on Thursday that it was time to reconsider some of the strictures imposed on the financial industry after the 2008 financial crisis.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Banking Regulatory Nominees Back Fewer Financial Restrictions

2017-07-27.abstract: The missile test is likely to infuriate President Trump but is not prohibited under the 2015 nuclear agreement between Iran and a group of six nations led by the United States.
2017-07-27.snippet: The missile test is likely to infuriate President Trump but is not prohibited under the 2015 nuclear agreement between Iran and a group of six nations led by the United States.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Iran successfully launched a missile into space on Thursday, state media reported, two days after the United States House of Representatives approved a bill that would impose additional sanctions against the country, and Russia and North Korea.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Iran Reports Successful Launch of Missile as U.S. Considers New Sanctions

2017-07-27.abstract: The Institute of Contemporary Art, Boston, is facing repercussions over a controversy surrounding Dana Schutz’s painting “Open Casket.”
2017-07-27.snippet: The Institute of Contemporary Art, Boston, is facing repercussions over a controversy surrounding Dana Schutz’s painting “Open Casket.”
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The artist Dana Schutz can’t seem to escape controversy.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Outrage Follows a Painter From the Whitney Biennial to Boston

2017-07-27.abstract: The South Street Seaport has long been a magnet for tourists at the expense of locals. A new addition to the waterfront aims to change that.
2017-07-27.snippet: The South Street Seaport has long been a magnet for tourists at the expense of locals. A new addition to the waterfront aims to change that.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: For several decades, few self-respecting New Yorkers would venture down to the South Street Seaport. Once renowned for its fish market and colorful waterfront characters straight out of a Joseph Mitchell short story, the 400-year-old historic port had become a tourist-only zone filled with I ♥ NY T-shirt stalls and suburban chain stores. It was ready for a makeover.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Reclaiming South Street Seaport for New Yorkers

2017-07-27.abstract: Here are a few helpful tips for when the Republicans do whatever it is with health care.
2017-07-27.snippet: Here are a few helpful tips for when the Republicans do whatever it is with health care.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: As heated debate over the future of the American health care system continues on the Senate floor and on Twitter, we are sending this form letter to notify you of your options should you lose health coverage.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Dear (Potentially Soon-to-Be-Former) Health Insurance Policyholder

2017-07-27.abstract: The chief executive of the Boy Scouts of America said he did not mean for the event to become a venue for Mr. Trump’s partisan political attacks.
2017-07-27.snippet: The chief executive of the Boy Scouts of America said he did not mean for the event to become a venue for Mr. Trump’s partisan political attacks.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Facing an angry backlash from parents and former members, the chief executive of the Boy Scouts of America apologized on Thursday for political remarks made by President Trump at the organization’s National Jamboree this week.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Boy Scouts Apologize Over President Trump’s Remarks at Jamboree

2017-07-27.abstract: Mr. Farmer found a way to get around spending limits on his way to raising $800 million for candidates.
2017-07-27.snippet: Mr. Farmer found a way to get around spending limits on his way to raising $800 million for candidates.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Robert Farmer, a prodigious fund-raiser who contrived a formula to circumvent federal campaign spending limits with so-called soft money, and who was credited with raising $800 million for four presidential candidates and the Democratic Party, died on July 22 in Miami. He was 78.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Robert Farmer, Resourceful Fund-Raiser for Democrats, Dies at 78

2017-07-27.abstract: Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, said he considered the threats to increase sanctions and various probes underway in Washington “an increase in anti-Russia hysteria.”
2017-07-27.snippet: Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, said he considered the threats to increase sanctions and various probes underway in Washington “an increase in anti-Russia hysteria.”
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Thursday denounced as “illegal” American plans for new sanctions against his country and scorned investigations into the Trump campaign’s relations with Russia as political hysteria. Moscow, Mr. Putin warned, cannot “put up forever with this boorishness.”
2017-07-27.headline_main: Putin Derides Sanctions and Trump Investigations as ‘Boorishness’

2017-07-27.abstract: In Hollywood, anything goes — even this big-screen tale about those little digital expressions of emotions.
2017-07-27.snippet: In Hollywood, anything goes — even this big-screen tale about those little digital expressions of emotions.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: In late 2014, the hack of Sony resulted in the publishing of private emails that much of the internet had a great time laughing at. One item considered particularly risible in certain corners was a pitch to the co-chairwoman of Sony Pictures Entertainment from a sort of youth consultant, averring that “NBD,” shorthand for no big deal, was popular text speak among millennials and that it should be used as dialogue in a new “Spider-Man” movie.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘The Emoji Movie’ Can’t Escape Its Own Idiocy

2017-07-27.abstract: A study of ancient DNA recovered from remains found in Lebanon contradicts a biblical story that an ancient war wiped out the group.
2017-07-27.snippet: A study of ancient DNA recovered from remains found in Lebanon contradicts a biblical story that an ancient war wiped out the group.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: There is a story in the Hebrew Bible that tells of God’s call for the annihilation of the Canaanites, a people who lived in what are now Jordan, Lebanon, Syria, Israel and the Palestinian territories thousands of years ago.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Fate of Ancient Canaanites Seen in DNA Analysis: They Survived

2017-07-27.abstract: Enabling soldiers to pursue their gender identity allows them to feel a part of the team, and be all they can be.
2017-07-27.snippet: Enabling soldiers to pursue their gender identity allows them to feel a part of the team, and be all they can be.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: HOHENFELS, Germany — My eyes welled with tears of happiness, and I cried as I had never cried before. For 20 years, I fought against who I am. But that day was the closest I ever felt to freedom. It was June 30, 2016, and Secretary of Defense Ashton Carter had just announced an end to the United States military’s ban on transgender service.
2017-07-27.headline_main: I Am a Transgender Female Captain in the U.S. Army

2017-07-27.abstract: Health care professionals and others weigh in on an opinion essay about a pharmacy error.
2017-07-27.snippet: Health care professionals and others weigh in on an opinion essay about a pharmacy error.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-07-27.headline_main: What’s the Rx? The Case of the Medication Mix-Up

2017-07-27.abstract: Jonathan Weisman, deputy Washington editor for The Times, explains the voting and amendment process that the bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act must go through next.
2017-07-27.snippet: Jonathan Weisman, deputy Washington editor for The Times, explains the voting and amendment process that the bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act must go through next.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Weisman, deputy Washington editor for The Times, explains the voting and amendment process that the bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act must go through next.
2017-07-27.headline_main: What Is the Health Care ‘Vote-a-Rama?’

2017-07-27.abstract: Read about how the other side thinks: Writers across the political spectrum on the president’s barring of transgender people from military service.
2017-07-27.snippet: Read about how the other side thinks: Writers across the political spectrum on the president’s barring of transgender people from military service.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. That’s why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Right and Left React to Trump’s Transgender Ban

2017-07-27.abstract: Readers condemn Republicans for “putting on a show” rather than addressing the problem and urge bipartisan cooperation.
2017-07-27.snippet: Readers condemn Republicans for “putting on a show” rather than addressing the problem and urge bipartisan cooperation.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-07-27.headline_main: The Machinations in Congress on Health Care

2017-07-27.abstract: Gov. Sam Brownback has accepted a job with the Trump administration. His departure will be an anticlimactic turn for a man who once had presidential aspirations.
2017-07-27.snippet: Gov. Sam Brownback has accepted a job with the Trump administration. His departure will be an anticlimactic turn for a man who once had presidential aspirations.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: TOPEKA, Kan. — For more than six years, Gov. Sam Brownback has steered Kansas on a hard right turn on one issue after another: taxes, guns, abortion rights, Medicaid and welfare benefits.
2017-07-27.headline_main: With State Finances Shaky, Kansas Governor Prepares to Step Down

2017-07-27.abstract: This chart shows what a narrower repeal would do.
2017-07-27.snippet: This chart shows what a narrower repeal would do.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: This chart shows what a narrower repeal would do.
2017-07-27.headline_main: The “Skinny” Repeal Republicans Hope to Pass Would Leave Huge Numbers Uninsured

2017-07-27.abstract: Evelyn Rodriguez’s grief has fueled a crusade against the MS-13 gang. But some fear her meeting with the president Friday will fuel an anti-immigration agenda.
2017-07-27.snippet: Evelyn Rodriguez’s grief has fueled a crusade against the MS-13 gang. But some fear her meeting with the president Friday will fuel an anti-immigration agenda.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: BRENTWOOD, N.Y. — These days, Evelyn Rodriguez always carries her blue clipboard, jotting down notes when inspiration or anxiety strikes. It has been her constant companion in the 10 months since her 16-year-old daughter, Kayla Cuevas, was killed by members of the transnational MS-13 gang.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Her Daughter Was Killed by a Gang. She Has a Message for Trump.

2017-07-27.abstract: The Thirty Meter Telescope, which would be the largest in the Northern Hemisphere, could survey black holes and planets orbiting distant stars, but opponents say it would desecrate a sacred mountain.
2017-07-27.snippet: The Thirty Meter Telescope, which would be the largest in the Northern Hemisphere, could survey black holes and planets orbiting distant stars, but opponents say it would desecrate a sacred mountain.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The stars are still in reach for astronomers who want to build a $1.4 billion telescope on top of Hawaii’s Mauna Kea.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Giant Telescope Atop Hawaii’s Mauna Kea Should Be Approved, Judge Says

2017-07-27.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-07-27.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2017-07-27.headline_main: U.S. Senate, Jerusalem, Jeff Bezos: Your Friday Briefing

2017-07-27.abstract: This white grape almost disappeared from Spain in the middle of the 20th century, but a dedicated group succeeded in reviving it.
2017-07-27.snippet: This white grape almost disappeared from Spain in the middle of the 20th century, but a dedicated group succeeded in reviving it.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Wine is full of places and grapes that were virtually unknown 10 or 15 years ago. We’ve covered several of these, including assyrtiko from Santorini and the reds of Ribeira Sacra.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Your Next Lesson: Godello From Spain

2017-07-27.abstract: Consumers may hold strong opinions about certain kinds of wine, but occasionally revisiting those biases opens people up to new pleasures.
2017-07-27.snippet: Consumers may hold strong opinions about certain kinds of wine, but occasionally revisiting those biases opens people up to new pleasures.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The last few weeks of Wine School have been as much of an education for me as they may have been for anybody else.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Giving New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc a Second Chance

2017-07-27.abstract: For its free summer theater program, Theatreworks USA has adapted a children’s book series featuring a laid-back, guitar-playing feline hero.
2017-07-27.snippet: For its free summer theater program, Theatreworks USA has adapted a children’s book series featuring a laid-back, guitar-playing feline hero.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Everyone knows that cats love to shred. But the shredding Pete enjoys is far more likely to damage your eardrums than your couch. This cat plays a mean guitar, and while some members of his species merely expect to be treated like rock stars, Pete really is one.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Pete the Cat,’ a Kitty Rocker Who Refuses to Be a Pet

2017-07-27.abstract: “Le Gai Savoir,” a series of conversations between two young militants, arrived in 1969 after Jean-Luc Godard said he was done making movies.
2017-07-27.snippet: “Le Gai Savoir,” a series of conversations between two young militants, arrived in 1969 after Jean-Luc Godard said he was done making movies.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: For many, Jean-Luc Godard’s great period began with “Breathless” in 1960 and culminated less than a decade later with “Weekend,” a movie that has a final title declaring the end of cinema. But there was also a nearly forgotten feature that extended this glorious run.
2017-07-27.headline_main: A Godard Riff That Adapts Rousseau’s Treatise on Education

2017-07-27.abstract: In this absurdly charming film, Kyle Mooney plays an obsessed fan who discovers that there is an entire world waiting for him beyond his TV.
2017-07-27.snippet: In this absurdly charming film, Kyle Mooney plays an obsessed fan who discovers that there is an entire world waiting for him beyond his TV.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The absurd and absurdly charming “Brigsby Bear” sounds, well, unbearable. It’s the story of a young man who, after decades of being shut away from the world, splashes down in it like a space alien. There are reasons for his re-entry, though that’s getting ahead of the story, which uses a queasy crime as a jumping-off point to spin a largely sweet, often very funny fairy tale about the perils and the sustaining pleasures of obsessive fandom. Mostly, it is an account of one man’s great, mad love, one that’s mocked, tested and deemed near-pathological — a familiar plight for many superfans.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Cosplay and Comedy in ‘Brigsby Bear’

2017-07-27.abstract: The disappearance of three girls and their teacher in 1900 rocks a small Australian town in this provocative mystery from Peter Weir.
2017-07-27.snippet: The disappearance of three girls and their teacher in 1900 rocks a small Australian town in this provocative mystery from Peter Weir.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Peter Weir’s haunting drama “Picnic at Hanging Rock” is one of the most celebrated films in Australian cinema, a subtle and indelible mystery that has unsettled audiences since its foreign debut in 1975. As it does in many of Australia’s best-known films (“Walkabout,” “The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert” and the “Mad Max” series), the Outback plays a significant part in the story — when three schoolgirls and a teacher go missing there on a Valentine’s Day picnic in 1900, their wild environment becomes more than just a backdrop, it’s an unknown world that’s more menacing than majestic.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Three Reasons to Watch ‘Picnic at Hanging Rock’

2017-07-27.abstract: A follow-up to “An Inconvenient Truth,” with new information on climate change and even some positive developments.
2017-07-27.snippet: A follow-up to “An Inconvenient Truth,” with new information on climate change and even some positive developments.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: In a summer movie landscape with Spider-Man, a simian army waging further battle for the planet and Charlize Theron as a sexy Cold War-era superspy, it says something that one of the most compelling characters is Al Gore.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘An Inconvenient Sequel,’ With Al Gore Keeping the Pressure On

2017-07-27.abstract: Elon Musk’s rocket company raised $350 million in new financing, raising its valuation to about $21 billion.
2017-07-27.snippet: Elon Musk’s rocket company raised $350 million in new financing, raising its valuation to about $21 billion.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — SpaceX, the rocket maker founded by billionaire Elon Musk, has raised up to $350 million in new financing and is now valued at around $21 billion, making it one of the most valuable privately held companies in the world.
2017-07-27.headline_main: SpaceX Is Now One of the World’s Most Valuable Privately Held Companies

2017-07-27.abstract: In this sweet, often understated film set in a Hasidic neighborhood, the title character is a widower who must remarry to regain custody of his son.
2017-07-27.snippet: In this sweet, often understated film set in a Hasidic neighborhood, the title character is a widower who must remarry to regain custody of his son.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: My heart broke a little near the end of “Menashe,” a sweet comedy that’s not without a bit of sadness. For sure, this funny and tender film prompts cheerful smiles, but sometimes they turn melancholy.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Menashe’ Finds Faith and Fatherhood Sometimes at Odds

2017-07-27.abstract: Nicole Garcia’s turgid adaptation of an Italian novella makes for a silly movie, despite a strong performance from Marion Cotillard.
2017-07-27.snippet: Nicole Garcia’s turgid adaptation of an Italian novella makes for a silly movie, despite a strong performance from Marion Cotillard.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: A full accounting of the silliness of “From the Land of the Moon” requires revealing a surprise near the end. Few viewers are likely to make it that far, so let’s start where many will stop: the English-language title, whose meaning is never clarified.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘From the Land of the Moon,’ and on Uneven Ground

2017-07-27.abstract: In the film, a linguist seeks to keep a language alive, but the only two men who speak it aren’t interested.
2017-07-27.snippet: In the film, a linguist seeks to keep a language alive, but the only two men who speak it aren’t interested.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: This is one of those movies in which every shot is beautiful. Conventionally beautiful, that is. “I Dream in Another Language” features lush tropical landscapes and attractive, compelling people, always lit — not quite just so (the filmmakers clearly know better) — with exemplary attention to the most eye-catching detail. It’s delectably watchable.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: In Search of a Dying Tongue in ‘I Dream in Another Language’

2017-07-27.abstract: In this road movie, a woman whose son has committed suicide travels to confront the hot-dog tycoon who stole her son’s idea.
2017-07-27.snippet: In this road movie, a woman whose son has committed suicide travels to confront the hot-dog tycoon who stole her son’s idea.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: It may be time to retire the type of road movie in which the protagonist, ostensibly on an urgent journey, insists on taking back roads — partly because she doesn’t like trucks, she says, but really because a quick drive on the Interstate wouldn’t sustain a feature.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Holly Hunter and Carrie Coon Try to Redeem ‘Strange Weather’

2017-07-27.abstract: Dr. Needleman studied lost baby teeth to show that any level of absorbed lead can damage young brains.
2017-07-27.snippet: Dr. Needleman studied lost baby teeth to show that any level of absorbed lead can damage young brains.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Dr. Herbert Needleman, whose studies of children exposed to low levels of lead prompted regulations that limited or banned the metal in a range of common products, like gasoline and paint, and set a standard for the modern study of environmental toxins, died on July 18 in Pittsburgh. He was 89.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Dr. Herbert Needleman, Who Saw Lead’s Wider Harm to Children, Dies at 89

2017-07-27.abstract: David Singer’s film is a modest con movie about the lengths an aspiring actress is willing to go to for some extra cash.
2017-07-27.snippet: David Singer’s film is a modest con movie about the lengths an aspiring actress is willing to go to for some extra cash.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: The title “Imperfections” doesn’t lie: Viewers of David Singer’s microbudgeted directorial debut will have to endure plenty of baggy scenes and awkward exchanges to enjoy the upside of this modest con movie, which has the charming, almost anachronistic noir setting of Chicago’s Jewelers Row district. (As a former Chicagoan, I’ll confess to some affection for the location, around the corner from the city’s main screening room for movie critics.)
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Diamonds Are a Mighty Tease in ‘Imperfections,’ a Noir Set in Chicago

2017-07-27.abstract: This documentary examines why the Dalai Lama is being careful to protect his lineage from Chinese interference.
2017-07-27.snippet: This documentary examines why the Dalai Lama is being careful to protect his lineage from Chinese interference.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: A surplus of wisdom and benevolence radiates from “The Last Dalai Lama?,” written and directed by Mickey Lemle, the filmmaker of “Compassion in Exile” (1993), another documentary about this Buddhist leader, who is 82.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘The Last Dalai Lama?’ Asks What Comes Next

2017-07-27.abstract: In war-torn Liberia, Charlize Theron and Javier Bardem face a big problem: how to keep their knotty relationship from fizzling.
2017-07-27.snippet: In war-torn Liberia, Charlize Theron and Javier Bardem face a big problem: how to keep their knotty relationship from fizzling.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Sean Penn has some significant experience as a human-rights activist. He has shown commendable stalwartness in walking the walk, so to speak, not just starting a foundation to help victims of  Haiti’s 2010 earthquake but traveling there to help on the ground. We can read Mr. Penn’s latest directorial effort, “The Last Face,” as a kind of tribute to the aid workers he has met. As well meaning as this movie is, it is also a turgid, muddled one.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Aid Workers in Love and War in Sean Penn’s ‘The Last Face’

2017-07-27.abstract: They are known in punk rock circles as simply Dennis and Lois, two superfans who are still going to concerts and shows, and bonding with the bands.
2017-07-27.snippet: They are known in punk rock circles as simply Dennis and Lois, two superfans who are still going to concerts and shows, and bonding with the bands.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Dennis Anderson and Lois Kahlert’s first date was in 1975 at CBGB, the seminal East Village club. Talking Heads and another band, Television, were on the bill and Lou Reed was shooting pool.
2017-07-27.headline_main: A Couple of Punks Who Just Won’t Quit

2017-07-27.abstract: Mikheil Saakashvili, a former Georgian president who moved to Ukraine to help fight corruption, went from being President Petro O. Poroshenko’s ally to his opponent.
2017-07-27.snippet: Mikheil Saakashvili, a former Georgian president who moved to Ukraine to help fight corruption, went from being President Petro O. Poroshenko’s ally to his opponent.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Once they were prominent allies in opposing the Kremlin: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine and the former president of Georgia, Mikheil Saakashvili. Mr. Saakashvili even went so far as to emigrate to Ukraine to serve as a regional governor under Mr. Poroshenko.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Ukraine’s President Sidelines Opponent by Stripping His Citizenship

2017-07-27.abstract: Dustin Guy Defa wrote and directed this low-budget feature that tells the stories of several New Yorkers over the course of a day.
2017-07-27.snippet: Dustin Guy Defa wrote and directed this low-budget feature that tells the stories of several New Yorkers over the course of a day.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Despite some notable names in “Person to Person,” it’s the lesser-known actors who leave an impression. But maybe that’s not entirely surprising for a movie loosely about authenticity and the little absurdities that abound in New York City.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: In ‘Person to Person,’ the Real-ish Humans of New York

2017-07-27.abstract: The documentary filmmaker Fern Levitt wants to shut down the dog-sledding industry. She makes a moving argument.
2017-07-27.snippet: The documentary filmmaker Fern Levitt wants to shut down the dog-sledding industry. She makes a moving argument.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: It’s easy to fall in love with the animals in “Sled Dogs.” It’s thornier to sift through the words of the handlers and mushers — many of whom seem to genuinely care for the dogs — and determine how pervasive abuse is in dog-sledding ventures.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Sled Dogs’ Exposes Abuse of Working Animals

2017-07-27.abstract: A sprawling documentary retraces the birth of the punk scene in the Bay Area, where bands like Green Day and Rancid came together and thrived.
2017-07-27.snippet: A sprawling documentary retraces the birth of the punk scene in the Bay Area, where bands like Green Day and Rancid came together and thrived.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Punk history is full of lurid misadventures, and Corbett Redford’s thorough documentary, “Turn It Around: The Story of East Bay Punk,” collects many of those “you had to be there” stories for a lively — if lengthy — chronicle of the Northern California punk scene, beginning in the late 1970s.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Turn It Around’ Plays to Fans of West Coast Punk Music

2017-07-27.abstract: This documentary celebrates the Italian cinematographer who brought a golden touch to his collaborations with Michelangelo Antonioni and Woody Allen.
2017-07-27.snippet: This documentary celebrates the Italian cinematographer who brought a golden touch to his collaborations with Michelangelo Antonioni and Woody Allen.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: When the Italian cinematographer Carlo Di Palma started out, he was a 15-year-old camera assistant on “Ossessione,” the 1943 Luchino Visconti movie that is widely considered the first Italian neorealist film. The new documentary “Water and Sugar: Carlo Di Palma, the Colours of Life” explores Di Palma’s long career, from that auspicious beginning to his work on “Red Desert,” “Radio Days” and some of the other best films of the 20th century.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: ‘Water and Sugar’: How Carlo Di Palma Burnished Reality on Film

2017-07-27.abstract: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2017-07-27.snippet: Previews, openings and some last-chance picks.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages — and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.
2017-07-27.headline_main: What’s New in NYC Theater

2017-07-27.abstract: This streaming series, inspired by the F. Scott Fitzgerald novel, stars Matt Bomer, Kelsey Grammer and Lily Collins.
2017-07-27.snippet: This streaming series, inspired by the F. Scott Fitzgerald novel, stars Matt Bomer, Kelsey Grammer and Lily Collins.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: “The Last Tycoon,” Amazon’s new series inspired by the F. Scott Fitzgerald novel, is certainly meticulous — the period costumes, the hairdos, the historical references. Yet attention to detail doesn’t buy passion, either in romance or in recreating the tumult of the 1930s. The show, which becomes available to stream on Friday, looks great, as do the people in it, but caring about any of them doesn’t come easily.
2017-07-27.headline_main: Review: Amazon’s ‘Last Tycoon’ Is Slick but Short on Passion

2017-07-27.abstract: There were 136 confirmed cases of whooping cough in the state in the first half of 2017, compared with 66 in the first half of 2016, but an expert was not alarmed.
2017-07-27.snippet: There were 136 confirmed cases of whooping cough in the state in the first half of 2017, compared with 66 in the first half of 2016, but an expert was not alarmed.

2017-07-27.headline_main: Whooping Cough Cases Double in Indiana in a Year, Prompting a Call to Vaccinate

2017-07-27.abstract: Nneka Ibeabuchi, the creative director of the “Beads and Braids” photo series, demonstrates how to create a summer hairstyle that she discovered in Ghana.
2017-07-27.snippet: Nneka Ibeabuchi, the creative director of the “Beads and Braids” photo series, demonstrates how to create a summer hairstyle that she discovered in Ghana.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Nneka Ibeabuchi, a creative director and hair stylist originally from Nigeria, came up with the concept on her Instagram page for the “Beads and Braids” photo project when she took a trip to Ghana in December. “I fell in love with Ghana’s culture and wanted to come back and tell everybody how my trip was,” she said.
2017-07-27.headline_main: A Trendy Way to Protect Your Hair From Heat Damage

2017-07-27.abstract: Suggested reading from editors and critics at The New York Times.
2017-07-27.snippet: Suggested reading from editors and critics at The New York Times.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Two new books about Syria go beyond the headlines, bearing witness to the lives of citizens whose world has been shattered by six years of war. Roxane Gay’s memoir reaches into the depths of trauma, memory and desire. A biography of Henry David Thoreau brings the 19th-century environmentalist into timely focus. And a thriller set at the zoo will set your pulse racing, as a mother draws on every survival instinct she has to keep her son safe from gunmen. All these, and more, in this week’s recommended books.
2017-07-27.headline_main: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week

2017-07-27.abstract: The workplace is evolving, as is our relationship to it. These three novels explore how work interacts with our personal lives.
2017-07-27.snippet: The workplace is evolving, as is our relationship to it. These three novels explore how work interacts with our personal lives.
2017-07-27.lead_paragraph: Work, and our relationship to it, is evolving. On Thursday, Google.org, the tech giant’s philanthropic arm, announced a $50 million initiative to support organizations preparing people for the changing job market. Employee priorities are shifting, and companies, particularly in the tech world, are responding by offering enhanced benefits, more flex time (like summer hours) and other in-office perks. In the three novels below, the characters’ time at the office interacts with their personal lives in various ways — in one case the former threatens to completely engulf the latter.
2017-07-27.headline_main: 3 Books That Delve Into What Work Means to Us

Here are some of our favorites.

2017-07-28.abstract: The world-renowned chef Claus Meyer is behind a new culinary center in Brownsville meant to serve the poor — and Williamsburg is not invited.
2017-07-28.snippet: The world-renowned chef Claus Meyer is behind a new culinary center in Brownsville meant to serve the poor — and Williamsburg is not invited.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, Lucas Denton was shopping at the Scratchbread Bakery in Bedford-Stuyvesant when he noticed a large man, seemingly unfamiliar with that part of Brooklyn, gesticulating and speaking loudly on the sidewalk in what Mr. Denton described as “an Elven language.” His impulse was to welcome him to the neighborhood, he recounted recently, “and maybe calm him down a touch.” Mr. Denton, then in his late 20s, had developed an appreciation for fashion but food culture remained alien to him; so it signified nothing when the man said that his name was Claus Meyer.
2017-07-28.headline_main: Brooklyn’s Anti-Gentrification Restaurant

2017-07-28.abstract: After a 94-loss debacle, an A.L. East team rediscovers its resourceful side as it tries to return to the postseason.
2017-07-28.snippet: After a 94-loss debacle, an A.L. East team rediscovers its resourceful side as it tries to return to the postseason.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: The history of Tampa Bay’s major league baseball team divides neatly in half — 10 seasons as the stumbling and hopeless Devil Rays, 10 more as the clever and resourceful Rays. Last season’s 94-loss debacle did not fit with the revival, but the Rays earned their last-place finish in the American League East and the skepticism that followed them to spring training.

2017-07-28.abstract: In an Ultimate Fighting Championship rematch, Cormier faces his archrival, believing that a life of hard work, and pain, will pay off in glory.
2017-07-28.snippet: In an Ultimate Fighting Championship rematch, Cormier faces his archrival, believing that a life of hard work, and pain, will pay off in glory.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: GILROY, Calif. — Daniel Cormier, the Ultimate Fighting Championship light-heavyweight champion, is built stocky, like a gallon jug of milk. He’s always been built a little like a gallon jug of milk. A shade under 6 feet tall, with a receding hairline, a round belly, white streaks encroaching on his dark beard and a wide, toothy grin as he steps around unopened wedding gifts in his man cave — it’s hard to imagine that this 38-year-old father of two young children is one of the best in the history of mixed martial arts, and is preparing for the pinnacle of a lifetime in combat.
2017-07-28.headline_main: Daniel Cormier Is a U.F.C. Champion. But He Must Beat Jon Jones to Feel Like One.

2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When’s the last time it felt as if an entire theater were about to levitate? That experience — electrifying and giddy and guaranteed to tap into every playgoer’s inner rock god — can be had through Aug. 22 at the capacious Coliseum, where the Jim Steinman musical “Bat Out of Hell” is all but blasting an adoring audience out of their seats. Count me among the adorers.
2017-07-28.headline_main: A London Musical With Energy to Burn, and Two Without It

2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: BOULDER, Colo. — Behind a locked door on the ground floor of a new University of Colorado science center here, a laboratory outfitted with specially reinforced concrete floors sits dark and empty, like a dining room set for a guest who never arrived. In this case, the no-show is a $2 million, 12-ton machine that is vital to addressing global warming.

2017-07-28.abstract: The question of whether the swastika could have flown over the Thames is much more than Hollywood fiction.
2017-07-28.snippet: The question of whether the swastika could have flown over the Thames is much more than Hollywood fiction.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: For more than a thousand years, the tribes of Europe have stared into the gun-metal-gray chop of the English Channel and thought of conquest. “We have six centuries of insults to avenge,” said Napoleon. I was just there, on the same spring week when the great bedraggled scraps of the French and British armies were cornered for slaughter by the Nazi war machine 77 years ago.
2017-07-28.headline_main: What if Hitler Had Invaded Britain?

2017-07-28.abstract: With a new book, a Republican senator protests for all to read.
2017-07-28.snippet: With a new book, a Republican senator protests for all to read.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: Do you ever get the feeling we’re all going to be judged for this moment? Historians, our grandkids and we ourselves will look and ask: What did you do as the Trump/Scaramucci/Bannon administration dropped a nuclear bomb on the basic standards of decency in public life? What did you do as the American Congress ceased to function? What positions did you take as America teetered toward national decline?
2017-07-28.headline_main: Jeff Flake Plants a Flag

2017-07-28.abstract: A proposal from the M.T.A. chairman calls for overdue maintenance, and still leaves a debate over how to pay for it all.
2017-07-28.snippet: A proposal from the M.T.A. chairman calls for overdue maintenance, and still leaves a debate over how to pay for it all.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: The save-the-subways plan announced this week by Joseph Lhota, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, contains no miracle solution. It is a list of 32 nuts-and-bolts ideas that, in the main, are almost self-evident and should have already been in place. That may be their principal strength: Instead of a eureka-like vision, Mr. Lhota has presented a multitask agenda that relies on rolling up sleeves and getting hands dirty to move the trains along.
2017-07-28.headline_main: A First Step, Finally, to Fix Subways

2017-07-28.abstract: Why is Trump hollowing out the State Department?
2017-07-28.snippet: Why is Trump hollowing out the State Department?
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On the first Friday in May, Foreign Affairs Day, the staff gathers in the flag-bedecked C Street lobby of the State Department beside the memorial plaques for the 248 members of foreign affairs agencies who have lost their lives in the line of duty. A moment of silence is observed. As president of the American Foreign Service Association, Barbara Stephenson helps organize the annual event. This year, she was set to enter a delegates’ lounge to brief Secretary of State Rex Tillerson on its choreography before appearing alongside him. Instead, she told me, she was shoved out of the room.
2017-07-28.headline_main: The Desperation of Our Diplomats

Now, scientists are setting sail to finally help solve the mystery of Zealandia, the lost undersea landmass being billed as the world’s eighth continent.

2017-07-28.abstract: Avoid seeming eager. Don’t be an oddball.
2017-07-28.snippet: Avoid seeming eager. Don’t be an oddball.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: ‘‘We are wary of people who are trying to get on a jury,’’ says Philip Anthony, chief executive of DecisionQuest, a trial consulting firm whose work includes assisting in jury selection. Many people try to shirk jury duty; signs of eagerness will arouse suspicion. Having surveyed more than 100,000 jurors after trials, Anthony’s company estimates that some 17 percent are ‘‘stealth jurors,’’ people seeking a seat to further a hidden personal agenda. Lawyers strive to ferret them out. Present yourself as willing but not enthusiastic.
2017-07-28.headline_main: How to Be Selected for a Jury

2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: Leonora Carrington kept a pet eagle, planted a tree in the center of her house and was once reportedly rescued from a mental asylum by a nanny in a submarine. She cooked her houseguests omelets that included their own hair, which she had secretly snipped off their heads while they slept the previous night. She was, in other words, a card-carrying Surrealist: spelunker of the oozy chasm between the rational and the absurd.

Other friends have gladly done so, and I have hung their specimens on my wall. My friend has refused, stating that it is gross. But back in Victorian times, it was a common mourning practice.

2017-07-28.snippet: The best dishes at Anna, which opened in 2016, encompass the shared Italian and Israeli passion for freshness and simplicity.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: One of the first things you see when you arrive at Anna, an Italian restaurant in the heart of Jerusalem, is a still life of ingredients: a basket of kohlrabi, a bowl of olives and confited garlic cloves, pots of fresh herbs arranged artfully on the pass. The tableau is a fitting tribute to the place. The restaurant is on the top floor of the 19th-century villa where the artist Anna Ticho lived and worked. When she died in 1980, she left her home to the Israel Museum. After a renovation, the chef Moshiko Gamlieli opened Anna in May 2016.
2017-07-28.headline_main: A Jerusalem Restaurant With Italian and Israeli Influences

2017-07-28.snippet: Late shows at the Greenwich Village club are known as raucous and experimental. But is the reputation deserved? Our critic stayed up to find out.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: Late-night comedy still has a mystique on Macdougal Street, where international crowds congregate every night outside the Comedy Cellar in Greenwich Village. The final shows, which go long past midnight, have a reputation for being dirtier and more raucous (a guy once threw a beer mug at Donald Trump Jr., sending him to a hospital), but the reason they have become a popular tourist destination is the possibility that Louis C.K., Chris Rock or Kevin Hart might make a surprise appearance. Unpredictability is part of the draw. Five comics who can fill arenas might share the same stage, or Dave Chappelle could tell jokes until dawn.
2017-07-28.headline_main: Dropping In at the Comedy Cellar With Amy Schumer and Leslie Jones

2017-07-28.abstract: The identity politics of the president’s supporters have always been deceptively complicated — but his own have been less so.
2017-07-28.snippet: The identity politics of the president’s supporters have always been deceptively complicated — but his own have been less so.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: In December, seven months before President Trump announced his intention to ban transgender people from serving in the military, I attended one of Trump’s postelection victory rallies, in Grand Rapids, Mich., with a Trump supporter named Jayne Locke. As it happened, Locke was a transgender veteran. This was not one of those journalistic exercises in deliberate expectation-thwarting; it had happened more or less by chance. On my way to Grand Rapids, I had been canvassing Facebook looking for Trump supporters who were going to the rally, and Locke was the one who wrote me back. When she did, she was quick to note something that was not readily apparent from her Facebook page: “I’m not sure if you are aware of this or not, but I am not only a Trump supporter but also a transsexual woman Trump supporter.”
2017-07-28.headline_main: The Emptiness of Trump’s Promises of Tolerance

2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: At the University of New Hampshire in the 1970s, John Pfordresher was teaching “Wuthering Heights” when he confessed to his students that he hadn’t read “Jane Eyre.” “One of them,” Pfordresher told me, “in a voice heavy with chastisement, informed me that I’d better read Charlotte Brontë’s novel soon. 2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: FREMONT, Neb. — Summer break 1985 was defined by my 4:30 a.m. alarm. The bus rolled up at 5, and my friends and I stumbled on, fighting off sleep until we arrived at the fields. Detasseling corn was a rite of passage in this Nebraska town: In order to cross-pollinate top-notch seed corn in those days, you needed people, lots of them, to walk through the fields to pull corn tassels manually from individual rows.
2017-07-28.headline_main: What to Do With the Kids This Summer? Put ’Em to Work

2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: The opening night gala for Lincoln Center’s Mostly Mozart Festival, in its 51st year, was held at the David Geffen Hall on July 25, and honored the award-winning Amazon Original show “Mozart in the Jungle.” The Olana Summer Party took place in Hudson, N.Y., on July 22, for the art organization’s 50th anniversary. Also on July 22, the 2017 SummerScape Gala was held in Red Hook, N.Y, benefiting the Richard B. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts at Bard College. Dinner was followed by a raucous after-party staged by Susanne Bartsch.
2017-07-28.headline_main: Summer Nights

2017-07-28.snippet: Selected by Terrance Hayes.
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: The speaker of this poem might be someone as loony and lonely as Emily Dickinson. The fly in the second line has a Dickinsonian buzz. The speaker is enchanted, but I can’t quite grasp the “her” here. Who is she? Who could be spoken of this way? Don’t send mail to me explaining why it may or may not be a mother. In my not grasping it, I get to pretend “her” is a divinity or a devil or the earth or the speaker speaking of herself. Selected by Terrance Hayes
2017-07-28.headline_main: After 30 Hospitals in 2 Hours

2017-07-28.abstract: As “The Emoji Movie” hits theaters, here’s a look back at landmark works — books, video and visual art — that make use of the images.
