2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: “The Emoji Movie” is the apotheosis of Hollywood’s consumerist blockbuster trend, where the smartphone is recast as a playground, and tech companies spin their products into sparking baubles to sell to children. In the film, three emoji characters chase their dreams while sailing down Spotify streams, scaling a level of Candy Crush and ascending into the cloud through every child’s most beloved app, Dropbox.

2017-07-28.abstract: This four-part documentary series profiles five girls at a boarding school that educates the children of the Dalits, or “untouchables.”
2017-07-28.snippet: This four-part documentary series profiles five girls at a boarding school that educates the children of the Dalits, or “untouchables.”
2017-07-28.lead_paragraph: The four-part Netflix documentary “Daughters of Destiny” is a celebration of a pioneering school for the children of Dalits, members of the lowest group in the oppressive caste system that still shapes Indian society. Much of it takes place in classrooms and dormitories. But it’s at its best when it leaves the school grounds and follows the children home, into a harsh and unchanging world whose realities seem hopelessly at odds with the ideals of the school.
2017-07-28.headline_main: Review: ‘Daughters of Destiny’ on Netflix Explores Caste Struggles in India

I knew the lower 15-letter entry (MAN TO MAN DEFENSE) but not the upper one (ESSENCE MAGAZINE), so the northern part of this grid was knottier. But that’s the way the weekend goes.

2017-07-29.abstract: Real progress will require an international scientific collaboration, like the one that discovered the Higgs boson.
2017-07-29.snippet: Real progress will require an international scientific collaboration, like the one that discovered the Higgs boson.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: Artificial Intelligence is colossally hyped these days, but the dirty little secret is that it still has a long, long way to go. Sure, A.I. systems have mastered an array of games, from chess and Go to “Jeopardy” and poker, but the technology continues to struggle in the real world. Robots fall over while opening doors, prototype driverless cars frequently need human intervention, and nobody has yet designed a machine that can read reliably at the level of a sixth grader, let alone a college student. Computers that can educate themselves — a mark of true intelligence — remain a dream.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Artificial Intelligence Is Stuck. Here’s How to Move It Forward.

2017-07-29.abstract: Five girls from India’s lowest caste work to change their fates. And Charlize Theron as Furiosa might be better than her performance in “Atomic Blonde.”
2017-07-29.snippet: Five girls from India’s lowest caste work to change their fates. And Charlize Theron as Furiosa might be better than her performance in “Atomic Blonde.”
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: “Daughters of Destiny” follows five girls from India’s lowest caste who are hoping to change their fates. And “Mad Max: Fury Road” might just be even better than watching Charlize Theron in “Atomic Blonde.”
2017-07-29.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘Daughters of Destiny’ and ‘Mad Max: Fury Road’

2017-07-29.abstract: You don’t need to be a former player — or a particular gender — to analyze baseball.
2017-07-29.snippet: You don’t need to be a former player — or a particular gender — to analyze baseball.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: It was another early summer baseball game last year at Chicago’s “friendly confines,” and in my expert opinion, the Cubs center fielder Dexter Fowler was playing too shallow. The newfangled analytics backed up my conclusion, and I could also draw on my playing days: having stood in the outfield in Wrigley Field, knowing the numbers can lie to you, especially given Wrigley’s unpredictable ricochets, ivy-covered entanglements and temperamental weather extremes.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Who Gets to Call the Game?

Now one cruise company is making a fuller proposal by launching the first millennial-targeted cruise line.

2017-07-29.abstract: “Walking around Tijuana, I noticed three main ideas — music, tradition and family — and those themes influenced the photographs I took,” Jake Michaels said.
2017-07-29.snippet: “Walking around Tijuana, I noticed three main ideas — music, tradition and family — and those themes influenced the photographs I took,” Jake Michaels said.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: In May and June, Jake Michaels was in Tijuana, a city he has visited several times in the seven years since he first began driving down from Southern California to attend soccer matches with friends along the border. He set out to explore the themes of music, family and tradition in Mexican culture, employing the vibrantly painted buildings as backdrops.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Drag Queens, a Metal Head and a Lot of Cowboy Hats in Tijuana, Mexico

2017-07-29.abstract: Dr. Jen Gunter was already skeptical of “snake oil” products meant to improve women’s sex lives. Now she is a detractor of the movie star’s website.
2017-07-29.snippet: Dr. Jen Gunter was already skeptical of “snake oil” products meant to improve women’s sex lives. Now she is a detractor of the movie star’s website.

2017-07-29.headline_main: A Doctor Gives Gwyneth Paltrow’s Goop an Examination

2017-07-29.abstract: The hair. The leg bronzer. Now at CNN, a journalist who accused Roger Ailes of harassment sets her first novel at a right-leaning cable network.
2017-07-29.snippet: The hair. The leg bronzer. Now at CNN, a journalist who accused Roger Ailes of harassment sets her first novel at a right-leaning cable network.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: Amanda Gallo, the idealistic heroine of the new novel “Amanda Wakes Up,” is a morning anchor at FAIR News, a cable news network that brands itself as “True and Equal,” goes easy on right-wing provocateurs and mandates miniskirts and leg bronzer for its blond female hosts.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Alisyn Camerota, Formerly of Fox News, Has a Story to Tell

2017-07-29.abstract: A growing number of entrepreneurs are turning their lives into do-it-yourself reality shows, hiring videographers to document their every move.
2017-07-29.snippet: A growing number of entrepreneurs are turning their lives into do-it-yourself reality shows, hiring videographers to document their every move.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: This spring, John Henry, a 24-year-old entrepreneur and the founder of a Harlem-based nonprofit, had a very strange first date. The woman he had taken to a SoHo restaurant seemed to know a suspicious amount about the places he’d been in recent weeks and the conversations he’d had. This, Mr. Henry slowly realized, was a byproduct of his recent decision to have a videographer film large swaths of his daily life: his work, travels, lunches and even subway commutes, which Mr. Henry had then posted on Facebook and Instagram.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Keeping Up, on Camera, Is No Longer Just for the Kardashians

2017-07-29.abstract: A Martha’s Vineyard retreat helped the writer Jenny Allen heal from the breakup of her marriage to the cartoonist and playwright Jules Feiffer.
2017-07-29.snippet: A Martha’s Vineyard retreat helped the writer Jenny Allen heal from the breakup of her marriage to the cartoonist and playwright Jules Feiffer.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: MARTHA’S VINEYARD, Mass. — Not long after Jenny Allen left New York City to live full-time here, her once-sturdy farmhouse had a nervous breakdown. The pump to the well gave out, the water heater flooded the furnace, the pipes froze and an ancient tree crashed through the roof. It was 2013 and Ms. Allen, the journalist, humor writer and performer, had just separated from Jules Feiffer, the cartoonist and author to whom she had been married for 30 years, when the house began behaving like a kindergartner who had toughed it out all day at school only to have a meltdown at dismissal. You could see its collapse as a proxy for Ms. Allen’s own experience. “It was like the house knew that someone was there to take care of it so it just went …” Ms. Allen paused. “It just went ‘boing’ like a house in a cartoon.”
2017-07-29.headline_main: For Jenny Allen, She and Her House ‘Were Sort of in This Together’

2017-07-29.abstract: The Sugars tackle several questions, including what to do when your best friend’s husband asks you to lie and why we sometimes recoil at very public displays of grief.
2017-07-29.snippet: The Sugars tackle several questions, including what to do when your best friend’s husband asks you to lie and why we sometimes recoil at very public displays of grief.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: In a heated moment, a mother reveals a dark chapter from her childhood to her daughter, then immediately regrets it. What now? In this week’s episode, the Sugars tackle this and several other questions, including how to handle a brother-in-law who treats your vacation as his own free childcare; what to do when your best friend’s husband asks you to lie; and why we sometimes recoil at very public displays of grief.
2017-07-29.headline_main: ‘Dear Sugars’: How to Reclaim Vacation From Entitled Relatives

2017-07-29.abstract: North Korea’s launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile has spurred the South to seek arms talks with the United States.
2017-07-29.snippet: North Korea’s launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile has spurred the South to seek arms talks with the United States.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — South Korea announced Saturday that it will soon start talks with the Trump administration about allowing Seoul to build more powerful ballistic missiles to counter the North, but current and former American officials said the move would have little effect on the most urgent problem facing Washington: North Korea’s apparent ability to strike California and beyond.
2017-07-29.headline_main: After North Korea Test, South Korea Pushes to Build Up Its Own Missiles

2017-07-29.abstract: The Hamburg authorities said the man accused of fatally stabbing one person had recently become radicalized, but they did not believe he posed an imminent danger.
2017-07-29.snippet: The Hamburg authorities said the man accused of fatally stabbing one person had recently become radicalized, but they did not believe he posed an imminent danger.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — The German police said Saturday that the 26-year-old man accused of killing one person and wounding five others with a knife in Hamburg was known to them as a recently radicalized Islamist, but that they did not believe he posed an imminent danger.

2017-07-29.abstract: Sharp rhetoric will get us nowhere. It’s time for the U.S. to abandon its longstanding “One Korea” policy.
2017-07-29.snippet: Sharp rhetoric will get us nowhere. It’s time for the U.S. to abandon its longstanding “One Korea” policy.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: With its latest provocation — a ballistic missile launch in the direction of Japan — North Korea is reminding Washington that its boast of having weapons capable of reaching the “heart of the United States” may not remain propaganda for much longer. The threat from Pyongyang should be one of President Trump’s most urgent priorities.
2017-07-29.headline_main: We Need a Radical New Approach on North Korea

2017-07-29.abstract: Aspiring opera singers moving to New York wonder if landlords allow multiple guarantors. The answer is yes.
2017-07-29.snippet: Aspiring opera singers moving to New York wonder if landlords allow multiple guarantors. The answer is yes.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: Q. My friends and I are planning to move to New York City from Ohio. We are all aspiring opera singers, so our combined income is not adequate to qualify for an apartment. We have cash saved, but do not have jobs yet, so we don’t have proof of employment. Instead, we plan to ask relatives to guarantee our lease. Do landlords accept guarantors who live outside the tristate area? If we have more than one guarantor, does each one have to earn enough to guarantee the entire lease, or will a landlord consider combined income?
2017-07-29.headline_main: Will a Landlord Accept an Out-of-State Guarantor?

2017-07-29.abstract: Claire Smith, the first woman voted into the sportswriters’ wing of the Baseball Hall of Fame, broke barriers in ways similar to her inspiration, Jackie Robinson.
2017-07-29.snippet: Claire Smith, the first woman voted into the sportswriters’ wing of the Baseball Hall of Fame, broke barriers in ways similar to her inspiration, Jackie Robinson.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: As the national baseball writer for The New York Times in the 1990s, Claire Smith became an ace at packing for two-week, six-city excursions. But preparing for the trip she will take this weekend to Cooperstown, N.Y., had her flustered.
2017-07-29.headline_main: For Female Baseball Reporter, Writing About, and Making, History

2017-07-29.abstract: A scuttled plan to move the remains of Lou Gehrig to the Baseball Hall of Fame could have turned it into the final resting place of stars who went home.
2017-07-29.snippet: A scuttled plan to move the remains of Lou Gehrig to the Baseball Hall of Fame could have turned it into the final resting place of stars who went home.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: The plaque gallery at the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown is a place of reverence for fans, who can gaze at the bronze images of 312 players, managers, umpires and executives affixed to the walls.
2017-07-29.headline_main: When Cooperstown Almost Changed From Museum to Mausoleum

2017-07-29.abstract: Fred Piscop likes forks in the road.
2017-07-29.snippet: Fred Piscop likes forks in the road.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Thanks to Fred Piscop’s dedication to the format, Split Decisions puzzles outlive their inventor, George Brederhorn. There’s not much to comment on because the splits that trip me up seem totally random. I think your brain randomly “sees” some correctly and some wrong. I have noticed that a stubborn knothole will suddenly reveal itself if you take a break from solving.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Variety: Split Decisions

2017-07-29.abstract: Former Commissioner Bud Selig and a longtime executive, John Schuerholz, will be inducted into the Hall of Fame. And other executives are poised to follow.
2017-07-29.snippet: Former Commissioner Bud Selig and a longtime executive, John Schuerholz, will be inducted into the Hall of Fame. And other executives are poised to follow.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: The Baseball Hall of Fame has held induction ceremonies in Cooperstown, N.Y., since 1939, when the first four classes were honored at once. Yet it has taken until now for two living executives to be inducted at the same time.
2017-07-29.headline_main: 2 From Baseball’s Front Offices, Not Its Fields, Get a Cooperstown Moment

2017-07-29.abstract: Where his older brother, Nawaz Sharif, has been criticized for a low-energy style in power, Shehbaz Sharif has nurtured a nearly opposite reputation.
2017-07-29.snippet: Where his older brother, Nawaz Sharif, has been criticized for a low-energy style in power, Shehbaz Sharif has nurtured a nearly opposite reputation.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — With his term as Pakistan’s prime minister cut short, and with his governing party facing critical national elections in less than a year, Nawaz Sharif announced publicly on Saturday that he was choosing his younger brother, Shehbaz Sharif, to be his long-term replacement as prime minister and as the party’s standard bearer.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Ousted Pakistan Leader Passes Baton to Brother, Shehbaz Sharif

2017-07-29.abstract: A program that offers internships to seven aspiring automotive engineering students each year has helped Renault compete against Formula One’s elite teams for engineering talent.
2017-07-29.snippet: A program that offers internships to seven aspiring automotive engineering students each year has helped Renault compete against Formula One’s elite teams for engineering talent.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: SILVERSTONE, England — In a Formula One season dominated by Ferrari and Mercedes, Renault Sport Racing is trying to make the leap from the ranks of the also-rans with unorthodox partnerships, new thinking in hiring and gambles on new technology.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Renault Sport Gives Its Engineering Interns a Head Start

2017-07-29.abstract: President Trump faces hurdles after a staff shake-up and rising defiance by his own party.
2017-07-29.snippet: President Trump faces hurdles after a staff shake-up and rising defiance by his own party.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump enters a new phase of his presidency on Monday with a new chief of staff but an old set of challenges as he seeks to get back on course after enduring one of the worst weeks that any modern occupant of the Oval Office has experienced in his inaugural year in power.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Trump Tries to Regroup as the West Wing Battles Itself

2017-07-29.abstract: Senator Chuck Schumer of New York has nurtured the unity of a disparate party coalition, even as he has promised to try to work with Republicans.
2017-07-29.snippet: Senator Chuck Schumer of New York has nurtured the unity of a disparate party coalition, even as he has promised to try to work with Republicans.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over the past week, as Senate Republicans feverishly cobbled together their doomed health care bill, Chuck Schumer, the Democratic leader, made several quiet visits to the private “hideaway” office of John McCain, Republican of Arizona, near the Senate chamber on the Capitol’s first floor. Senator McCain, who recently received a brain cancer diagnosis, was nervous about the bill, which he thought would harm people in his state, and elegiac about members of his storied family, reminiscing about them at some length.
2017-07-29.headline_main: How Schumer Held Democrats Together Through a Health Care Maelstrom

2017-07-29.abstract: Republicans are pushing wasteful and dangerous plans to expand the numbers and capabilities of our arsenal.
2017-07-29.snippet: Republicans are pushing wasteful and dangerous plans to expand the numbers and capabilities of our arsenal.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: A quarter-century after the end of the Cold War, the United States and Russia still possess thousands of nuclear weapons. Even so, some administration officials and members of Congress are pushing wasteful and dangerous plans to expand the numbers and capabilities of those weapons, threatening a web of arms control agreements that have ensured the stability of Russian and American arsenals that contain fully 90 percent of the world’s 15,000 nuclear weapons.
2017-07-29.headline_main: A Threat to Nuclear Arms Control

2017-07-29.abstract: A Republican Party that can rule but cannot govern.
2017-07-29.snippet: A Republican Party that can rule but cannot govern.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: When we think about the ebb and flow of majorities in American politics, we like to imagine that there is a clear link between politics and policy – between gaining power and having an agenda to implement, between winning votes and responding to substantive challenges, between F.D.R’s majorities and his New Deal or Reagan’s victories and his Reaganomics.
2017-07-29.headline_main: The Empty Majority

2017-07-29.snippet: The faintest of praise.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: Yes, it’s true that Hillary Clinton got more votes, but he got the votes of more than 62 million people — and I am pretty sure I don’t know any of them. You can make a rude joke about Donald Trump in places like Washington and the Upper West Side of Manhattan, and be confident that nothing you say will give offense.
2017-07-29.headline_main: We Asked People to Say Something Nice About Trump. Here’s What We Heard.

2017-07-29.abstract: Let’s hope that Senator McCain’s words, rather than Mr. Scaramucci’s expletives, echo in Americans’ ears in the days to come.
2017-07-29.snippet: Let’s hope that Senator McCain’s words, rather than Mr. Scaramucci’s expletives, echo in Americans’ ears in the days to come.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: Anthony Scaramucci, the new White House communications director, likes to talk about the sense of responsibility and privilege he feels in his role near the apex of American public life. “I’m here to serve the country,” he declared at one particularly laughable moment during his pornographic rant last week to The New Yorker, in which he assaulted his own colleagues, threatening to fire some of them and unleash the F.B.I. on others.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Mr. McCain and The Mooch

2017-07-29.abstract: I used to watch her walking around in her underwear. And then we finally met.
2017-07-29.snippet: I used to watch her walking around in her underwear. And then we finally met.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: VALERIE MONROE They have floor-to-ceiling windows, my neighbors across the street, and they seldom use their shades. My apartment is a couple of floors up and a wide street away. Not so wide that I can’t see many of the details inside their home. Several years ago, I watched them move in: a petite blond woman about my age and her husband.
2017-07-29.headline_main: From Voyeur to Friend

2017-07-29.abstract: New tools can help doctors understand their patients.
2017-07-29.snippet: New tools can help doctors understand their patients.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: The device slipped over my arm like a blood pressure cuff. Eight domino-size electrodes were pressed against my skin. I heard a series of beeps and felt a small electrical pulse, like a pinprick. Then, before I knew it, my arm was quivering like a bowl of gelatin.
2017-07-29.headline_main: Empathy Gadgets

2017-07-29.abstract: Two men were arrested in connection with two attacks on a 14-year-old in Birmingham, but one was released after being questioned, the police said.
2017-07-29.snippet: Two men were arrested in connection with two attacks on a 14-year-old in Birmingham, but one was released after being questioned, the police said.
2017-07-29.lead_paragraph: One man was charged and the police were looking for a second suspect after a 14-year-old girl in Birmingham, England, reported that she had been raped in two separate attacks on the same night, the British Transport Police said on Sunday.

2017-07-29.snippet: A study has found overwhelming evidence that a brain disease is linked to football playing. So how will the N.F.L. take care of its players?

2017-07-30.snippet: Today, make a show-stopper, like a chicken wrapped in pie crust, and embrace simplicity for the rest of the week.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: Good morning. You know what would be a cool thing to make today? This chicken wrapped in an all-butter pie crust situation that Julia Moskin picked up from the Boston chef Barbara Lynch a few months ago. It’s not difficult! You just make and roll out a big sheet of pie dough, wrap it around a chicken you’ve stuffed with sautéed vegetables, and bake it on a sheet pan for an hour. Let it rest for a couple of hours and serve. Crisp pastry, juicy chicken, super fragrant vegetables – that’s a nice Sunday dinner, no?

2017-07-30.snippet: The deaths of 10 migrants who had traveled in a tractor-trailer to San Antonio have cast a bright light on a practice known for its danger.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — In one truck, the migrants crouched in the dark in a three-foot crevice between the trailer’s ceiling and the top of medical-supply boxes. In another, smugglers crammed 73 men, women and children into a trailer filled with rotting watermelons, to try to disguise their scent for Border Patrol dogs.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Big Rigs, a Human Smuggling Mainstay, Often Become Rolling Traps

2017-07-30.snippet: Mr. Grotjahn has managed to take control of his relationships with collectors and galleries and gain a rare level of influence over his work’s monetary value.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: Sitting in his expansive studio in the Echo Park section of Los Angeles last year, the abstract painter Mark Grotjahn refused to answer questions about the way he does business. More recently, he declined several requests to discuss his success — namely the auction high of $16.8 million set this spring at Christie’s (more than double Mr. Grotjahn’s top price to date, $6.9 million in 2010).
2017-07-30.headline_main: When an Artist Calls the Shots: Mark Grotjahn’s Soaring Prices

2017-07-30.snippet: ArtCenter/South Florida, a Miami Beach nonprofit, has hired the museum board member and collector Dennis Scholl as its president and chief executive.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: Call it an art world Cinderella moment. ArtCenter/South Florida, a scrappy nonprofit in Miami Beach, has long been overshadowed by the area’s newer cultural arrivals; its founding mission of providing affordable artist studios is nowhere near as fancy as starting a museum or partying at the annual Art Basel Miami Beach fair.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Miami Arts Center’s Windfall Brings a New Leader and Expansion Plans

2017-07-30.abstract: A construction mishap severed a transmission line that brings electricity to Hatteras and Ocracoke, N.C., prompting officials to order evacuations.
2017-07-30.snippet: A construction mishap severed a transmission line that brings electricity to Hatteras and Ocracoke, N.C., prompting officials to order evacuations.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: Thousands of people were evacuated from Hatteras and Ocracoke Islands in North Carolina’s Outer Banks after a construction mishap damaged the area’s main power line, plunging the islands into darkness and shutting off air-conditioners.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Thousands Evacuate Outer Banks After Power Outage

2017-07-30.abstract: A panned animated film scored at the box office while “Atomic Blonde” sputtered, a reminder of the disconnect between critics and the masses.
2017-07-30.snippet: A panned animated film scored at the box office while “Atomic Blonde” sputtered, a reminder of the disconnect between critics and the masses.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The disconnect between Hollywood’s taste and that of the masses has rarely been more sharply drawn as it was over the weekend, as the stylish “Atomic Blonde” sputtered and “The Emoji Movie” pushed past horrified critics to become a box office success.
2017-07-30.headline_main: ‘The Emoji Movie’ Starts Strong as ‘Dunkirk’ Stays at No. 1

2017-07-30.abstract: Guess who invented Obamacare?
2017-07-30.snippet: Guess who invented Obamacare?
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: Every once in a while people make the point that much of what eventually became Obamacare came from, of all places, the Heritage Foundation – that is, the ACA is basically what conservatives used to advocate on health care. So I recently reread Stuart Butler’s 1989 Heritage Foundation lecture, “Assuring Affordable Health Care For All Americans” – hmm, where have I seen similar language? — to see how true that is; and the answer is, it really is pretty much true.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Heritage On Health, 1989

2017-07-30.abstract: A military court upheld the soldier’s manslaughter conviction in the killing of a Palestinian assailant as he lay wounded on the ground.
2017-07-30.snippet: A military court upheld the soldier’s manslaughter conviction in the killing of a Palestinian assailant as he lay wounded on the ground.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — When an Israeli soldier fired a single shot through the window of a home in a West Bank settlement this month, wounding a Palestinian assailant and putting an end to a stabbing rampage that killed three people, many Israelis hailed the soldier as a hero.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Israel Court Rejects Appeal for Elor Azaria, Soldier Who Shot Wounded Assailant

2017-07-30.abstract: In columns and books and on TV, Dr. Jones’s clever fictional creation, Daedalus, tweaked laymen and scientists alike.
2017-07-30.snippet: In columns and books and on TV, Dr. Jones’s clever fictional creation, Daedalus, tweaked laymen and scientists alike.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: In Greek mythology, Daedalus was a cunning craftsman who occasionally outsmarted himself. The labyrinth he designed to contain the bovine Minotaur was so disorienting that even Daedalus got lost. He fashioned waxed wings that enabled him and his son, Icarus, to flee Crete, but Icarus drowned when the wax melted as he defiantly overreached and soared too close to the blazing sun.
2017-07-30.headline_main: David E.H. Jones, Scientist Whose Alter Ego Challenged Conventions, Dies at 79

2017-07-30.abstract: At the New York Musical Festival, a love story plays out in a divided Berlin, and women entangled in suburban soccer-mom life become the center of another drama.
2017-07-30.snippet: At the New York Musical Festival, a love story plays out in a divided Berlin, and women entangled in suburban soccer-mom life become the center of another drama.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: A few minutes into “A Wall Apart,” during the propulsive opening number, I noticed something that hadn’t happened at either of the other shows I saw over the weekend at the New York Musical Festival: My leg was moving in time to the beat.
2017-07-30.headline_main: The Cold War Meets ‘Romeo and Juliet’ at a Festival for Musicals

2017-07-30.abstract: China and India have come close to the brink of conflict over 34 square miles of land.
2017-07-30.snippet: China and India have come close to the brink of conflict over 34 square miles of land.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: China and India, two nuclear-armed nations, have come near the brink of conflict over a contested region in the Himalayas at the point where Bhutan, China and India meet. The standoff began in June after Chinese troops began working to extend a road through the Dolam Plateau. It is one of the worst border disputes between the countries in more than 30 years.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Heng on China and India’s Dolam Standoff

2017-07-30.abstract: On a day of civil unrest, many Venezuelans didn’t vote and nations across the region rejected the predetermined result of President Nicolás Maduro’s effort to rewrite the Constitution.
2017-07-30.snippet: On a day of civil unrest, many Venezuelans didn’t vote and nations across the region rejected the predetermined result of President Nicolás Maduro’s effort to rewrite the Constitution.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — The legitimacy of Sunday’s election to overhaul Venezuela’s Constitution was under threat as many voters avoided the ballot box, nations across the region rejected the predetermined result and the streets erupted in the deadliest day of unrest in three months.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Venezuela Vote Marred by Violence, Including Candidate’s Death

2017-07-30.abstract: In just his second concert in the United States in three years, Mr. Ocean seemed determined to hold the Panorama festival crowd’s attention in the most quiet way possible.
2017-07-30.snippet: In just his second concert in the United States in three years, Mr. Ocean seemed determined to hold the Panorama festival crowd’s attention in the most quiet way possible.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: There were times Friday night when Frank Ocean was on stage kneeling or squatting, meaning that to the overwhelming majority of the many thousands of fans watching him on the grass on Randalls Island, he became a speck, if that. During these stretches, though, on the huge screen behind him, he was often shown in full, his hunched figure taking up almost the whole view — a man in contemplative pose, a man curling into himself for protection, a man trapped in a box.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Review: Frank Ocean Transmits Intimacy on a Grand Scale

2017-07-30.abstract: This latest example of sun-streaked conflict and misty boredom takes place in and around an affluent island community just southwest of Sarasota, Fla.
2017-07-30.snippet: This latest example of sun-streaked conflict and misty boredom takes place in and around an affluent island community just southwest of Sarasota, Fla.
2017-07-30.lead_paragraph: The shift from “Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County” to “The Hills” was the most portentous of the reality-show era. What began in 2004 as a sun-kissed, sometimes-bumbling lark finished in 2010 as a neo-romantic, industrial-smooth juggernaut. Teenagers who predated the constant self-broadcasting of the social-media era rapidly became television stars, doing their best to play the roles of teenagers who did not know they were being filmed. The genre had gone sentient. It would never look back.
2017-07-30.headline_main: Review: ‘Siesta Key’ Returns to Reality Television’s Awkward Youth

Martin Luther King Jr.: “So the question is not whether we will be extremists, but what kind of extremists we will be.”

Under different circumstances, this might have been alarming. Moustakas is approaching free agency, and his breakout season — including 30 home runs so far — will most likely price him out of the Royals’ range.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y. — Over the weekend here, it was as if the 1994 baseball season had never ended abruptly with a players’ strike that began Aug. 12, when the Montreal Expos owned the best record in the game. Or as if a new, privately financed stadium had magically been built in Montreal, allowing the Expos to remain in Canada instead of relocating to Washington after the 2004 season and becoming the Nationals.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Tina Howe’s “Singing Beach,” produced by Theater 167 at Here, needs a lifeguard. While it returns to themes and situations she has movingly explored in other works, this sometimes absurdist play about a family in crisis splashes and thrashes under Ari Laura Kreith’s direction. It goes under almost from the get-go.

Boarded-up shops faced the lots on one side, and public housing on two others. High-rise apartments and office towers in downtown Miami, markers of the city’s rapid resurgence, glistened not far off.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Up an alley, beyond some hoarding, through what can feel like Harry Potter’s secret portal, the underworld of an unfinished Crossrail station sprawls beneath the traffic and commotion of Tottenham Court Road. Escalator banks descend through a sleek, silent black ticket hall where towering, empty, white-tiled passageways snake toward the new, vaulted train platform, curving like a half moon into the subterranean darkness.
2017-07-31.headline_main: London’s New Subway Symbolized the Future. Then Came Brexit.

2017-07-31.abstract: This week’s episode gave us our first glimpse of a character we’d been waiting to see.
2017-07-31.snippet: This week’s episode gave us our first glimpse of a character we’d been waiting to see.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Because “Twin Peaks” doesn’t take place in the “real world” per se, it’s been fascinating in this revival to see just what aspects of modern life David Lynch and Mark Frost see fit to include in their story. I’ve already mentioned the unusually futuristic computers in the otherwise retro Twin Peaks police station; but throughout the series so far there’ve been more conventional signs that it’s taking place in the 2010s. The Double R Diner now touts its “RR2GO” service, for example; and at the Great Northern, Ben Horne is taken aback when he receives Agent Cooper’s old room key in the mail, because the hotel hasn’t used metal keys in years.
2017-07-31.headline_main: ‘Twin Peaks’ Season 3, Episode 12: Hornes Aplenty

2017-07-31.abstract: What’s lost when an education becomes a transaction.
2017-07-31.snippet: What’s lost when an education becomes a transaction.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: We conventionally think of college as a place where you can discover new ideas, indulge curiosities and learn for the sake of learning. As tuition skyrockets and becomes less accessible for everyone, however, students have been compelled to think of college from a business perspective instead. In the 2010s, much of the discussion surrounding higher education is less about education and more about its suitability as an investment, like real estate or publicly traded stock.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Why We Shouldn’t Think About College as a Business

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: LONDON — HSBC said on Monday it would buy back as much as an additional $2 billion in shares as it reported better-than-expected earnings in the second quarter.
2017-07-31.headline_main: HSBC to Buy Back Up to $2 Billion in Shares

2017-07-31.abstract: France, Norway and India have already said they want to eliminate gas and diesel vehicles.
2017-07-31.snippet: France, Norway and India have already said they want to eliminate gas and diesel vehicles.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The drive to switch to electric cars went a mile further last Wednesday when Britain joined France in pledging to end the sale of new gas and diesel cars by 2040. Norway and India have also said they want to get rid of gas and diesel cars, and at least 10 other countries have set targets for electric cars. All that is good news for the planet and for human health, even if caveats and challenges abound.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Britain Joins the Shift to Electric Cars

2017-07-31.abstract: Four decades of intellectual and moral deterioration.
2017-07-31.snippet: Four decades of intellectual and moral deterioration.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: When the tweeter-in-chief castigated Senate Republicans as “total quitters” for failing to repeal the Affordable Care Act, he couldn’t have been more wrong. In fact, they showed zombie-like relentlessness in their determination to take health care away from millions of Americans, shambling forward despite devastating analyses by the Congressional Budget Office, denunciations of their plans by every major medical group, and overwhelming public disapproval.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Who Ate Republicans’ Brains?

2017-07-31.abstract: The White House is a jungle of wild accusations, out-of-control egos and slithering strivers.
2017-07-31.snippet: The White House is a jungle of wild accusations, out-of-control egos and slithering strivers.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump’s foul-mouthed, preening, narcissistic flack, Anthony Scaramucci, made a string of jaw-dropping statements last week — including accusing chief strategist Steve Bannon of using the president for rapacious self-aggrandizement, comparing this impulse in Bannon to autofellatio — but perhaps none were more telling and important than this statement on White House leaks Scaramucci made last week on CNN:
2017-07-31.headline_main: Satan in a Sunday Hat

2017-07-31.abstract: He was always an outsider. But now he’s cut all ties to the establishment.
2017-07-31.snippet: He was always an outsider. But now he’s cut all ties to the establishment.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: In Donald Trump’s White House, Reince Priebus and Sean Spicer were more than chief of staff and press secretary. They were the president’s connection to the Washington establishment: the donors, flacks and apparatchiks of both parties whose influence over politics and the economy many Trump supporters wish to upend.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Trump Goes Rogue

2017-07-31.abstract: Each insensitivity and assault on etiquette has logistical consequences that delay trains.
2017-07-31.snippet: Each insensitivity and assault on etiquette has logistical consequences that delay trains.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: A smoky trash fire this month on a stretch of subway tracks in Harlem trapped hundreds of passengers on stalled trains and created a torrent of rush-hour delays across much of the underground system. It did another thing as well: It showed that, sometimes, New York riders are their own worst enemies.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Try Showing Your Subway a Little Love

2017-07-31.abstract: Eliminating a corrupt leader is a good sign for the rule of law, but none has ever finished a term in office there.
2017-07-31.snippet: Eliminating a corrupt leader is a good sign for the rule of law, but none has ever finished a term in office there.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: For those hoping for signs of a deepening of democracy in Pakistan, the ouster of Nawaz Sharif provides no help. On the surface, the decision of the Pakistani Supreme Court to disqualify Mr. Sharif and his family from holding office over allegations of corruption seems a triumph for the rule of law, but the way it was done smacks too much of political infighting to celebrate, and the ensuing confusion is in no one’s interest. Nor is there much to cheer about for the future of Pakistan’s troubled relations with the United States and India.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Pakistan’s Prime Minister Falls, Again

2017-07-31.abstract: He was a Jewish Communist on the right side of World War II. But was he on the wrong side of history?
2017-07-31.snippet: He was a Jewish Communist on the right side of World War II. But was he on the wrong side of history?
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: In my family, we’ve lived without God for a hundred years. It’s had its ups and downs.
2017-07-31.headline_main: My Grandfather, the Secret Policeman

2017-07-31.abstract: Big countries like Russia don’t have a monopoly on misinformation anymore. Expect things to get messy.
2017-07-31.snippet: Big countries like Russia don’t have a monopoly on misinformation anymore. Expect things to get messy.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Reports this month that the United Arab Emirates orchestrated the hacking of a Qatari news agency, helping to incite a crisis in the Middle East, are as unsurprising as they are unwelcome. For years, countries — in particular Russia — have used cyberattacks and the dissemination of disinformation through social media and news outlets to provoke protests, sway elections and undermine trust in institutions. It was only a matter of time before smaller states tried their hand at these tactics.
2017-07-31.headline_main: The Hacking Wars Are Going to Get Much Worse

2017-07-31.abstract: The roots of the phrase lie not in libertarian economics but in Confederate rebellion.
2017-07-31.snippet: The roots of the phrase lie not in libertarian economics but in Confederate rebellion.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. — When President Trump recently proposed his budget for “school choice,” which would cut more than $9 billion in overall education spending but put more resources into charter schools and voucher programs, he promised to take a sledgehammer to what he has called “failing government schools.” That is harsh language for the places most of us call public schools, and where nearly 90 percent of American children get their education. But in certain conservative circles, the phrase “government schools” has become as ubiquitous as it is contemptuous.
2017-07-31.headline_main: What the ‘Government Schools’ Critics Really Mean

2017-07-31.abstract: But you do. And you should.
2017-07-31.snippet: But you do. And you should.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Keys in hand, I took a deep breath. I flipped the ignition and the memories of my Papa rushed back, just as the familiar rumble of his Thunderbird kicked in.
2017-07-31.headline_main: The Universe Doesn’t Care About Your ‘Purpose’

2017-07-31.abstract: Women Photograph, a new organization dedicated to helping female visual journalists address obstacles in photojournalism, has announced the recipients of its first grants to support personal projects.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The first Women Photograph grants to support personal projects by female visual journalists have been presented to Alex Potter, Lujan Agusti, Gabriella Demczuk and Néha Hirve. Women Photograph, a new organization, aims to help women gain opportunities in an industry that has historically been dominated by white men and has been rife with sexism.
2017-07-31.headline_main: No Longer Seeing the World Through Men’s Eyes

2017-07-31.abstract: News that the White House communications director and his wife were breaking up kept intrigue swirling.
2017-07-31.snippet: News that the White House communications director and his wife were breaking up kept intrigue swirling.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Anthony Scaramucci, the White House communications director whose flair for gale-force showmanship makes his new boss look almost tame, had an explosive first week on the job — so explosive that the president removed him from the role on Monday. The news of his ouster, at the hands of John F. Kelly, a new chief of staff tasked with instilling order in the West Wing, followed a particularly chaotic weekend in Mr. Scaramucci’s personal life.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Divorce Report Capped Scaramucci’s First Week. There Was No Second Week.

2017-07-31.snippet: The most outspoken member of the Supreme Court avoided talking about President Trump, a subject that caused her grief last year, but remained candid in discussing the court.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is the most outspoken member of the Supreme Court, sometimes to her regret. Last year, she issued a statement saying that her criticisms of Donald J. Trump during the presidential campaign had been ill advised. “In the future,” she said, “I will be more circumspect.”

2017-07-31.abstract: It’s Monday, and you probably don’t have all the time in the world: Keep it simple with David Tanis’s chilled watermelon soup, or maybe some cold sesame noodles.
2017-07-31.snippet: It’s Monday, and you probably don’t have all the time in the world: Keep it simple with David Tanis’s chilled watermelon soup, or maybe some cold sesame noodles.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Here’s what I think would be a nice thing to cook for dinner tonight, tail end of July in America in 2017: A bowl of corn chowder followed by a brick of simply grilled wild salmon and a few florets of grilled broccoli, with some caramel peach skillet pie for dessert. Simple, nourishing, super-delicious.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Reality Bites

2017-07-31.abstract: Just 36 percent of children having strong allergic reactions receive epinephrine before arriving at the emergency room, suggesting more education is needed.
2017-07-31.snippet: Just 36 percent of children having strong allergic reactions receive epinephrine before arriving at the emergency room, suggesting more education is needed.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: A severe, rapid allergic reaction calls for a dose of epinephrine as soon as possible. The medicine counteracts potentially dangerous symptoms, such as a plunge in blood pressure and closing of the airways. In extreme cases, it can mean the difference between life and death.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Caregivers Are Too Slow to Reach for EpiPens, Study Finds

2017-07-31.abstract: Calderwood, a melty Vermont mountain cheese aged in hay, is now available at Saxelby Cheesemongers.
2017-07-31.snippet: Calderwood, a melty Vermont mountain cheese aged in hay, is now available at Saxelby Cheesemongers.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Anne Saxelby, an owner of Saxelby Cheesemongers in the Essex Street Market, gets around to adding a new cheese about once a month. The latest is Calderwood, a firm but satin-textured mountain cheese from Jasper Hill Farm in Vermont. It gets its name from the Randi Albert Calderwood Cropping Center, a facility near the Vermont cheesemaker that dries bales of hay. The cheese is aged in hay, bits of which cling to its sturdy, herbal-scented rind. The interior of the cheese, a first-rate melter, has a fruity aroma and flavor with a tart aftertaste: Calderwood, $24.99 a pound, Saxelby Cheesemongers, Essex Street Market, 120 Essex Street (Delancey Street), 212-228-8204, saxelbycheese.com.
2017-07-31.headline_main: New Options for That Grilled Cheese Sandwich

2017-07-31.abstract: Mr. Jordan, the respected Swiss conductor, will take one of the most prestigious — but historically most tumultuous — podiums in the opera world.
2017-07-31.snippet: Mr. Jordan, the respected Swiss conductor, will take one of the most prestigious — but historically most tumultuous — podiums in the opera world.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: One of the most prestigious — but historically most tumultuous — posts in the opera world has been filled. The Vienna State Opera announced on Monday that its next music director would be the Swiss conductor Philippe Jordan, who will begin in fall 2020.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Philippe Jordan Will Lead the Vienna State Opera. Can He Bring Peace?

2017-07-31.abstract: Two historians will discuss J. Ranji Smile, New York’s first celebrity chef from India, at the Brooklyn Historical Society.
2017-07-31.snippet: Two historians will discuss J. Ranji Smile, New York’s first celebrity chef from India, at the Brooklyn Historical Society.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The history of Indian restaurants in New York could perhaps be traced to J. Ranji Smile, a colorful personality who arrived here from India in 1899 and cooked Indian dishes at Sherry’s restaurant. By the early 1900s, restaurants devoted to the cuisine had started opening. In a public talk, Sarah Lohman and Vivek Bald, two historians, will discuss Mr. Smile and the history of curry in American cuisine: “The Original Celebrity Chef: The King of Curry,” Aug. 10 from 7 to 8:30 p.m., $10 ($5 for members), Brooklyn Historical Society, 128 Pierrepont Street (Clinton Street), Brooklyn Heights, 718-222-4111, brooklynhistory.org.
2017-07-31.headline_main: The Origins of Indian Curry in New York

2017-07-31.abstract: The new documentary “Rumble” brings to light often overlooked contributions, starting with the guitarist who invented the power chord.
2017-07-31.snippet: The new documentary “Rumble” brings to light often overlooked contributions, starting with the guitarist who invented the power chord.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Plenty of rock ’n’ roll songs have been banned from the airwaves because of their lyrics, but “Rumble” was the first to be banned because of its very sound. Recorded by Link Wray & His Ray Men in 1958, the instrumental pioneered the use of distortion, feedback and the power chord, a mix that made stations in New York and Boston so nervous they refused to play the song for fear that it might incite violence. According to popular lore, the hit song got its name because it reminded listeners of a gang fight, or at least a musical invitation to one; in “Pulp Fiction,” it’s the tune that plays while Uma Thurman and John Travolta share a $5 milkshake and a tense silence.
2017-07-31.headline_main: An Encore for the Native Americans Who Shook Up Rock ’n’ Roll

2017-07-31.abstract: Sugar Hill Creamery on Lenox Avenue sells scoops in flavors like salted caramel crunch and soursop.
2017-07-31.snippet: Sugar Hill Creamery on Lenox Avenue sells scoops in flavors like salted caramel crunch and soursop.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Thomforde’s ice cream parlor on West 125th Street in Harlem was in business from 1903 to 1983. Chain ice cream stores filled the gap when it closed, but Nicholas Larsen, an alumnus of Telepan and Blue Hill, has opened an independent shop in the neighborhood with his wife, Petrushka Bazin Larsen. At their Sugar Hill Creamery, homemade ice creams and sorbets include vanilla, soursop and salted caramel crunch. Floats, milkshakes, sandwiches and hand-packed pints are also available: Sugar Hill Creamery, 184 Lenox Avenue (West 119th Street), 212-634-9004, sugarhillcreamery.com.
2017-07-31.headline_main: An Ice Cream Shop That Recalls Harlem’s Past

2017-07-31.abstract: Nene’s Treats ships these flavored treats nationwide.
2017-07-31.snippet: Nene’s Treats ships these flavored treats nationwide.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Susan Owens’s idea of taking the crumb cake recipe of her mother, Marie Felice, to market has turned into a business success for both women, as well as for Ms. Owens’s daughter. Ms. Felice, nicknamed Nene, began baking in Paterson, N.J., with her own mother more than 50 years ago. The family now lives in Charleston, S.C., where it produces the cakes, which freeze well. Plain, some chocolate variations and blueberry are among the flavors: Nene’s Treats, $39 to $45 per cake, 3 for $89, 6 for $149, goldbely.com; more stores on nenestreats.com.
2017-07-31.headline_main: A Formidable Crumb Cake as Only Grandma Can Make

2017-07-31.abstract: Shortstop Amed Rosario and first baseman Dominic Smith are set to make their major league debuts, as the team begins to revamp its roster for next season.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — As the Mets have sought in recent days to look beyond the disappointments of 2017 and begin to revamp their roster for next season, they have had two main goals: bolstering their bullpen and clearing a path for their two top prospects.
2017-07-31.headline_main: As Addison Reed Departs the Mets, Prospects Are on Their Way

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Couples who live together share a lot of things: beds, bathrooms, food, toiletries. But one thing they might not expect to share? Skin bacteria.

2017-07-31.abstract: Le Bon Magot sells spreads, perfect for cocktail bites, with flavors inspired by the flavors of Africa, Asia and the Middle East.
2017-07-31.snippet: Le Bon Magot sells spreads, perfect for cocktail bites, with flavors inspired by the flavors of Africa, Asia and the Middle East.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: A collection of unusual condiments inspired by the flavors of Africa, Asia and the Middle East is a versatile resource for the cook. Try cumin-scented eggplant caponata on chicken; tomato and sultana chutney in an omelet; spiced raisin or lemon-sultana marmalata with cheese or yogurt; and white pumpkin and almond murabba, a kind of preserve, over grilled fruit. Dabbed on flatbread, they make for quick cocktail nibbles: Le Bon Magot condiments, $13 for 8 ounces, lebonmagot.com.

2017-07-31.abstract: A standard method for evaluating shelter dogs’ behavior — the results often meant the difference between adoption and euthanasia — is under scrutiny.

2017-07-31.snippet: “I sleep in like three or four chains,” says the rapper, whose favorite is a diamond tennis necklace from Avianne Jewelers.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The rapper 2 Chainz (born Tauheed Epps) loves jewelry so much that he usually wears more than two chains at a time, even when he sleeps. This month and next, he’ll be traveling the country on his “Pretty Girls Like Trap Music” tour. He also hosts a GQ video series focused on his love for luxury goods.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Sam Shepard, who died last week at 73, was a true renaissance man. As a playwright, he was the toast of Broadway and a Pulitzer Prize recipient. And he had no trouble making the transition to screens small and large, winning over audiences as an actor and earning respect within the industry as a skilled pen-for-hire. His body of work, rich and varied as it is, reveals a man with infinite empathy and intellectual curiosity. Here is a small sample of his works and appearances:
2017-07-31.headline_main: Where to Stream 5 Great Sam Shepard Movies

2017-07-31.headline_main: Critics for The New York Times on Sam Shepard’s Plays, Books and Movies

2017-07-31.abstract: Mr. Wu and his business partner, Wilson Tang, plan to reopen the restaurant as Nom Wah Tu in September.
2017-07-31.snippet: Mr. Wu and his business partner, Wilson Tang, plan to reopen the restaurant as Nom Wah Tu in September.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Fung Tu, Jonathan Wu’s innovative Chinese restaurant on the Lower East Side, will close after dinner on Aug. 31. Mr. Wu and his business partner, Wilson Tang, plan to reopen the restaurant as Nom Wah Tu in September. Mr. Tang owns Nom Wah Tea Parlor in Chinatown and newer branches of Nom Wah, including Nom Wah Kuai in the Canal Street Market, in which Mr. Wu is also involved. The new restaurant will offer a revised menu incorporating dishes associated with Chinatown like dim sum and other plates for sharing, all with Mr. Wu’s creative touch. The move comes in response to customer feedback, which also led the partners to plan to lower prices and to turn the space into a more casual setting: 22 Orchard Street (Canal Street), 212-219-8785, fungtu.com.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Fung Tu, Jonathan Wu’s Innovative Chinese Restaurant, Will Close on Aug. 31

2017-07-31.abstract: “Any intrusion of this nature is obviously disruptive, unsettling and disturbing,” the network’s chief executive told employees.
2017-07-31.snippet: “Any intrusion of this nature is obviously disruptive, unsettling and disturbing,” the network’s chief executive told employees.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: HBO confirmed on Monday that the network had been the target of a cyberattack, as an anonymous hacker boasted about leaking full episodes of upcoming shows along with written material from next week’s episode of “Game of Thrones.”

2017-07-31.abstract: Adrian Beltre of the Rangers got his 3,000th hit. Several other players look likely to achieve that total.
2017-07-31.snippet: Adrian Beltre of the Rangers got his 3,000th hit. Several other players look likely to achieve that total.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Adrian Beltre of the Rangers got his 3,000th hit on Sunday, becoming the 31st player to attain one of baseball’s most hallowed marks. Ichiro Suzuki is the only other active player to get there.
2017-07-31.headline_main: 3,000 Hits: Who Else Will Get There?

2017-07-31.abstract: Oral gonorrhea is hard to detect and treat. And with drug-resistant strains of the bacteria on the rise, experts are concerned about so-called super gonorrhea.
2017-07-31.snippet: Oral gonorrhea is hard to detect and treat. And with drug-resistant strains of the bacteria on the rise, experts are concerned about so-called super gonorrhea.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The human throat houses billions of bacteria, most of them harmless. But one species is becoming more common, and it is anything but benign.
2017-07-31.headline_main: A Dangerous, ‘Silent Reservoir’ for Gonorrhea: The Throat

2017-07-31.abstract: The man’s mother called 911 for help for her son, who was acting erratically. He was shot after advancing on officers with a large knife, the police said.
2017-07-31.snippet: The man’s mother called 911 for help for her son, who was acting erratically. He was shot after advancing on officers with a large knife, the police said.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: A man whose mother called the police to report that he was acting erratically was fatally shot on Monday by one of the police officers who responded to the family’s apartment in Brooklyn, the police said.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Police Fatally Shoot ‘Emotionally Disturbed’ Man Holding Knife in Brooklyn

2017-07-31.abstract: As part of the deal with the International Olympic Committee that was announced Monday, Paris will be awarded the 2024 Olympics.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Los Angeles officials announced a deal Monday with the International Olympic Committee to play host to the 2028 Summer Olympics, giving up a bid for the 2024 Games to Paris and bringing the Olympics back to the United States for the first time since 2002.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Los Angeles Makes Deal to Host the 2028 Summer Olympics

2017-07-31.abstract: Bartman, reviled by many fans after he reached for a foul ball 14 years ago, was welcomed by the team, which sought “closure on an unfortunate chapter.”
2017-07-31.snippet: Bartman, reviled by many fans after he reached for a foul ball 14 years ago, was welcomed by the team, which sought “closure on an unfortunate chapter.”
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: On Oct. 14, 2003, a Cubs fan named Steve Bartman innocently reached up for a foul ball at Wrigley Field and initiated a cascading series of events that knocked his famously frustrated team right out of the postseason.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Chicago Cubs Give Steve Bartman a World Series Ring, Bejeweling an Infamous Hand

2017-07-31.abstract: The United Arab Emirates contends that Qatar’s hosting of a Taliban embassy is evidence of extremism. But the U.A.E. wanted to host it, too.
2017-07-31.snippet: The United Arab Emirates contends that Qatar’s hosting of a Taliban embassy is evidence of extremism. But the U.A.E. wanted to host it, too.

2017-07-31.headline_main: Persian Gulf Rivals Competed to Host Taliban, Leaked Emails Show

2017-07-31.abstract: The European Court of Justice had ordered a stop to logging in Bialowieza Forest, a Unesco World Heritage site.
2017-07-31.snippet: The European Court of Justice had ordered a stop to logging in Bialowieza Forest, a Unesco World Heritage site.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Defying an order from the European Union’s highest court, the Polish government said on Monday that it would continue logging in Bialowieza Forest, the last primeval forest in Europe and a habitat for hundreds of bison.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Defying E.U. Court, Poland Is Cutting Trees in an Ancient Forest

2017-07-31.abstract: Probably no one else was more at ease in a pair of Levi’s and a simple T-shirt than he.
2017-07-31.snippet: Probably no one else was more at ease in a pair of Levi’s and a simple T-shirt than he.

2017-07-31.abstract: How the playwright and actor kept his cool, from the days of flower power to the age of social media.
2017-07-31.snippet: How the playwright and actor kept his cool, from the days of flower power to the age of social media.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: He was, for so many, the archetypal American male given flesh and form (and a leather jacket). He was born in the heartland and worked on ranches in Duarte, Calif., where his family owned an avocado farm. He rode horses, sheared sheep, picked oranges, delivered newspapers. He had a volatile relationship with his father, a World War II fighter pilot who developed an alcohol problem, something that would later afflict the son.
2017-07-31.headline_main: When It Came to Style, Sam Shepard Was an Endangered Species

2017-07-31.abstract: The Discovery Channel, known for sometimes frivolous reality fare, hits the prestige-TV target with a mini-series about the hunt for a notorious mail bomber.
2017-07-31.snippet: The Discovery Channel, known for sometimes frivolous reality fare, hits the prestige-TV target with a mini-series about the hunt for a notorious mail bomber.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Let’s be honest: “Prestige television” and “Shark Week” are not phrases that go together naturally. Yet during its recent rather frivolous annual shark-themed programming stunt, the Discovery Channel was heavily promoting as laudable a series as TV has offered this summer: “Manhunt: Unabomber,” an eight-parter that begins on Tuesday night.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Will Shark Lovers Love ‘Unabomber’? Asking for a Cable Network.

2017-07-31.abstract: This special-occasion restaurant on the East River in Brooklyn was in many ways a pioneer, yet its understated charm and elegant owner still thrive.
2017-07-31.snippet: This special-occasion restaurant on the East River in Brooklyn was in many ways a pioneer, yet its understated charm and elegant owner still thrive.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Dining at a coveted window seat in the luminous River Café, which rests on a former coffee barge in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge, even the most jaundiced New Yorkers have to concede that the magic endures.
2017-07-31.headline_main: View From the River Café: 40 Years of Feasts and Firsts

2017-07-31.abstract: In 1919, British astronomers photographed a solar eclipse and proved that light bends around our sun — affirming Einstein’s theory of general relativity.
2017-07-31.snippet: In 1919, British astronomers photographed a solar eclipse and proved that light bends around our sun — affirming Einstein’s theory of general relativity.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: So this is what it is like to play cosmic pinball. The worlds move, and sometimes they line up. Then you find yourself staring up the tube of blackness that is the moon’s shadow, a sudden hole in the sky during a total solar eclipse.
2017-07-31.headline_main: The Eclipse That Revealed the Universe

2017-07-31.abstract: A World Bank-sponsored study found that wealthy countries Finland, Saudi Arabia and the United States and poor nations Eritrea, Pakistan and Tanzania had gone through assessments.
2017-07-31.snippet: A World Bank-sponsored study found that wealthy countries Finland, Saudi Arabia and the United States and poor nations Eritrea, Pakistan and Tanzania had gone through assessments.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Of the world’s countries, only six — three rich ones and three poor ones — have taken the steps they should have to evaluate their ability to withstand a global pandemic, according to a recent report sponsored by the World Bank.

2017-07-31.abstract: The deal bolsters the Yankees’ starting rotation as they make a determined bid to win the American League East and play deep into October.
2017-07-31.snippet: The deal bolsters the Yankees’ starting rotation as they make a determined bid to win the American League East and play deep into October.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: A year ago at this time, Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman had to persuade Hal Steinbrenner, the team’s general managing partner, to take a most un-Yankee-like approach to the trade deadline, advising him to shed well-known and highly paid players in exchange for unproven prospects.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Yankees Acquire Sonny Gray From Oakland as Trade Deadline Arrives

2017-07-31.abstract: Christopher Chege Musando, who would have played a role in counting ballots in the Aug. 8 presidential election, was found dead three days after he disappeared, officials said.
2017-07-31.snippet: Christopher Chege Musando, who would have played a role in counting ballots in the Aug. 8 presidential election, was found dead three days after he disappeared, officials said.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — A senior election official in Kenya was found dead Monday, intensifying anxiety over whether the country can hold a fair and peaceful vote next week in a tightly contested presidential election.

2017-07-31.abstract: A social media post sparks the sale of a 1969 Rolex “Paul Newman” Daytona for $175,000 within minutes.
2017-07-31.snippet: A social media post sparks the sale of a 1969 Rolex “Paul Newman” Daytona for $175,000 within minutes.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, it was a stylishly retro 1962 Bulova Super Compressor on @analogshift that won my heart. On Wednesday, it had been an elegantly understated 1970 Rolex Submariner, courtesy of @jasonheaton, that quickened the pulse. Tuesday had brought its own obsession, a vintage Heuer 3647 Carrera chronograph, regrammed on @hodinkee.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Instagram Turbocharges the Watch Market

2017-07-31.abstract: Planarian flatworms can react to light when they lose their heads and brains, and gradually regain their ability to distinguish different hues as they regenerate their bodies.
2017-07-31.snippet: Planarian flatworms can react to light when they lose their heads and brains, and gradually regain their ability to distinguish different hues as they regenerate their bodies.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The planarian flatworm is a smooshed noodle of an organism that can be found all over the planet. It has a triangular head occupied by a rather primitive version of a brain and two black dots for eyes. You can chop off this head, and it will grow back in about a week — eyes, brain and all. And you can hack away at the critter until all that’s left is a tiny speck of worm dust — and the thing will still grow back.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Chop Off This Worm’s Head and It Can Still Detect Light

2017-07-31.abstract: Prosecutors said he defied a judge’s orders to stop targeting Latinos — including citizens and legal immigrants — in a pattern of discriminatory policing.
2017-07-31.snippet: Prosecutors said he defied a judge’s orders to stop targeting Latinos — including citizens and legal immigrants — in a pattern of discriminatory policing.

2017-07-31.abstract: We don’t just need safer chemicals, we need a whole new way of doing chemistry.
2017-07-31.snippet: We don’t just need safer chemicals, we need a whole new way of doing chemistry.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Is humanity killing itself off? In a study published last week, a team of epidemiologists found that sperm counts among men in the United States, Europe and Australia have declined by more than 50 percent between 1973 and 2011. Alongside the deleterious effects of cigarette smoke, especially during critical stages of prenatal development, the authors of the study point out that exposure to certain synthetic chemicals has been associated with decreased fertility.
2017-07-31.headline_main: How to Save Your Sperm

2017-07-31.headline_main: How to Survive a Rip Current: First, Don’t Fight It

2017-07-31.abstract: Thousands of Yemenis watched as the condemned man, lying face down with hands tied behind him, was shot with an automatic weapon at point-blank range.
2017-07-31.snippet: Thousands of Yemenis watched as the condemned man, lying face down with hands tied behind him, was shot with an automatic weapon at point-blank range.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: SANA, Yemen — In a televised execution attended by thousands of Yemenis chanting approval, a man convicted of raping and killing a toddler was placed face down in a public square in Yemen’s capital on Monday and shot with an automatic weapon at point-blank range.
2017-07-31.headline_main: In TV Spectacle, Man Convicted of Child Rape-Murder Is Executed in Yemen

2017-07-31.abstract: Butterie, available in multiple colors, stores a stick of butter at room temperature so it is ready to spread.
2017-07-31.snippet: Butterie, available in multiple colors, stores a stick of butter at room temperature so it is ready to spread.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: There are a couple of arguments for storing butter at room temperature. Left in a dish on the kitchen counter, it’s ready to spread at all times, and cooks will have soft butter without waiting. Joelle Mertzel, an entrepreneur, has created Butterie, a butter dish for the countertop, with a convenient built-in flip-top lid. The company had butter left at room temperature for three weeks tested for yeast, mold, bacteria and rancidity, and it was fine: Butterie, BPA-free plastic with spreader, $12.99 Bed Bath & Beyond stores, bedbathandbeyond.com; $13.99 (more colors available online), butteriedish.com.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Don’t Refrigerate This Butter Dish

2017-07-31.snippet: The conductor Leon Botstein, a champion of overlooked works, brings Dvorak’s seldom-performed “Dimitrij” to Bard SummerScape.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The conductor Leon Botstein is driven by a compelling conviction that comes with a warning. He has argued for decades that classical music risks boring itself to death through the endless repetition of a canon of staples. Mr. Botstein tirelessly champions neglected works that were significant in their time but have slipped into obscurity.
2017-07-31.headline_main: Review: Flawed but Fascinating Dvorak Opera in a Rare Staging

2017-07-31.abstract: The actress Carice van Houten spoke about her role as the red priestess, whose latest prophecy hints at the character’s deepening sense of vulnerability.
2017-07-31.snippet: The actress Carice van Houten spoke about her role as the red priestess, whose latest prophecy hints at the character’s deepening sense of vulnerability.
2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: The last time she was on Dragonstone, the red priestess Melisandre was on a mission to convert and support Stannis in his bid for the Iron Throne. It didn’t turn out well, for him or his family. So she moved on to Plan B (or C): to bring ice and fire together, to make sure Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen joined forces. After glimpsing Jon’s arrival from afar, she shared a few cryptic words with Varys, a fellow foreign-slave-turned-royal-councilor: “I have to die in this strange country, just like you.”
2017-07-31.headline_main: Q. and A.: The Cryptic Humanity of Melisandre on ‘Game of Thrones’

2017-07-31.abstract: May, a slugging first baseman, was traded to the Astros before Cincinnati’s Big Red Machine really got rolling. The move felt like being “kicked out of the house,” he said.

2017-07-31.lead_paragraph: Lee May, a slugging first baseman with the Cincinnati Reds who was traded to the Houston Astros for Joe Morgan after the 1971 season and missed the Reds’ becoming one of baseball’s greatest teams a few years later, died on Saturday in Cincinnati. He was 74.
